Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ElaineChicago
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful Hotel and location was great. The view from our Room at night was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: AWJC
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay at the Conrad with first class service. The rooms are modern and spacious the swimming pool is large and also very warm. The Executive Lounge is first class with lovely canapes and nibbles for afternoon tea and evening cocktails. The drinks selection is also very good with good wine, beers, champagne and cocktails. Albert who worked in the Exec Lounge when we their provided fantastic service and was so helpful and friendly. The hotel is also very close th the Suntec shopping mall and other restaurants and bars. You wont be dissapointed with the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I have Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: Joywrk
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. The location was terrific for exploring the city--walking distance to the hop on , hop off bus and many restaurants etc. The service was impeccable.We stayed on the club floor which was an excellent choice. They served a terrific breakfast with lots of choice, afternoon tea and cocktails and canapes-- all wonderful. the room was spacious and comfortable as well as very appealing. It was truly an outstanding stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: danjed
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with the Conrad. It has a lovely pool, is in the middle on Singapore although set back about 5 mins walk from esplanade. Great service real attention to detail. Stay time and time again. Rooms are nice ask for a high floor and away from lifts for best view and peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Great Room”
Reviews.Author: sanipaim
Reviews.Content: We stay here for a week, Hotel located in excellent location very convenience to take subway and not fare from other landmark. Great room are clean, not too big not too small for 2 fat lady. Breakfast very nice, service good and we got Conrad Teddy Bear Doll back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Colin G
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful 6 days in Singapore and 5 nights at the Conrad Centennial. From the moment we arrived to the last second of departure it was a wonderful experience. Many hotels claim to be 5 star, but the Conrad Centennial certainly is in every respect from the quality of the accomodation, the friendliness and courtesy of all the staff to the expansive and appetising breakfast buffet. It retains a cosy and informal un-stuffy atmosphere but nevertheless transmits a feeling of staying somewhere very special with the staff being the key element in making the guests feel welcome and important. It is also ideally and centrally located for all amenities including, transport (MRT 1 min away at Promenade), sightseeing bus tours, as well as shopping and eating and drinking at three adjacent malls; Suntec, Millenia Walk and Marina Square. Don't look any further, the Conrad Centennial is top of its class and where we will staying next time we visit Singapore, no question !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great room and view - even for family of 4!”
Reviews.Author: homeATlux
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with our 4 & 1.5 yr old girls before heading to Bintan Island. The location is great - there are enough shops (middle/high ends are both ava) and restaurants (of all levels) within short walking distance (bear in mind we have 2 young children, if we can do it, anyone can!) There are pubs on one side of the hotel and lots of shops and malls via the underground walkway (the hotel staff can tell you where the hidden elevator is, apparently not far from the escalator which is not safe for the stroller!) The room is big (exec floor), nice view, staff is very friendly, the restaurant downstairs (the cantonese one) has great food....we'd stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying, well-executed five star that feels like home”
Reviews.Author: divvy_l
Reviews.Content: In a country where, overall, service can be too often unknowledegable, brusque or dismissive, this SIngapore mainstay does well to rise above a number of its competitors with an assured level of service without falling back on any other aspect of its offering. During my recent stays I have at no point been dissatisfied and I would have no question about basing myself here in the future. This well-located hotel is readily accessible from the airport without encountering traffic and is located short metres away from Marina Square and Suntec City as well as the Esplanade MRT; the Esplanade district itself is a short stroll away. Taxis are almost always on call here in contrast to some other locations around town. The public areas are sharply executed and well-staffed. This is also reflected in the rooms - floor to ceiling windows let in plenty of natural light and sharp views. There is plenty of desk space and an expansive and tastefully-outfitted bathroom with quality toiletries. The executive lounge too performs well with pretty views across Marina Bay and a high-quality execution of the Hilton breakfast buffet and afternoon buffet, with a high-tea buffet to boot. Breakfast at Oscar's is on the extensive side (an ice-cream bar at breakfast? certainly complements the made-to-order waffles nicely). However it is in service that this hotel distinguishes itself. From the courteous and helpful check-in, where real upgrades are given happily and proactively, through to the restaurant staff, the business centre staff and housekeeping, the service is not just obliging but thoughtful and comfortable. I usually ask a lot of difficult questions of hotel staff but I was never disappointed with an answer I received here. I would definitely recommend this for short and long-stay travellers as somewhere where you can genuinely feel comfortable and at home. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: viajeroManila
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference at Suntec. Since the room was booked and payed for by the organizers, I cannot comment on the pricing, but if the conference website is to be a barometer, it is one of the higher priced hotels in expensive Singapore. However, after the experience, I believe it is worth every dollar the organizers paid for. Location was very central and convenient in the middle of Suntec City, Marina Square, City Link and Raffles Place. Bus stops are just in the vicinity, MRT stations a few hundred meters away. Check in was free and easy and Kamil in the front desk gave me the guided tour of the way the room was laid out. Big Sony Bravia LCD TV with DVD player and VGA input in the room (useful reviewing my presentation). Bed was pretty comfortable, but quite high (around 4 feet from the ground!). Bathroom large, with separate bath and shower. Acca Kappa toiletries, but not to my taste. Business floor came with free internet which was spot on fast. Breakfast at Oscar's had a good selection of eastern and western fares. It was pretty full, but the staff was pretty attentive despite the volume. Got a quick workout in the gym where the equipment was ample. Checkout quick and painless. Would definitely put on the radar while in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stays”
Reviews.Author: ronan32
Reviews.Content: We had two recent stays here and were very happy with the experiences. As HHonors Diamond was upgraded both times. Enjoyed Oscar's at breakfast for the widely varied selections available. The executive lounge was one of the best we have come across in the Hilton chain with very good food and wine selections operated by an entirely professional group. Would especially like to commend one of the executive lounge staff members, Lillian, who remembered us and our drink choices by the second day and was warm and welcoming each time we encountered her.

Reviews.Title: “'Established 5 Star Hotel continues to do its thing'”
Reviews.Author: Barratt
Reviews.Content: The Conrad in Singapore is well established and offers the traveller a sound experience. It is very comfortable; rooms are well maintained and everything works. Conrad staff are attentive; well trained; and very helpful and civil. The Oscars restaurant is a delight and while we did not use it, the breakfast buffet looked wonderful. Surprisingly, check in procedures are time consuming despite accommdation being prepaid. There was a lot of paperwork and requests for form completion to set out what should have been on file from our reservation. Surprisingly, great attention was paid to taking my credit cards and then setting asisde a 'deposit' of SGD 800 for incidentals. The necessity for this escapes me if the Gold AMEX card tendered and noted is good enough to settle the account. Bit of a turn off really! Also, The Conrad has not realised that we live in the age of connectivity. Wi-fi is available but billable at daily rates that take one's breath away. Guests are left with free wi-fi in local coffee shops and the Conrad is left without the revenue the traveller might spend within the hotel should wi-fi be more reasonably available. All in all a very comfortable modern hotel that is well located with good airport access and proximity to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: HappyfeetAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for many times in the past year. I have finally decided to change hotel this year. I found the service standard dropped over years except for the house keeping staff. My first stay was back in 2006. The hotel has a nice lobby and is at a reasonably convenient in location. The room is nice and average in size. The toilet and bathroom is big. However the room design is not very user friendly. There is no power point in the bath room to connect hair dryer. I have to sit on my work desk with a small mirror when blowing my hair. When I first stayed there I had problem finding the power point which is hidden under a wooden panel in the cupboard. In the last two years, I noticed the hotel has removed the panel that covering the power point so that it is more obvious to their guests. The bed is too high. When my mom was staying with me, I need to use a stool for her to climb down from the bed which is a bit of danger for elderly person. The cafe and the chinese restuarant food are very average and certainly not value for money. It is a bit inconvienent that I have to walk out to have dinner most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st Class Hotel in the Heart of Everything”
Reviews.Author: USexpatbiztraveler
Reviews.Content: Got an amazing rate at this hotel thru Agoda. Got a King room in a higher floor. Was given a corner room with an amazing view. What a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: IgorDe
Reviews.Content: Absolutely impeccable service makes up for anything that might not fully satisfy you at this property. Expect things to be top-notch all-round, and a location to match. Shame internet was apart, and pricey too. The rooms are perhaps not that big, but we still managed to squeeze in a family of four. The problem with staying at a hotel like this is that it becomes a benchmark by which you will tend to judge other hotels, and then you're bound to get disappointed more often than not. Five-star service at its best.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: hiflya
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at this property. Being a Hilton Diamond, I was upgraded to a corner suite which had fantastic views from 2 of the rooms, a nice welcome gift with a box of sweets and a bowl full of fruit. The Executive lounge had the most extensive selection of wines available that I have seen yet at a Hilton property . I love the location near the harbor and used the best hp on hop off tour company in the city which is just across the street. You won't go wrong with this property!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended if price is not a factor.”
Reviews.Author: pfc1203
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, rooms are tastefully appointed, large bathroom with full amenities. Booked two rooms, other room though still smelled cigarette smoke.gym is fully equipt n breakfast was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, but average rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ttttssssszzzzzz
Reviews.Content: The customer service in the Conrad is excellent, but to be honest, it is the same service you would get in any 5 star rated hotel in Asia. The main issue with the Conrad is that the rooms are generally average at best. The Aircon design is awful - there are just 4 settings - off, low, medium, high. If the Aircon is off, it is too warm (it is tropical Singapore!), on the low setting, the room gets cools pretty quickly and during the night it is actually freezing as your body temp drops while asleep. There are no power sockets near the bed, and as any business traveller now needs, you have to a couple to charge your myriad of business devices. There was also a distinct paint/thinner smell in my room (although I suspect it may be a one off). On the plus side, the gym is nice and the breakfast buffet is good. A couple of minor gripes, the bathroom amenities did not include a shaver kit or a comb, very strange for a business oriented hotel not to have these basics. not really an issue as a quick call to the concierge resolved it, but it did waste 5 minutes of my time after I checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Cold rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelEverwhere
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Hilton and Conrad hotels and whilst this is not the best of the Conrads, it is very nice. There was one downside, the aircon in the room was terrible. I had it set to 30 deg C and it was still just above freezing! I had a smoking room on the exec level so the aircon was necessary as you cannot open the windows. Conrad staff, if and when you read this, please check your aircon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jan A
Reviews.Content: Simply put, one of the best hotels I have ever visited. I did not expect a business oriented hotel like Conrad Singapore would offer such a family friendly experience. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best hotel I've ever stayed in..”
Reviews.Author: Ijonesy
Reviews.Content: There will be more "modern", "glamorous" and centrally located hotels you can stay in Singapore but you won't beat The Conrad for all round customer service, amenities and the overall "experience". Proof that fantastic fixtures, fittings and location does not necessarily add up to a great hotel. My wife stayed here for 6 nights in an Executive suite and I can honestly say that this is the best hotel I've ever stayed in. And the simple reason for this is the staff - after all this is what really makes a great hotel in my view. I've stayed in many hotels throughout the world but very few of those could claim to have genuinely happy, motivated staff prepared to go the extra mile for their guests. They get the simple things right too - the Conrad feels like staying with family - all the staff without exception were welcoming, courteous, helpful and professional. From the concierge staff who helped plan our "memories" tour and who were always ready with advice; the Executive Lounge staff whose smiling welcome and service brightened every day; the chambermaid who serviced our room and kept us supplied with water, fruit and biscuits; the pool and gym staff who were always happy to chat and ask about our day - they are all an enormous credit to the hotel. I would have no hesitation in staying at the Conrad again and very much hope we can return with our children one day soon - they would love it. Well done the Conrad - keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gingko2
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel in a good position in Singapore. Oscars Restaurant is of a very high standard. The breakfast buffet is extremely varied to suit all tastes and nationalities. Service of highest standard. Rooms spacious and beds very comfortable. Pillow menu. Flowers abound everywhere in the most stylish arrangements. I am in a wheelchair and access is good. One of the elevators has a low level panel for wheelchair users.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: SDHopper
Reviews.Content: The room was not at all what I expected for the price (>300SD with our corporate discount.) The room was a bit damp and the pillow were musty/moldy. It seems old and in need of updating. There wasn't a plug anywhere near my desk and the only one in the bathroom was "shaver only" (where to plug in the hair dryer?!?) My clock was broken. The service was so-so. Check in was fine but check out (of course when I was in a hurry to go to the airport) was slow and inattentive, even though I was the only person there!! My room bill was simple...room charge only and nothing else. Yet it took forever to check out. It almost seemed like the the woman was doing something else after I handed her my room key (looking down at a book, no eye contact or a word to me, talking to the other woman.) It was only when I finally said I was leaving and to send me a bill that she paid any attention to me at all (and only then to say I needed to write down my address...my goodness, they had it from the booking and from my HHonors account!.) The housekeeping inexplicably took away my unopened bottles of water I left in the room. The location is not far from the subway but you need to know which door and how to exit the hotel. The staff is oddly not knowledgeable. I was meeting some people for drinks at the famous bar at the Raffles Hotel (probably the most famous bar in Singapore!) which is ~500m away. I had directions and a phone with GPS but just asked which door and which direction to start. The woman said she didn't know and would have to look it up!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: NERoth
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights at the Conrad Centennial Singapore this past week and the stay could not have been better. The service is impeccable. The room was extremely quiet. And the king bed could not have been better - firm and felt new. Two minor gripes: The bathroom is spacious and has both a bath and a shower but the lights are a bit dim for shaving and there are not enough outlets in the room. If you stay on the executive floor the $40 breakfast buffet in the restaurant is included (or you can eat in the lounge if you prefer). The buffet is outstanding with a wide range of alternatives - cooked to order omelets, smoked salmon, cereal, Asian breakfasts, tropical and other fruit, fresh juice bar, pastry, breads, etc. The concierge was also very helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and hope to stay again”
Reviews.Author: GlobalFoodie
Reviews.Content: Just a one night stay because of the schedule but really wished to stay a little longer. Great room and great service. Very quick staff and not pretentious. The only qualm I have is with the pricey Internet if you don't have a package with free Internet, but was able to bypass this with the great mobile Internet access of Singapore. As with all Singapore hotels, great value per buck. Hope to stay here a little longer next time I stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classic 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: panda_panda82
Reviews.Content: just stayed here for 1 night. The room size is quite small, it's even smaller than the room in Conrad Hong Kong. The receptionist told me that there was complimentary wifi access, however i could not use it at all during my stay. Since it was a very short stay and i was out most of the time. So nothing much to comment about this hotel. It's just a normal 5 star hotel with nice toilet amenities. Alws like Conrad's body lotion. One more point, there is no convenience shop nearby. Don't think i'll go back to this hotel next time unless it offers really attractive deal.

Reviews.Title: “Of all Singapore Hotels, Among my Top 3”
Reviews.Author: AlamTravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at about a dozen hotels in Singapore. I keep going back to the Conrad and feeling like it is a good choice again and again. Note I am a Diamond at the Hilton chain so I get 99% of the time access to the executive lounge, free breakfast, and free internet. That makes a major difference in terms of pricing when compared with other hotels in this city ( I'd say a 80-100 SGD advantage ... ). What I absolutely love about the Conrad: 1. The breakfast is royal. I love it. The selection is great and of high quality. I just reviewed the Sheraton and the Conrad has a much much better breakfast. 2. The gym is well equipped, by the pool, and usually was not super busy. Maybe just my luck. 3. The bed is heaven. One of the best. 4. The view from the rooms is nice but not as good as that from the Ritz Carlton as that hotel has a view directly on the bay. The hilton is obstructed by the Mandarin. 5. Service is great for Diamond members. They truly make us feel 'special'. 6. The freebies from the HHonors program are truly valuable. 7. The location: so convenient and so many places where you can eat, read, shop, etc. 2 mins from the reception. The not so good: 1. The rooms are becoming tired and not large. Ritz has bigger ones. The Fullerton bay has similar ones. Some folks may not like the TV selection but it never bothered me as I rarely if ever watch TV: only when there is a football game I need to watch at 2 AM! To reassure folks: other hotels do not fare any better in terms of channel selection. The TV at the conrad is like a 40" flat panel I think. 2. The price of non-corporate discounted rooms is on the high side: I'd go to the Fullerton Bay or Ritz if the prices are the same. My overall recommendation for SIngapore: Conrad Ritz Carlton Fullerton Bay Take the one where you can have a great price differential. Fullerton Bay is nice for non-business folks. Location is fine. What does it have over the Conrad? Room design is better but some may prefer the Conrad given the privacy in the bathroom. Ritz: take it if cheaper and want the better view. The rooms are better than at the Conrad in terms of space and quality. One final note: The executive lounge at the Conrad could do better in terms of a more relaxed atmosphere. It has great views but : 1. I always feel like I am entering a Hospital waiting room awaiting news whether a dear one died or not after surgery. A bit of a relaxed mood would help. Business folks are not that formal. 2. The amount of time when food and drinks are available is rarely suitable for business folks. Think about it management: many of us come from Europe or US. We rarely will leave the Singapore office at 6 PM to make it to your set schedule early in the evening. Something to consider to adjust to your clientelle. No, it is not about having dinner there as I see some guest doing. I end up rarely going to the club as it is never 'available' when I need it.

Reviews.Title: “Does not remain in the mind ....”
Reviews.Author: BO777
Reviews.Content: These dated rooms. The pool area was by no means a pleasant or attractive. Executive lounge with great views and delicious catering.Service ok.

Reviews.Title: “A classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: dichowza
Reviews.Content: Booked a quick weekend trip to Singapore and was glad we stayed here. Service was great, breakfast was quality and the location was perfect. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: LPTripalicious
Reviews.Content: The beds are divine and the staff are fantastic. Food is always fabulous. Love staying here for work

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: MrsMK
Reviews.Content: This was my 8th holiday trip to Singapore. Normally I stay at the Mandarin oriental, but this time I decided to try new hotels, the Fullerton Bay (see other review) and the Conrad which is supposed to be the best the Hilton group offers. I stayed 4 nights in January 2012 in a "Club or Executive" room right after the CNY. I'm sorry to say that I find it hard to find anything that I liked about this hotel. Here are a few things: - the general "style" of the hotel is quite old fashioned (and not in a good way) and you get a feeling you could be anywhere in the world -the Club was not at all inviting, but really basic -the pool area is more like in a 3* hotel - I only ate once in the main restaurant, it was more of a buffet restaurant, but the only place that was open in the afternoon - the room was tiny even for one person and very basic -the bed was so high I had to get a little chair to climb on it (and I'm 1,63 meters tall) - they ask more $ for the airport limo transfer than the MO which is a more expensive hotel -for some weird reason the concierge gave my room number while making a dinner reservation at an outside restaurant, unacceptable! - you could choose your breakfast between a room service continental and the club buffet breakfast. However they tried to charge me for the room service continental! So, all in all, unfortunately I cannot recommend the Conrad if you are used to high end hotels.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: nokwin G
Reviews.Content: The staff are excellent and customer oriented. the staff are especially helpful at the front desk-always smiling and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this hotel is excellent”
Reviews.Author: terot
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. A short walk to the closest MRT station as well as one the largest malls in Singapore. A bunch of very nice restaurants very close. Extremely friendly staff. We had a nice room in the 21st floor facing the Marina. Breakfast was very nice, and there is a nice gym which is open 24 hours. Everything about this hotel is very good. Even the wireless internet worked very well during our whole stay. If we ever visit Singapore again, we'll definitely stay at Conrad Centennial again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Value for money”
Reviews.Author: KruthiBangalore
Reviews.Content: Small room not value for the price we pay. The TV does not face the bed. The tea coffee maker in the room not functional. The remote system which controls the electrical connection in the room does not work at all times

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: guidedug
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for a few nights. Excellent hotel. Super friendly staff , even gave me an extra Conrad bear to enusre both my daughters were able to get one each . Excellent location, easy drive form airport and very easy to get around the city as it is also very close to Esplande metro station. Very comfortable and luxurious room with good views over city. Plenty of eating and drinking places in the vicinty. A good sized swimming pool , which is ideal place to relax after a days work ! Easily the best hotel i have stayed in SIngapore

Reviews.Title: “A 5-star experience”
Reviews.Author: macalif0rnia
Reviews.Content: One could choose from several excellent hotels in Singapore and make a great choice, but for the money, the service and the overall experience, the Conrad Centennial is outstanding. We just spent a week and every aspect of the stay was 5-star. First, the facility has been updated and construction in and around the hotel since our first stay as been completed. Second, the location near Singapore's happening Marina Bay makes the location a great choice for business travelers as well as tourists as the proximity is within walking distance of the famous Raffles, the new (now two years old) Sands casino, and an underground world of shopping that never seems to end. Especially noteworthy is the 31st floor executive lounge where a concierge is stationed fulltime to arrange cars, reservations and hotel needs, and the food and beverage selection is excellent from breakfast through Happy Hour. The hotel is pricey (about US $500+ for most corporate account travelers, but oddly still a bargain for the highest of high-end of hotel experiences. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Customer Oriented Hotel - Conrad Centennial”
Reviews.Author: KHTAN9943
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying in Conrad in the past and it has been few years I never back to this hotel. This time, I was coming from Japan. Leaving Haneda airport during the mid night and arriving 0630 in Singapore. I checked into Conrad again and I was delighted to be back. Like always, a great hotel where every detail is well taken care. I enjoy my 2 days stay during the weekend. On Monday morning, when I about checked out, the hotel sent me a bill for pre-checking. I noticed there is an additional night charges on the bill. I ran to the duty manager to ask what the charges are about. He told me is one night charge for the reservation on the night before I arrived. I refuse to pay because my colleague who arrived a night earlier has informed the hotel that I will be only arrive the next day. The reception response, no problem "we will take care about it". I appealed that it is not right to charge for me for full room night and but I willing to pay 50% of it. After a long discussion with John Park, the duty manager. Last, he told me he will waive the charges and wish me to stay with them in future. With the customer oriented altutude, I am fully impressed and I will revisit them for sure when everytime I spend my nights in Singapore. This type of customer first 'empowered' management style that I read a lot in the marketing book, finally I witness myself in Conrad! Highly recommended especially for business traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Everything is good but......”
Reviews.Author: molocinque
Reviews.Content: We are actually now stayig at the Conrad for 3 nights. Everything was good, service is good, we had late lunch at the Oscar's Cafe, staff and food is very good........until some maintenance job happening upstairs with lots of noise from drilling and hammering! It happened right after we checked in to the room....very annoying! I called the reception and asked what happening but seems the girl doesn't know there is work in the guest room, she went to check and came to us with apology. I explained to her that my husband not feeling well and need some rest, at the end she stopped the maintenance job for the whole afternoon. Now the drilling and hammering just started again! I wonder why there is no any notice when we checking in, or why unable to move us to another guest room? I guess the hotel is very full?

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: suhelsayed25
Reviews.Content: Conrad Centennial Singapore is outstanding in every sense of the word. The Reception staff was exceptional including Vani who helped answer many questions before I arrived. Check in was a breeze. Everyone smiled and very helpful. Room was clean and bed extremely comfortable. Buffet breakfast at the restaurant was great--had something for everyone. Hotel next to the Suntec Mall including metro stop. Recommend the food court to try the local cuisine. So much selection. GREAT EXPERIENCE IN A CLASSY HOTEL. Worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ariani50
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Hotel with Firendly Staff. Delicious Food. Clean Room and ... Every Thing is OK

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate luxury....”
Reviews.Author: stylianmos
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week before in the fantastic MBS, and we thought that we had seen it all and enjoyed the absolute hospitality, the amazing service, and unsurpassed luxury ... All that until we checked-in in the Conrad Centennial Singapore, where we were treated like never before and where we experienced the ultimate luxury....The room here has more contents, starting from the fruit basket, and going to the box of pralines on the table next to the bed... The breakfast is simply delicious, and with so many restaurants around in the area we regret that we didn't try a meal in the main restaurant and that alone is a good reason to come back to this wonderful hotel.... We had a memorable stay here mainly because all hotel staff without exception greeds you when walking by, the beds with pillows were the BEST I ever slept in my entire life, and frankly we did not see anything that was not just perfect. Right next to the hotel are two shopping centers, the "Millennia Walk" and "Suntek City", enabling all kinds of shopping, and dining in Japanese, Vietnamese, Korean, Thai restaurants, and more. Adjacent you will find the subway station to move to the city center. But everything is so comfortable around you that we did not feel the need to go to the center at all. Keep in mind that this is one of the real five star hotels, and prices are higher than outside and around the area...We found that absolutely ok!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: scowsan
Reviews.Content: In terms of location, I would not recommend to anyone who would like to go shopping as it is at least one change of trains to get to the main shopping area on Orchard street. Location is a bit out of the way from shopping districts. However, if you are a Hilton Honors member, the benefits of free breakfast and Internet is great if you can get a great rate of less than 180 U.S. dollars. This is based on if you want to be next to the casinos and prefer to be near where the "non shopping" actions happen. Location is great to downtown area with alot of local "good eateries" nearby. Would recommend for short stays of 2or3 days. The only bad point I would mention is that if you are the type of person who brings your computer with you and work.. The hotel room does not have an outlet near the desk. There were no plugs (outlets) available. I had to unplug a lamp next to the bed to charge my pc! I wish a hotel in the same class of the Conrad would realize business people need outlets next to the desk! I just wished the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: christine2008
Reviews.Content: We had booked a business king room which was a good size with a very large sony flat screen TV, a stocked fridge, tea and coffee making facilities and free water. The bathroom was a good size with a large shower and a bath. We had a business standard room which was on the 25th floor and gave decent views of the city. The hotel is connected to the Suntec City shopping mall and is a 10 minute walk to the river. The hotel is opposite the hop on hop off bus tours which is ideal for sightseeing or getting your bearings. This is very much a business hotel but is also suitable for holidaymakers. Whilst we were in Singapore there was an air show/convention nearby and most of the good hotels were fully booked but the hotel never felt overcrowded. There is a very nice pool and pool area with a pool bar and a gym and spa within the same area. Large towel chair covers and pool towels are provided and iced water free of charge which is a nice touch. The lobby is large and the female concierge was very helpful when we needed advice as were the doormen and luggage attendants. There was the option for breakfast at lobby level or next to the pool area which was good and we ate at the hotel restaurant-Oscars which had an international buffet or a-la-carte. We had the help-yourself buffet and found it to be good value, a huge selection and nicely presented. I would not hesitate to visit this hotel again if i stayed in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel with excellent service and great location”
Reviews.Author: YewMing
Reviews.Content: This is my preferred hotel in Singapore which i pretty much visit monthly. It is a business hotel conveniently located right next to the Suntec convention hall & Suntec office towers. Right next to it is also the Marina Square mall as well as the Suntec shopping arcade. Hop next door to the Food Republic to try out local Singaporean fare if you are not up for hotel food or check out the many Japanese restaurants on the boulevard right outside the hotel. There's also a nice Paulaner bar right next to the hotel. You can also take the MRT which stops nearby. The service staff here is great and very efficient. Checkin & checkout can be sometimes a pain when it's peak hours or when a big group comes in but otherwise, there's really nothing to complain about other than the shower (needs some upgrading & better water pressure).

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel with Minor Issues”
Reviews.Author: oliverAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Executive Level floor. On the plus side, the free internet and the afternoon drinks and snacks in the Club were excellent and service was very good. Breakfast was also good and the bed was comfortable. On the downside, an older style TV (although it was a flat screen) without a crisp, modern digital image and being charged for room internet. It never ceases to annoy me to be charged for the internet in a 5 star hotel when most backpacker places and budget hotels have it for free. Still, I know that the Conrad is not alone in this. I also trod on a sliver of glass which was in the carpet when I pulled the curtains closed. Probably a glass was broken at some time, and I know that vacuuming it all up is difficult. However, if the rate was good, I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mapboy11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Conrad for 4 nights. We both thought the hotel was a very pleasant place to stay in Singapore. It was nearby public transportation and is in a decent location. There are a few hotels that might have slightly better locations, but the Conrad was definitely well situated. We especially enjoyed the Food Republic hawker center in the building across the street. Not the greatest hawker center in Singapore but it is a good way to get your feet wet before branching out to more adventurous places to eat. Our room was comfortable and the staff was quite friendly (as are most folks in Singapore). We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Tom34438
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad for 3 nights. I got upgraded to the Executive Floor and was very happy with my accommodations. The room was spacious, comfortable bed, and very nice bathroom. The reception staff was very friendly and efficient. The hotel definitely has the feel of a 5 star hotel. Breakfast on the Executive Floor lounge was a little too limited for my taste, but I tried the main restaurant and was very pleased with the selection. The staff was outstanding!! The concierge was excellent in providing guidance on places to visit, including nightlife (Go to Clarke Quay). I noticed a couple of incorrect items from the mini-bar bill on my bill, the issue was resolved in a quick, friendly, and efficient manner. When I checked out and waited for a taxi, the staff even vetted my taxi. One taxi wanted a fixed price of $50 for a ride to the Airport and the Conrad staff quickly waved him off and got me a metered taxi which was half the price. Another thing that is very convenient is that the city tour bus hub is right across from hotel. I was very happy with my stay at this hotel and would definitely return if my travel plans take me back to Singapore. A beautiful city and hotel! Most definitely recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Its amazing”
Reviews.Author: Sergey S
Reviews.Content: Conrad Centennial Singapore is outstanding in every sense of the word. The efficiency and friendliness of the staff at the lobby and front desk, to the cleanliness of the room was just amazing. I have never had a more hassle-free check-in or having my requests met and I have stayed in many hotels. I am so impressed by Conrad that I feel that no other hotel is able to give me such a wonderful stay as Conrad did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business”
Reviews.Author: AsianTravellerHK
Reviews.Content: I am a Hong Kong expatriate from the USA and have lived in the region for over 9 years. Therefore, I have been afforded the opportunity to stay, dine, attend conferences or some combination thereof at some of Asia's best hotels including: St. Regis (Beijing), Ritz Carlton (Bejing & Hong Kong), Four Seasons (Hong Kong), Grand Hyatt (Hong Kong & Macau), the Peninsula (Hong Kong), Shangri-la (Cebu and Hong Kong), JW Marriot (Hong Kong), and the Conrad (Hong Kong and Singapore), etc. I would like to think given my lodging experience at these fine establishments that I would know good service. With the Conrad Singapore, your experience will certainly be a good one. I have been there a number of times and the consistency of service has not degraded one bit. What I think they do there best is the hospitality - it is top-notch and on par or exceeding the level of detail and attention of other hotels within its peer group. My most recent stay was October of 2011 and I am looking forward to heading back in March. The check-in is pleasant and expediant, particularly if you are staying on the Executive Floor (which I highly recommend) as they have their own check-in counter. It's the little things that distinguishes great service from good service. The staff seem genuinely happy to serve you and go out of their way to meet your needs. For example, I like to read the Financial Times. In the executive lounge I asked for a copy. Then every morning thereafter whithout saying a word I was receiving the Financial Times delivered to my room. They also remember my drinking prefernce such as red wine or champagne every time I go to the Executive Lounge for a couple of drinks in the evening. Speaking of the excutive lounge, the food is quite good and they mix it up every day. In the morning you can grap a nice international breakfast with a selection of fresh juices and baked goodies. Afternoon tea set can really be thought of as either a lunch or dinnner as it is open buffet just like breakfast. Nice slection of finger foods / canapes and the desserts are delicious. The staff are always looking to fill your next glass of wine or champagne. The lounge is a great place to read a book, do some work or simply collect your thoughts. Some of the earlier comments about the building looking somewhat aged are valid, but that does not detract from the experience. While not as opulent as some of the other hotels I have stayed, you still get the sense that you are staying in a 5-star hotel. The rooms are wonderfully maintained though admittedly perhaps a bit on the smaller side. The swimming pool and gym facilities are nothing to rave about but they get the job done and are decently appointed. I do a lot of business in Singapore, and I always look forward to returning to the Conrad Centennial.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: uswmnj
Reviews.Content: Along with the JW Marriott Hong Kong, this is the best hotel I have stayed at (being a Marriott plat and a Hilton Diamond I travel a lot). Entire staff was exceptional including Kimberley Flores who helped answer many questions before I arrived. Check in was a breeze. Everyone smiled and very helpful. Room was clean and bed extremely comfortable. The bathroom shaver plug was broken and they brought up a transformer immediately. Buffet breakfast at the restaurant was great--had something for everyone. Hotel next to the Suntec Mall including metro stop. Recommend the food court to try the local cuisine. So much selection. GREAT EXPERIENCE IN A CLASSY HOTEL. Worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Executive floor worth it”
Reviews.Author: Love_the_life
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week in Singapore which included several days at this hotel. Service was excellent as I have come to expect in Singapore and the staff at the Conrad were friendly and efficient. As there were three of us, we opted for an executive room so that we could use the lounge for breakfast and drinks in the evening. The room was a little cramped with twin beds and a rollaway but it was not really an issue for us. The bathroom was large and well appointed with a separate shower. Our room overlooked the Fountain of Wealth which provided a lovely light show each evening. We did not eat dinner at the hotel, although we did use Oscars for breakfast one morning. There was a greater choice of menu items than in the lounge but the view of the three of us was that it was a little too busy and noisy to enjoy breakfast. All in all this was a good choice of hotels for us. Its location in the Marina area was very convenient as we could walk to the Flyer, to Raffles and the river area. We used taxis for longer trips.

Reviews.Title: “Aging Hotel, in need of renovation.”
Reviews.Author: Ozymandez O
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights on a getaway to Singapore. It's still a great hotel, but it looks visibly aged. Rooms are ordinary at best, shower and bathroom very basic. Hotel is in need of a dire renovation. Rooms however are clean and tidy, bed is comfortable. Breakfasts is great with good choices and fresh fruits. Overall a 5 star stay in an old and aging hotel. Other choices for same money and better locations are available.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not the best view”
Reviews.Author: Trotteglober
Reviews.Content: If you decide to go downtown Singapore meaning by the beautiful bay Conrad is a good choice with connections to suntec city conference and mall. The view is however blocked by some other hotels on the bay front. Rooms are comfortable but have nothing special. Concierge in the lobby is outstanding and able to support you for anything. Staff at the executive floor is not as efficient. Ground floor restaurant and buffet is a very good choice in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Sharp decline in staff service”
Reviews.Author: flyA380-800
Reviews.Content: My previous stays over years have been always full of memorable experiences thanks to wonderful staff members, paying attention to every detail and going extra miles. However my recent stay was another story. The bell, reception staff were no different from hostel or motel accommodations. Every question was answered wrongly including payment and I did not see any hand over among the team. The envelope explaining benefits were supposed to be provided upon check-in and another staff promised to slip in and nothing happened at the end. Call the one stop service line, which was no different from an operator, simply preventing guests reaching the reception or duty manager directly. The aging shower head needs to be replaced as well. Breakfast for business floor guests by the pool were very much unimpressive. The new MRT station nearby is a welcome feature.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Conrad!”
Reviews.Author: Kimilogy
Reviews.Content: My 2nd time staying at this hotel and I must say the staff never failed to impress me with their service. I celebrated my birthday over the weekends and I was given a complimentary cake by the hotel. Oh ya, I wanna thank Roy for bringing the cake over and also for the lovely Conrad bears! I will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Joaquin03
Reviews.Content: As a lone traveler, I booked the Conrad as a Hilton HHonors Diamond member. I was met at the airport by a driver who was ready to drive me to the hotel (for a charge). From that point on, the service was superb and after first recognition, I was addressed by my last name (it's little things like this the separate 5-star hotels from others). I booked a King Room with a view of the city, and was upgraded on arrival to an Executive Room. The room itself was a good size, and layout was great. It had separate tub bath and shower, with all amenities included. The only request I made while I was there was for some ice, and that was promptly met by housekeeping in what seemed like a few seconds. After having stayed at the Conrad in Hong Kong and Tokyo, this Conrad is certainly in line with the excellent service I've come to expect from this high class Hilton property. In regards to location, it is near the central business district (CBD), which has made a popular destination for business travelers, as I noticed a large amount of guests where in this category. It's great because you don't get that touristy atmosphere that you would get at a resort destination. In summary, the staff, the service, the location, and the overall experience made my stay in Singapore all the more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Hingdoi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Conrad Singapore many times in the past and the consistent service level did not fail this time either. The breakfast is excellent and staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY”
Reviews.Author: 2love2hike
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights here and I can't say enough about how kind and accommodating the staff were. Our room was on the top floor facing the Sand's "ship". We had a beautiful view. The bathroom amenities were top of the line, Executive lounge amazing - great food options and excellent service. The staff was friendly, helpful, interested. This place is the epitome of customer service. It is a must stay in Singapore. Oh, and the birthday cake? TO DIE FOR!

Reviews.Title: “conrad hotel singapore”
Reviews.Author: paulburns
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel very freindly staff excellent facilities it is a bit far out but near to the underground

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: KDexplorer
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night on a business trip. Top class hotel. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud. The TV was huge. Lots of nice touches like bath salts and a rubber ducky to cute. They looked after my every request ( late check out etc) . Right in the middle of suntec city

Reviews.Title: “exceptional in every way”
Reviews.Author: mark c
Reviews.Content: Service, food and the room were everything you'd expect from a 5 star hotel but often don't get. The beautiful wooden cot and mini slippers provided for my daughter were a great touch. Rooms are elegant and well appointed. Staff are chatty and efficient. Good location. Other food and drink options on your doorstep if the hotel prices are a bit keen. Perfect stay. Just glad my company were paying for it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Hollymount26
Reviews.Content: Was disappointed with the Conrad after staying in the Fairmont, considering the Conrad is supposed to be a 5* it did not compare with the Fairmont at a 4*. Beds were only turned down on the 1st night, complimentary water only left the 1st night, my husband is a hilton honors member and it did not count for anything. We were questioned by the door man on our arrival back to the hotel at around 11.00pm after a visit to the zoo granted we looked like no one owned us but we did take offence at being questioned. Always try and stay in Hiltons generally but this particular hotel has let the Hilton name down.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: LivingInNorway
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Executive floor and the service was fantastic. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom large. Laundry service was prompt. The pool was the perfect temperature on a sweltering day. A few Cons: the lounge is quite busy during peak hours and the food never changed in the 3 days we were there. Also, the tv is at a right angle to the bed so you can't lie against the headboard and watch a show.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and pleasant stay but beware of wireless access fees”
Reviews.Author: kmsc_1
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, arriving in the early morning from an EU flight. Our room was available for check-in straight away which was very welcome. The room was large,comfortable, well equipped and with a great view. We were on a room only basis and we did not try the restaurants since there are plenty of eating places directly surrounding the hotel. The location is convenient and relatively close to several MRT stations. Staff were all friendly and polite. We booked using HHilton Honors points, so the price was not relevant. The one downside was the very high wireless access fees 60 SGN. For a city as connected as Singapore we found it surprisingly difficult to get wireless in coffee shops (despite asking at the Singapore Visitor's Center) and so ended up needing to use the hotel access. The policy was transparent, but the price really is too high.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Lil H
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel but a bit dated. The service was excellent. The location is ok but not my favorite part of town. The rooms are big and comfortable with every amenity you could ever need. The exec lounge is too busy in peak periods and more like a train station than a lounge. Overall it is great value for money and was a lovely experience. I would stay here again for business but it is not very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Never Fail to Impress”
Reviews.Author: Rayy T
Reviews.Content: This will be my third year coming back to the Conrad Centennial Singapore. For the past three years, we will bring different friends or family to come stay with us at the conrad centennial singapore. And without fail, all only have great things to say about Conrad! I brought my sister & brother in law for the stay this time, being a Diamond member of the Hilton Honors, our rooms were automatically upgraded and we were able to use the lounge excess. We understand that the hotel were running full hence, our rooms were located on different floors. The Executive floor staffs were not as friendly as before, as i can't seem to recognize any one that was there anymore. On a better note, they had a better menu now for breakfast, afternoon tea & evening cocktails. Do book the Executive Floor room, cause the view from the lounge ,the service and the food up there is amazing. Do come by early as it can be very crowded especially in the evenings. Thank you to Mimi and Abar who were always so attentive to us. The room was very large with a king sized bed, very comfortable providing us a great night sleep. Next to the bed there is a control panel that took care of the lighting in the room as well as the do not disturb light on a panel outside the front door. There was a very large flat screen TV in the room as well as a built in entertainment center with radio and DVD player. The housekeeping would turn on the music from the DVD in the evenings, so do not be alarmed! The bathroom was large with a glassed in marble shower, full sized bathtub and sink. The hotel included every possible bathroom amenity and their toiletries smelled great. The lobby of the hotel is very large and impressive with many couches to sit on,listen to the tunes from a grand piano where someone played a few tunes in the evenings. Everyone one was always on smiles and ready to assists. We both were however very impressed with one of the lobby staff Yuana, she never fails to remember us! On one of the evenings when we just came back from dinner, i was surprised that someone greeted me by my name. And there she was, she had attended to us since three years ago when we first stayed at the Conrad . Previously, she was the one that took us up to our room and showed us the amenities. Last year when we came in for check-in, she was coincidentally on duty at the doors, saw us coming in and quickly made a phone call and whisked us up to the Executive Floor. We really felt welcomed and being remembered is a bonus since we only visit once a year. She gave us good dinner recommendations, sent us for great massage and always never fail to impress us. She is quick,attentive to our needs, gives good suggestions knowing our preference and always smiling. Not only a hotel staff but she makes us feel very welcomed and also like a good friend. We are definitely looking forward to see her again next year as she always makes us feel at home. We enjoyed our stay at the Conrad, the staffs were really attentive and always greeted us in high spirits, from when we entered the hotel , to the one that mended the lifts and even the housekeeping staff that was on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: sactokw
Reviews.Content: Stayed on executive 31st (top) floor for 2 nights in Jan 2012 during Chinese New Years week. Service was very personalized for Diamond Hilton members on the executive floor. Executive lounge on 31st floor had excellent view with nice breakfast, afternoon snacks, and evening appetizers; lounge had computer with printer (very convenient). Free in room internet access for 15 minutes only. but free unlimited for Diamond members. Room was clean; AC strong, flat TV with HBO, bed was comfortable, had complimentary small teddy bear, water bottles, basket of fruit and some chocolate (nice touch). Bathroom was large with walk in shower and rubber duck by bathtub; toilet flush was a litle weak; shower water pressure was excellent; very nice soap/shampoo/lotion. Excellent gym and pool on 4th floor; large gym with treadmills, free weights, and a few machines; free water and juice; free rental headset for treadmills to watch cable TV if you ask for it. Large pool was very comfortable especially with Singapore heat. On 4th floor, there is a departure lounge and shower for those airplanes leaviing later (very nice). In lobby, buffet breakfast had a huge spread (Chinese, American, European, Japanese, Indian favors); a little expensive at >$30 if not included with room. Location was convenient; next to Fountain of Wealth; across the street from Duck&Hippo Tours main station at Suntek (very convenient for tourist who want to participate in tours). Also walking distance (if you can take the Singapore heat) to the Singapore Flyer ("largest ferris wheel") and Marina Bay Sands (15-30 minutes walk), Overall, excellent hotel and service.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but room a little dated”
Reviews.Author: perryw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in October/November 2011 in a twin-bed Executive room, having made the booking directly through the hotel website for a twin-bed Business room, where I was upgraded to the next category above upon check-in. The rate at that time was not particularly competitive but that was the case with basically all the hotels in Singapore at that time. Arrival I arrived here by taxi from the airport and the welcome at the reception area was quite warm with quite a friendly attendant present and I was later escorted to the lift and then to the room with a full explanation of the room features being made later. I was told that I had been upgraded to a higher level and the immediate higher category of room but the room still seemed to be very similar to the usual rooms advertised on the hotel website and it was on the smaller side. I had requested a non-connecting room but that could not be arranged and my room was connected to another through a door next to the TV and in front of the luggage rack. It did appear, though, that this style of room was what could be expected for a twin-bed Executive, as it was in the same style as advertised on the hotel website and perhaps connecting rooms are the only ones available in this category. The Room The room was in an older style and not hugely complicated or filled with various tech features as far as hotel rooms go these days. There were no impressive lighting features such as found in the St. Regis in Singapore, for example. It was also a little old and worn but still quite well-maintained The bed was very comfortable and the linens had a high thread count so were also quite comfortable and felt soft on the skin. The bedhead design and look was really quite simple. The sofa chair was comfortable but looked a little generic and simple. The bathroom was quite large with very large oversize mirrors within and the ‘Anystream’ showerhead really did produce a large variety of water streams. The toiletries provided were of a high quality and generously proportioned. The bathtub wasn’t particularly large and it took a while to fill because of the weak water stream coming from the tap. The water stop in the bathtub was a little odd and not the usual type; it was operated from outside the bath and I was concerned whether it might be the best from a hygienic point of view as it didn’t seem possible to wash it directly. Another problem with the bathroom was the slightly dirty or darkened grout in parts of the bathroom, especially the shower area, which shouldn’t really happen in a hotel at this level and could have been mould or mildew. All things considered, it seemed like it was time for a general bathroom overhaul by the look of things. The TV in the room was quite impressive, being a large LCD Sony system with excellent picture and sound quality, being particularly clear and there was also a dvd player included as well as a large selection of channels available. The soundproofing in the room was more than adequate and even though they couldn’t provide a non-connecting room and only had a connecting one available, nothing could really be heard from the connecting room and it was also quite well sound-proofed from the traffic which was on the street level, although it was a higher-level room. Complimentary pralines were provided in the room as a welcome amenity but I thought it would have been even better if these were replenished daily because hotels do replenish fruits in the rooms when provided and perhaps the chocolates should also be refilled. There was no free internet in the room officially but there was an option to select the free 15 minutes worth of internet and to continually reselect the option when the allotted time had run out. The room provided a medium-sized safe, not the largest in a hotel room but larger than some of those which can only fit a small laptop. My room had quite a nice view out over to the fountain at the Suntec towers and over the expressway in that area as well as of the towers themselves. The fountain looked more impressive at night when it was lit in a variety of colours. As I recall, my room had no iron or ironing board provided except on request but fortunately, the rate included some complimentary pressing. Videos of the room can be found through my profile section. Staff Service There was ice provided in the room after the turndown in the evening and the range of teas available was also more than usually provided and of higher quality too. All of my newspaper requests were met in the morning. I tried the in-room dining once and the attendants on the phone and bringing the meal were friendly. The meal itself was also quite good, confirming the quality that I have so far experienced in Hilton hotels as far as the in-room dining meals. Hotel Facilities Breakfast was provided in a sort of private area next to the pool and although it was definitely a very quiet, cosy and private dining area relative to that provided in most hotels, the choice of food for the buffet was also quite limited. Service was also only just acceptable and the staff there didn’t seem that friendly on the two times I had breakfast there with the exception of one staff member. The hotel did not have any jacuzzi or sauna facilities but a spa service was available and the gym was well-equipped with a wide variety of new equipment. Location The hotel’s location was very convenient for shopping and dining, as it was basically on top of the Millenia Walk Shopping Centre and close to the Marina Square Shopping Mall, which had quality dining available as well as a foodcourt. The Suntec shopping centre was also closeby with a few more dining options in the basement levels of one of the towers including another large foodcourt as well as many restaurants. The Esplanade and Promenade MRT stations are also nearby and connect with other MRT lines which go to many other parts of the island. Conclusion Overall, it was a good experience here. The room quality perhaps was not the best that can be found now but the service levels were generally very good. Just as a quick comparison for illustration, the rooms here were not as impressive as at the St. Regis Singapore but the service levels were better. In any case, I felt that the hotel had more of an old-style homely feel to it which made for a comfortable and relaxing experience. The main issues were the high rates at the time and the fact that my request for a non-connecting room could not be met. Overall, I would give the hotel a 4.5 out of 5. NOTE: Videos of the hotel room can be found through my profile section.

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the beds”
Reviews.Author: shiba57
Reviews.Content: We've stayed a number of times, and last time they had replaced all the mattresses. Oh dear!! They obviously knew these were a problem as this time they had put mattress toppers on. Even with a mattress topper the bed was rock hard. The topper was only feather and it just flattened when we lay on it. Finally two doonas later, plus another folded in half, we could sleep. But the underlying bed was so hard we may as well have slept on the floor! We had to buy cheap foam mattresses from Carrefours, which is ridiculous in a hotel of this calibre! Having to pile so much on made me feel like I needed steps to get into bed. Oscars restaurant was great for breakfast, but despite offering help with food allergies, the dinner chef got it wrong. So for our last three days my husband was very ill, and we missed out on all the Chinese New Years festivities. it took another week for him to recover properly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Singapore's Marina District”
Reviews.Author: Zaideeanne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in the Marina District and is convenient to shopping malls and restaurants. My room was very comfortable and had a nice view looking down at the swimming pool. The 4th floor pool had pretty landscaping around it and was a pleasant place to relax and swim after a busy day of exploring Singapore.The food in the hotel's casual restaurant was very good, and the service personnel at the reception desk and at the concierge desk were very friendly, pleasant, and helpful.The hotel is within half an hour walking distance of some of the major attractions of downtown Singapore, including the Merlion statue and the Asian Civilizations Museum. I was given good directions for exploring Singapore on foot at the concierge desk. I enjoyed my two night stay at the Conrad Centennial Singapore very much.

Reviews.Title: “Top class service in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: benrose
Reviews.Content: We booked online for 2 nights in the Conrad Centennial, based on previous reviews on Tripadvisor. We booked a KING BED EXECUTIVE ROOM and for an additional S$70 we could get an upgrade to a 1 KING BED EXECUTIVE PREMIER ROOM. On our arrival, we were pleasantly surprised to find that our upgrade was to a suite! We thoroughly enjoyed the additonal space, as well as the luxurious linen and appointments. It also included free access to the Business Lounge on the top floor, with spectacular views and fantastic snacks and drinks every afternoon around 5pm. It is within easy walking distance from the spectacular Marina Sands complex - the new icon on the Singapore horizon.

Reviews.Title: “For suntec travellers”
Reviews.Author: ShabbirMerchant
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in center of suntec towers, very convenient for business travellers to suntec city. Quite cosy and comfortable, has a range of restaurants and malls at walking distance. No great views from the room though.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: sidroy100
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by my recent stay at the Conrad Centennial Hotel in Singapore. The location seems to be very conveniently located and for a change hopping into taxis did not pose a major problem even during peak hours (unlike my stays at other comparable hotels in Singapore).As can be well appreciated, a critical convenience for most business travellers to Singapore is the ready availability of taxis from hotels specially during peak hours.I do not know how many hotel reviews bring out this factor of ready taxi availability (and I am not referring to the hotel provided taxis which are quite expensive compared to public taxis) but in this context the Conrad Centennial was quite a revelation. Another aspect to note is the high quality of the live music provided at the lobby level of the hote.It was pure bliss after returning in the evening from meetings and listening to (and watching) the highly talented ensemble late till the night.A noticable aspect of the music on an acoustics basis was the fact that it did not seem to be so loud to prevent any meaningful conversation to take place.In some of the other hotels featuring live music in the lobby,it is often quite difficult to carry on a proper conversation.Not so in the case of the Conrad Centennial. if there was a a discordant note,I found it to be in the final bill that I received in which I was charged twice for the same room and for the same date.Obviously the reception counter forgot to destroy the credit card charge-slip which one normally submits on arrival (to ensure guaranteed payment) when checking in.As a matter of abundant caution I would advise fellow travellers to always insist that their original credit card charge-slips are either returned to them or disposed off in their presence at the time of actual check out.This will eliminate considerable inconvenience later on and this applies to all hotels. All things considered however,the stay at the Conrad Centennial in Singapore was a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melanie B
Reviews.Content: Ok. lets start by admitting that this hotel is not the Mandarin Oriental. It is a 1980's style hotel but the rooms are not small, they are relatively modern and they are clean (except for some of the tiles in the bathroom which need updating). The hotel is however, well located close to a shopping centre that has some good restaurants in its immediate vicinity. The gym is spacious and friendly and the pool is pleasant. There is an excellent Chinese Restaurant located in the hotel itself.The staff overall are very friendly although I would not necessarily pay a lot more to stay on the Executive floor as it often seems to be under staffed, the quality of champagne is quite poor and the quality of snacks it serves in the evenings is not great. The club floor does however have some good views over Singapore. Nevertheless this hotel is a lot cheaper than the Mandarin Oriental or the Ritz and so unless you want to splurge top dollar and receive that slightly better level of room and service then the Conrad in Singapore is a good solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “A practical and functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miquelg
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in the Marina Bay, is a 5 * fair. Club room not very large, with excellent bed and bath. Breakfast for Club rooms good but repetitive: during 6 days there was always the same! Buffet restaurant excellent but expensive. Attentive service. Value high compared to other hotels in the area. Serious pedestrian access to go to malls

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: AKabani
Reviews.Content: Our flight was delayed into Singapore and we arrived at the hotel at 2am. The receptionist was so nice and kind and esorted us to our room. Inspite of the late hour, she upgraded one room and offered several free amenities to us. The rooms were spacious and very nice. The executive lounge on the top floor was beautiful. It had a very nice afternoon tea service. The buffet breakfast was included in the room and had a very wide offering. I would definately stay at this hotel next time I am in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMC6
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a Singapore stop over.Staff are superb,always available as soon as you step out of the lifts nothing to much trouble.Rooms and bathrooms spacious .Breakfast everything you can want. Try the dumplings! Wonderfully decorated for Christmas with piano player etc . Walk into the shopping mall opposite and to the Marina. Marina full of eating places and entertainment.Stopped one night pre cruise and then a day room on the way back.Everthing we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “OK but Not the best choice in Singapore for me”
Reviews.Author: UKcritic
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the positives: Good location and very convenient for MRT and other attractions Great staff - all friendly and keen to please at all times Room is good with great bed Negatives: I stayed for several nights in an Executive Room and used the lounge. Snacks and drinks OK but it gets very crowded when the food is served. Choices are OK but hardly change over days. Had breakfast In Oscars each day and again, the monotony of choice is the striking feature. Asian selection was very poor on most days. Had buffet dinner 1 night for S$78 plus tax which is hardly cheap for what's on offer and why is there a 10% service charge for a self-serve buffet? Had the buffet at Raffles the night before which was far superior and cheaper and didn't have young children running around out of control. Food at the Golden Peony overpriced and very ordinary. Overall, I wasn't either greatly impressed or majorly disappointed but I won't be going back to the Conrad next time I'm in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: DanielBeryl
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is exceptionally well maintained. It's just a short walk to the nearest subway station. Service is quick, efficient, and always friendly. The Executive Floor Lounge serves a delicious breakfast along with afternoon tea and evening hors d'oeuvres. The only negative about the room was that only instant coffee was available. The pool and health club are nice, but there are no spa type facilities such as steam, sauna, or whirlpool. With easy access to transit, it's in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: justjayce
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Conrad at 2AM after a full day of flying. While tired I was immediately impressed by the customer service even at that late hour. The bellman whisked our bags away and we were taken to the front desk by another representative. Despite the late hour the folks at the customer service desk were very chipper and welcomed us to the hotel. My status was recognized and we received an upgrade to a business class room, which included $S20 in free laundry service each day, 1 hour of conference room time on the business floor daily, shoe shine service and fresh fruit daily in the room. The front desk agent just didn't just give us our keys - she took us up to our room on the 30th floor and showed us the amenities. She also shared with us that since it was Christmastime there was a small teddy bear in the room as well as a rubber ducky in the bathroom that we could take with us when we left. These are very nice touches. The room was very large with a king sized bed. The bed was too hard for my liking, but still afforded a great night sleep. Next to the bed there is a control panel that took care of the lighting in the room as well as the do not disturb light on a panel outside the front door. This light got us into trouble once as we forgot it was on. The room was not serviced and our laundry was not delivered. But even with that when we called down for our laundry not only did they deliver, but they did refresh the whole room while we were at a late dinner. Excellent service! There was a very large flat screen TV in the room as well as a built in entertainment center with radio and DVD player. The bathroom was large with a glassed in marble shower, full sized bathtub and generous sink. The hotel included every possible bathroom amenity and replaced them daily. The closet had plenty of space but the safe was so small that a laptop with anything greater than a 12" screen would not fit. There was also a very nice sized table to conduct business at - but we were there to tour around. The room overlooked the fountain of wealth and we were entertained by the nightly show at the fountain. We received free breakfast every morning. We were told we could have buffet breakfast at the pool lounge or at the restaurant in the hotel, Oscar’s. If they give you a choice - choose Oscar’s every time. The selections are much better and the service was as well. We took advantage of the $S20 free laundry - the free daily allowance isn't even enough to get a suit done but it took care of several of our items and I was impressed with the quick turnaround. Every night we received turn down service. I wasn’t expecting it and it was nice to come back and have music playing as you walked into the room. The lobby of the hotel is very large and impressive with many couches to lounge on, a bar and a grand piano where occasionally someone played a few tunes. Because of the holiday season there was a fun Christmas tree made out of Conrad Teddy Bears. I was impressed. The hotel is conveniently located directly across the street from a mall where you can get a variety of gifts and there is a large food court with many selections. The mall also has the main stopping point for the hop on hop off bus which took us all over the city. The subway is about a 3 minute walk away from the hotel. On our last day I took advantage of an hour of time in the business lounge. The lounge opens early and is open until 11PM. I was escorted to a private suite with a computer, printer other office supplies and even breath mints. I needed to print a few things for the last leg of my trip and got it all done quickly. The front desk agent even gave me a nice envelope to store my printed pages. Overall this was a magnificent hotel. There was just one minor issue. I found the hallways in the hotel to be very warm. This time of year Singapore is in the 80s with high humidity. A couple of times I found myself overheated in the hallway on the way to the elevator. That is my only issue. Otherwise this was a fantastic stay and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller674
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights back in June 2010. We arrived at 8am from a long flight from London and we were able to check in at that time with no problems or having to pay extra. Breakfast was fantastic and had more or less everything you fancied. I recommend a freshly squeezed fruit juice of your choice to start your day. The rooms are clean and spacious, however after a long flight we went for a sleep for a few hours but when we woke up, we found the air con unit was leaking with water and caused a puddle of water in the hallway and just missing our items being soaked. We called reception about this and they sent someone up with a big industrial machine to clean it up but we refused and asked to move rooms as we didn't want to be in the room while they did maintenance. After various conversation, we were given a new room and we were given club room access for the inconvenience. The club room was good with a range of good snacks and drinks throughout the day. I would definitely recommend this and perfect for pre dinner drinks. Overall nice hotel and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Talk about WOW factor --WOW”
Reviews.Author: dcl80
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that I was impressed from the time I arrived till the time I walked out the door. I tend to look for negative things when ever I step foot in a hotel, I can honestly say I had a very hard time finding anything negative about the property.
