The Conrad Centennial Singapore is located within the business, historical, cultural and shopping districts of Marina Bay. Across from the Suntec Singapore – Convention and Exhibition Centre with access to shops and restaurants. A 20-minute drive from Singapore Changi International Airport, Sentosa Island, the Singapore Expo and a short walk to The Singapore Flyer. This was only my 3rd Conrad experience, in the past I was a guest at the Conrad Brussels and Istanbul. Both of these hotels did not meet my expectation, as a luxury brand in the Hilton Family, to me they were just Hilton hotels with the Conrad name. However the Conrad in Singapore just kept pleasing me over and over. Check In: Getting out of the taxi I was greeted by 2 hotel staff opening the doors for us on each side of the car, there was a 3rd staff member who had all our bags on a cart, he kindly asked my name. I was escorted to the front desk, the doorman got the door for us. The front desk was fully staffed with smiles, I gave my name and flashed my Hilton Diamond card, the agent quickly walked from behind the desk and escorted us to the executive level check in. When we arrived I was greeted by name and all the paperwork was ready. After a quick copy of the passport, we had the keys. Walked into the suite to find our luggage already there, very impressive. The Suite: Named the Centennial Suite, was a very nice size, with living room, bedroom, and very large and well appointed bathroom. The suite was on one of the corners of the building providing some cool views. Fresh flowers were placed in the room daily. I was impressed with the size of the SONY LCD TV in the living room, and the A/V connection panel with universal plug that would take most any plug type (why don’t more hotels have this?!?) The bed room was a good size. I really liked the bathroom, a nice glass inclosed shower, tub & duel sink vanity. The toilet was in it’s own spacious room. There was also a Conrad rubber ducky in the bathroom, and two bottles of Conrad Singapore branded water. The amenities in the bathroom, included the shampoos, conditioner, bars of soap... but the extras were toothbrushes, loofah, combs, shaving kits, sowing kit, and more.. The Executive lounge: The lounge was very nice with table service all day, the drinks kept flowing. The food selection at night was varied and hight quality. The staff in the lounge took pride as they set up the food service. It was kept full and clean. The lounge was a nice size with some really nice views. Internet in the lounge (wireless) was free. Good service and staff made this lounge very enjoyable. Doorman: I never opened the door to the hotel myself. I was greeted with a smile and a hello each time I was coming or going. When walking out, the staff outside always asked if we needed a map or helping finding something. I was very happy with my stay, the staff was just top of the top. Friendly, helpful, personable, knowledgeable & caring.. You could not ask for any better.. The hotel is run very well.. If you are in Singapore consider this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: The_GlobeTrotter73
Reviews.Content: One of the better city Conrads.....nice rooms, super exec lounge, helpfull staff - and at pretty good rates. Highly recommended when you visit Singapore next.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad at it's finest”
Reviews.Author: anni21
Reviews.Content: This is the second time for us in a Conrad Hotel. I am a Hilton Honors member. From the moment we walked in the door, the service was above welcoming. We booked a room on the concierge level and this decision did not disappoint us. We arrived somewhat early. We were escorted up to the 31st Floor for check-in. While we were waiting for our turn to check-in (minimal wait), we were invited to enjoy the lovely buffet breakfast. Hotel location was very good, better that I expected...close to shopping, across the street from the hop-on-hop-off bus, and close to the metro. Although perhaps if you are looking for a more local flavor hotel, the Conrad might not be what you are looking for. Since the hotel is located across from the Sunte Convention Center, I thought it might be too business oriented for a holiday stay, but WE were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a short break with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: KKlow
Reviews.Content: Like many other Conrads, this one is nothing different in terms of its services, food and hospitality. Great place to stay in especially with kids and family. Rooms: clean, spacious, no complains Food: great breakfast selection with piping hot food Pool: did not try Location: about 15mins by taxi to major orchard Service: staffs were very proffessional, helpful n friendly

Reviews.Title: “My stay”
Reviews.Author: Lzaragoza
Reviews.Content: A five star hotel should have free wifi they charged about 30 dlls per day

Reviews.Title: “The Way of 21st Century Service - Awesomeness!”
Reviews.Author: ShawnWoo
Reviews.Content: My HM checked us into Conrad cus it's near Marina for the NYE countdown. We arrived @3.30pm jus to find our room not ready and having to wait to be brought up to Exec floor after 30 mins of wait n having to pay the price, we were hungry n fuming mad but the story just began. Conrad staff staged a very impressive come back during our 3D2N. From the point of arrival, we were greeted with warm n apologetic smiles, tho it doesn't solve all the problem cus me n HM was super hungry having driven from KayL, still it is an effort I recognize now. We were brought to the Execfloor for high tea to quell our famine struck body. It was a relief ! Tho, my HM & I expects the usual smiles, proper greets, clean rooms n the whatnots of a 5 Star Hotel, I was taken by surprise for the next 72 hours on the staffs work ethics and camaraderie. Our late arrival was met with a personal HANDwritten letter with an apology from their Manager, ensued with Chocolates on Day 2. A Book Marker on my pillow top Which blown me away cus I was reading a book n din have the proper book marker, I jus used the MRT card to mark my last read pages. We were given late check outs @4pm promptly when we requested and knew these guys are sincere in their approach of treating us, the customers right. Most Hotels would have made us wait another 1 hour for escalation of cases n most will come back a Disappointment n made to feel being Ripped having check in later. Water bottles n toiletries regularly checked and replenished without us having to ask, and coming back in the evening after dinner to find the bed ready for sleep, with water n glass ready on bed side table, and the fluffy sandals placed in proper place is simply Amazing! There's also a Pillow Menu with over 10 types of pillow to choose from! I cudnt really sleep well on first night trying the softer pillow, but having changed to a firmer pillow, I awoke the next day thinking I was @ home n soon mistakenly got myself ready for work, NOT until I opened the curtain that Reality struck I am still on Holiday... Phew! All in all, it has been an Awesome experience with Conrad and the best way to start 2012. To readers n decision planners on where to stay next in Singapore town, give it a go... To the EDM picking up my story, pls extend my sincerest congratulation on your success in giving the best customer experience in the service industry. Staffs being staff on a normal payroll, you deserve a pat on the back. You have given me so much during my stay, inspiring me to give this much back to you in hopes Service standards like this prevail and become a Benchmark both in Singapore & Malaysia. To the management, you hit the pot of gold, and don't change your philosophy. It's in the right track. I found it once in Club Med but soon because of management change... The experience collapsed. I will be back for more of Conrad on my next visit to Singapore. I sincerely hope my minuscule story will give a glimpse into how happy you made my day and inspired me that 2012 is a Bright year ahead. God Bless, Salam and Godspeed Conrad!

Reviews.Title: “Great Services”
Reviews.Author: sandycolondam
Reviews.Content: Location: joining an event at Suntec convention centre? Conrad is the perfect place to stay. Its only 5 min away from nearby MRT and city hall are very close as well. Room: Just great! while standard business room was not spacious, but the room amenities, commentaries and toiletries are definitely high-class and accommodating. Free hi-speed wifi, an LCD TV with USB/Memory card plug, pillow menu (seriously!), very comfy sandal, complimentary mineral drink and fruits (Which replenished daily), cuddly teddy bear! (i requested to have 2 of these) and a floating duck to accompany your bathtub session. Breakfast: alot of varieties. Services: starts with lots of smiles, end with lots of smiles. Staffs are very helpful and smiles alot. Checkin and checkout process was very smooth Overall: Excellent. Totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: tippster
Reviews.Content: Reading some other reviews I wondered if I stayed at the same hotel. The lobby is quite nice and location is good. But the rooms are certainly not large, rather they are on the small side for a hotel of this price and class. Also there was mold in the grouting in the shower which is something that I would not expect in such a hotel. Service was also a bit on the slow side and I called the concierge several times without getting anyone to pick up on the other end. Overall a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was too good!!”
Reviews.Author: Rab M
Reviews.Content: This hotel we could NOT fault!! In fact it was just about perfect right down to the very last detail! The staff were so helpful they would not even let us carry our own rucksacks. The room was immaculate, big and a very classy and prepared bathroom with matching bathrobe and slippers.. Gym was good as well with good selection of benches and free weights/ treadmills/ crosstrainers Located right next to most of the attractions It wasent the cheapest hotel around but it was reasonably priced compared to others in the area and like I said, I don't like seeing little girls struggling with heavy bags and they won't let you help, but that's the service they try to uphold. I would reccoment this hotel to other travellers

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with the service, but ...”
Reviews.Author: Tookaa
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I became sick after a terrible night with cigarette smoke coming into the room from another floor, and very loud party noise from both up/downstairs which was the reason for a completely sleepless night. I had booked my room for 7 nights but we moved out to another hotel after the second night. An air purifier machine was delivered to my room after I declined to change rooms at 2 AM, but this did not help to remove the terrible smell of the cigarette smoke. Then there was the gym.. One of the only two elipticals was defective, and there were stickers at every machine that restricted the use to only 20 minutes during the morning and evening rush hour. This is simply unacceptable for a hotel of this standard. On the positive site the staff were very friendly and were trying to be helpful. This was the first and the last time I will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: ikathrada
Reviews.Content: Wow, 5 star indeed. From the rooms to the breakfast its absolutely what it should be in tems of a hotel. Though for some reason it didnt feel as special as it should, cant quite ut my finger on why. The rooms are great as are the views. The breakfast was amazing with everything you could possibly want and the staff there are great. The Concierge staff arent as great as they could be and spend far too much timealig to each other instead of working, my only criticism as such.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MarcusStumpf
Reviews.Content: The Conrad SG is located in Suntec City, a business Parc with some big Shopping Malls and good connections to Subway lines. Rooms are typical Conrad Style in good quality, staff is very attentive and friendly, breakfast at Oscars is good but always overcrowed, if you sit inside you get numb, outside it's a bit smelly from the airco's. Overall perfect place tonstay

Reviews.Title: “Unusually bad service at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights as Hilton Gold members, using points. The hotel is lovely inside. The room was great, with adequate broadband speed (that shut off the last couple hours of our stay) but it did allow multiple connections for iPad and PC. Great bed and bathroom facilities, supplies, thick towels, etc. Also if you're a tourist, the hop-on, hop-off buses' HQ is right across the street, very convenient. Also Peet's and Starbucks close by. The big downer was the service at bkfast -- we ate there twice and, once you get your coffee, they dont check on your again -- at all. Omlettes were rushed and runny -- yuk. They smile and say "bye" as you walk out -- but for thirty bucks (if you paid), I was surprised at this poor service. If the breakfast isnt included, just find the local coffee shop and enjoy the hotel otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “A truly serene hotel”
Reviews.Author: roxieontheroad
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel often gets inundated with tour groups and tourists, it's very quiet and comfortable in the rooms. It's definitely worth opting for the executive level. The executive lounge provides a lovely breakfast buffet of foods from almost every region of the world and also provides afternoon tea and evening appetizer service. Of course, there's no need to ever go hungry when you're out and about in Singapore. The options for dining span the range from hawker stands to fine dining. Even a vegetarian can be happy here. With multiple shopping centers and hotels interconnected to the Conrad, it's easy to find multiple dining options. Some of the other reviewers weren't excited about the location yet the Marina area is excellent for both business travelers and tourists. It's easy to get a taxi, hop on public transportation, or take a tour bus. The best part of staying at the Conrad is the service. Everyone is warm and welcoming. It's obvious everyone working here likes his job and likes to interact with people. I only wish every Hilton-branded property were this warm and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Samson O
Reviews.Content: Have been staying there on and off for the past few years. When it comes to service, the employees are amazing and they remember what i eat for my breakfast and also they remember my name all the time. Extremely good hotel. The good thing is they provide pillow menu too!! Absolutely great!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good,restaurant amazing”
Reviews.Author: ajc101_2
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in Dec 2011 . Firstly my advice is dont go to Singapore in December.It rained constantly .However the positive result of the inclement weather is that instead of venturing out to find little local restaurants we stayed within the hotel and its immediate area to eat. The main restaurant within the hotel is The Golden Peony. I am very fortunate,through my line of work, in that I eat at some very good restaurants throughout the world,including many Michelin star establishments. The Golden Peony immediately has moved into my top 5 restaurants and most definitely the best chinese restaurant I have eaten in,obviously not including the trashy chinese restaurants that are standard fare in the UK which dont merit a culinary mention in my book .Every dish we ordered was exceptional bar none . The hotel was very good without being exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bussiness hotel and base to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: NikonKing
Reviews.Content: Excellent business hotel and base to explore the city. Stayed there just as the Grand Prix was leaving, they said Lewis and Jenson had just left before I arrived. Very enjoyable stay, with an amazing view over the city. The standard of service in the hotel and the quality of the rooms and amenities is superb. The desk was not ideal for business use as I was working late and I found it uncomfortable after an hour or so. Bathroom was a good size and well presented with great towels (I think towels say a lot about a hotel!). Decent sized swimming pool and reasonable gym. Great location walked back there after a meal in Clarke Quay. It is expensive WiFi costs and ‘extras’ do add up but if you want comfort and quality I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, excellent infrastructure, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dimitr
Reviews.Content: Best service I received at an international hotel. Staff available every 3 meters. You can walk to the Flyer, Merlion and Raffles hotel from here. The Hippo tours start across the street. Right next to the Suntec mall complex. The executive lounge was good but kinda small and crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: mpk17
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Conrad a couple of times over the last two years on business and find it always up to the very high standard one expects at Singapore hotels. In terms of service, infrastructure and amenities it is irreproachable. The club lounge on the top floor in particular is spectacular. However the location is not ideal unless one has business on that side of Singapore. Not the cheapest option, but if you are looking for an excellent business, high standard business hotel that is perfectly run and managed, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: Pooja C
Reviews.Content: I am usually in Conrad for all my business trips. my job entails a lot of travelling and i have been to many places. but Conrad Singapore is always the highlight of my stay every single time i am in Singapore for business. they have the most amazing and friendly staff. i never have had any issues with the service i have recieved there. whats more they always remember my preferences. so i get customised and tailor made service each time i am there. from things like what i prefer in breakfast to how i like not using water bottles (environment friendly alternatives) , they keep a track of everything. i m in love with Conrad Centennial sinagpore.. its an amazing place to stay!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: berray
Reviews.Content: Nice clean, good quality with high specs hotel. Location not ideal. Gym and pool outside area needs updating and could be more of a feature

Reviews.Title: “True meaning of customer service”
Reviews.Author: mcbsjd84
Reviews.Content: I booked at Conrads last November 1 for a November 5 check-in. And upon confirmation, i have experienced real customer service. They immediately asked my flight details, requests, like adjoining non-smoking rooms, because they said they wanted to ensure that our rooms would be available as soon as we arrive. And to our delight, we got what we wanted. We only booked regular rooms, but felt the quality and comfort difference from other hotels we have stayed. From small details like quality of pillow cases,.no pillow ends sticking out, reception bringing us to our room, etc. My family claims its the best so far! Very warm and sincere accomodation of the staff. With all these, i just really think i owe them a 5 star review, despite my very busy schedule. This is how much we really enjoyed our stay at conrads singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Tale of two cities”
Reviews.Author: hazban
Reviews.Content: Recently had a few nights at the Conrad Singapore followed by a few at the Conrad Hong Kong so which of these two establishments wins my vote? Singapore has to be one of the best cities in terms of organisation, cleanliness and good manners and the Conrad Centennial definitely reflects this national trend. Although in a slightly ‘commercial’ part of the city once invited through the welcoming doors one feels cocooned in an atmosphere of eastern hospitality. As with many international hotels there is little to remind the guest of where in the world they are staying, but, -- there are enough subtle reminders that you are not in London, Paris or New York. Without exception I found everyone willing, polite and anxious to make my stay memorable. Rooms are of a good standard with many extra amenities, plenty of work space, decent choice of TV even a choice of bathrobes. Instead of a chocolate on the pillow at turndown I got a box. Spoilt slightly perhaps as I had paid a bit extra for a room on a high executive floor. If you intend doing a few touristy things the open top sightseeing buses start from the convention centre just across the road. There is also a pretty good ‘food court’ there with a good selection of ethnic delicacies, also direct access to one of the air-conditioned shopping malls. Thoroughly recommend the Conrad, though if you want to be in a more touristy part of the city (i.e .where all the designer shops and chain restaurants are) try the Hilton or Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CVCHONG
Reviews.Content: i love the location of this hotel, and the environment there is so nice. I will definitely recommend it to people around me. friend staff, nice food ... good facilities ..

Reviews.Title: “comfortable & well located”
Reviews.Author: Luzius01
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel several times for the past 2 years and I am always happy to return. Beside the excellent facilities (rooms etc.) and great food (buffets) the friendly and professional staff is also to mention and of course the convenient location, next to Suntec City. I am looking forward to my next stays in January, May and November 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and sedate”
Reviews.Author: vwhk
Reviews.Content: "Conrad" means consistent and high quality 5-star hotels: their Singapore property is up to the brand's usual standards. However, the hotel lacks a distinctive feature that would help it rise above its local competitors. The location is central but not ideal. The surrounding area is of no particular interest and the Suntec mall is downmarket compared to others. The colonial district is a good 15 minutes walk: either boring in underground passes, or sweaty in the Singapore heat. The situation has improved with the opening of the Promenade and Esplanade subway stations, but they are on the less convenient Circle Line. As it is, one has to rely on taxis to commute to places of business or entertainment. The lobby and the common areas are cool and shady; all noise is efficiently absorbed and the guests seem to conform to the ambient quietness by avoiding to raise their voice; as a result, the whole place seems to lack pulse. Service is attentive and friendly but tends to be a bit slow, particularly on check-in and check-out. The strong point of the hotel is the rooms: large, with modern equipment and classy decoration, very comfortable. On this front however, the Conrad finds itself outclassed by its neighbour, the luxurious Ritz-Carlton. Bottom line: a good hotel, but giving me no compelling reason to go there, except to attend a conference at Suntec city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and good standard”
Reviews.Author: susemm
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at the Conrad Centennial, much because of other reviews. We were not disappointed at all. From the very warm welcome to the minute we left the hotel we were greeted with smiles everywhere. The staff is fantastic. The lobby lounge is nice and relaxing with a good atmosphere. They serve nice cocktails and snacks and have a lovely afternoon tea. Outside they have a champagne bar with happy hours and some light snacks. We loved the miniburger and springrolls! We did not have breakfast included but ordered room service twice and we were very satisfied with our breakfast. The order was efficient and accurate and the coffee was really tasty. Loved it! We stayed on the 25th floor with views of the harbour and financial district. Possibly the view is nicer here than on the other side of the hotel. The bed was very comfortable and quite high so you slept like royalty. The surrounding area is nice with shopping centers and quite a few restaurants and there are walk ways aroung the bay, perfect also for jogging. If you would like to get on a Hop on Hop off bus, they are parked just across the street from the hotel. It is a great way to see the sights and they have several different routes you can take. The tickets are valid 24 hr, so you can see the city both during the day and late afternoon. We had booked airport transfer with the hotel and it was very convenient to have a driver waiting at the airport. The drive is just 15-20 minutes, so it was worth it although it is a lot cheaper with shuttle bus or underground. But we didn´t want to carry our luggage, and then I guess you pay for the service:-) Oscars restaurant served good food and a buffet every day, which we didn´t eat. But the a la carte menu was good and the Angus steak fantastic. Try and get a table by the window or perhaps outside to get a bit more privacy. It seems buffet dinners are very popular for families. All in all, we had a wonderful stay. The only thing we would like to see a bit nicer is the pool area and the sun beds there. The area could be more cosy, even though they have made it okay. Perhaps nicer umbrellas and sunbeds, and more green plants would make it better. However the staff in the pool bar was fantastic and the food very tasty. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in all areas”
Reviews.Author: werli
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the best hotel I have ever stayed at. The price for a room is quite high, but you truely get what you pay for. Room as large as a suite at other hotels, Excellent service, where everybody can do enough to please you. Usually I have problems with the pillows at the hotels where I stay, but at Conrad Centennial they have a Pillow Menu, so that you can choose exactly the type of pillow you like. Pool area and Gym are great and so big that even during "peak" times it does not feel like it's filled up with people. MRT station is only 50 meters away if you wish for quick transport around all of Singapore. If your desire is an excellent high end hotel - look no further.

Reviews.Title: “A very happy returning guest..”
Reviews.Author: travelliingaussie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad Singapore for a second time this year over the weekend. I was a bit worried that I had looked at my previous experience with rose coloured glasses, as I previously stayed there after spending a week in a cramped cabin on a wooden boat in the Maldives. I am happy to say that those fears disappeared the second I entered the hotel lobby on Friday morning. The Conrad Singapore is a class act. Great location, beautiful rooms with every luxury imaginable, but what really sets the hotel apart is the staff. I recently stayed at the Conrad in Hong Kong too, which was also excellent, but the staff on Singapore are just on a different level. Do yourself a favour and stay at the Conrad Singapore. They have certainly won my loyalty and I can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Steven T
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed at more than 100 Hilton Brand Hotels. This is by far, the best Hotel that I’ve stayed at. I stayed 10 Nights in November 2011. I was privileged enough to stay on the Executive Floor. I would like to stay Thank You to all of the Executive Floor Staff for their impeccable service and all of the Hotel Staff for making this such a pleasurable trip. If you’re your in Singapore I would defiantly recommend staying at this Hotel. Thanks again. Steven J Turmala Diamond Member

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sayed D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as as part of a 1 week long holiday in singapore. Hotel was in the marina bay area. The latest place to go to in singapore. Room that i received was really beautiful. comfortable high bed, ample bathroom space, tv channels that goes on and on. In terms of view, i got the city view. Which was satisfactory. Bellhop were friendly. overall nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable high-end property with excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: ymff
Reviews.Content: Getting to Hotel: Taxi from airport S$25 approx. 25 mins in light 2am traffic. Location: Across street from SunTec Centre. Check-In: Fast. Very smooth. Elevators: 6 fairly quick. Room: 1721 at end of hallway. Non-smoking. Large sized room with ample space to walk around bed and desk. Safe: Yes. Too small to acoomodate laptop. Didn't expect this problem with an otherwise very well appointed room. Bed: One king size bed. Wall maounted bedside lamps. Very comfortable with no sag or lumps. Very clean. Windows: Large floor to ceiling glass along one wall. Small window in side wall. Blackout curtain effective at blocking sunlight. View From Room: Good view of fountain roundabout at SunTec centre from main windows. From side window could see giant ferris wheel and Marina Bay Sands hotel. Room Lighting: Very well lit when all lights on. Noise Level In Room: Very little airconditioning noise. No noise from adjoining rooms. No noise from street level. Closet, Drawer and Cabinet Space: Drawers in large closet area as well as cabinet in front of TV. Bathroom: Large. Tub and shower. Lots of mirrors. Good lighting. Magnifying mirror. Higher end amenties. Water pressure strong. Hot water very hot after a while. No bidet. Room Cleanliness: Very clean. No smoke smell - smoke free. Air Conditioning: Very effective. Could easily adjust between hot and cold. Phones: Phone on desk. Phone bedside. Phone in bathroom. Sitting space. Chair at desk. Extra chair. Small sofa chair. Desk: Large. Stong table lamp. Power socket nearby at cabinet near TV but no easy power socket at desk. Desk chair not comfortable to extended working at desk. TV: Large LCD. Mounted in wall. Alarm Clock and Wakeup Calls: Alarm Clock. Alarm with phone. Wakeup calls booked with reception were right on time. Iron: None. Robes: Yes, as well as kimono. Slippers: Yes. Umbrella: Yes. Morning Newspaper At Door: Yes, from choice offered at check-in. Fridge: None. Not much space in mini-bar for own items. Microwave Oven: No. Tea and Coffee in room: Complimentary coffee and tea. Drinking Water: Complimentary bottles provided in room replenished daily. Other amenities: Chocolates in room on first day. Fresh fruit replenished daily. Conrad Teddy bear and rubber duck to take away. Room Service: Very fast. Good food. Usually hotel prices. Turn Down Service: Yes. Breakfast: Buffet breakfast at restaurant at lobby level. Included in room rate. Extensive choices. Excellent service. Restaurant: Only used for breakfast. Gym: There - did not use. Pool: Very good pool for swimming laps. 23m lenght. Perfect temperature for swimming. Very clean pool area. Bottled water available at gym near pool. Parking: Did not use. Staff: Polite and very helpful and efficient. Check Out: Fast and efficient. Return: Taxi to airport S$20 took 25 minutes at 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location - near anything you would need”
Reviews.Author: AkulaTheShark
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights for business. If you are into walking, this location isn't too far from the riverwalk. Very clean, excellent service. The only odd thing is that I was travelling on business, I needed to iron a shirt and pants. This isn't possible as there is no iron or ironing board in the room. I was told I get free pressing the day I arrive but I arrived at 2am so I wasn't able to get anything pressed. For the money, I should have an iron. I don't like looking like I live in a suit-case.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Allowegian
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in November, and had a great stay. The room was wonderful, the breakfasts were great. We were upgraded on arrival, and it was my girlfriends birthday. That evening complimentary chocolates appeared in our room, and later whilst enjoying drinks, 3 staff appeared with a cake singing happy birthday. It made her day. Thanks so much for the hospitality. We will stay here again next time we are in singapore. Euan and Susan

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Rachel B
Reviews.Content: Had a good experience. Good service and attitude from staff. A very comfortable stay afterall!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlinDenver
Reviews.Content: Good service, nice comfortable room, great food, fast internet and friendly staff .

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY hotel in Singapore... (wait, there are others?)”
Reviews.Author: ChaunceyGardiner
Reviews.Content: I was puzzled when someone mentioned the other day that there were other hotels in Singapore… that, frankly, had not occurred to me in a number of years. I’ve been traveling in and out of SIN for almost 20 years. I’ve bunked at the Shang Valley Wing, the Shang Sentosa, the Grand Hyatt, the Sheraton, the Intercon, Swissotel/Westin Stamford, Fairmont/Raffles Plaza… and others. …until I stumbled onto the Conrad. Since then, I’ve not darkened the door of any other hotel… and I have no need to. I had two visits to the Conrad on this trip, and it's still possibly the best managed hotel in Asia/Pacific, this is a hotel which is both warm and also crisply efficient. Whether it’s pressing a jacket or printing pages, things here happen effortlessly, and with a smile. The rooms are spacious, but it’s the beds that differentiate it… especially those high density feather pillows. One of these days, I’m going to break down and buy two pillows to take home (they’re available in the giftshop for SGD160 each!). Easily the best sleeps I have outside my own bed are at the Conrad. Recently, they upgraded the bathroom amenities to Acca Kappa... Did I take the leftovers with me? Yes, I did. Oscar’s, the all day/night dining is nice, although I think the buffet is a bit overpriced. Plus there are numerous restaurants around the hotel, so you’re not out for food choices. (Try Bel Mondo, across the parking lot for nice Italian) Since I’m Diamond level, I get upgraded to Exec Lounge access, and that just makes life better. A large lounge, with good distance between tables, and it’s open late. Impressive breakfast, and you can certainly substitute a lounge visit for dinner if you wish. Excellent wine selection… usually 3-4 very nice whites and 3-4 very nice reds, and usually a high end Champagne. (More hotels could learn from this… I’ve been to too many JWMs or Grand Hyatt’s where the wine is plonk… not the Conrad.) Internet access is solid throughout… wireline or wifi in the room, and wifi in the Lounge area. I always return, and I always look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “simply amazing !”
Reviews.Author: elliemaybelle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from 8th October to the 15th October in an executive room. We arrived late and very tired after our 12 hour flight and we were treated like royalty, nothing was too much trouble for them, throughout our entire stay every staff member we encountered were fantastic, a special mention to Jasper, Aquamarine, Apple, Noah and Siana in the executive lounge, simply wonderful ! Our room was on the 24th floor over looking the fountain of wealth and it was perfect, very comfortable (if somewhat high for my little legs) bed, lovely bathroom stocked with really good amenities (don't bother bringing your toiletries as no need), good TV but not many UK channels on it and very nice cd/radio player. The breakfast, afternoon tea and high tea in the executive lounge was more than enough for us to not need eating out in the afternoon or evening, and the evening drinks were superb, although I do wish they had the ingredients for a Singapore sling !! The Promenade station is a two minute walk away as is the Suntec mall, you have everything on your doorstep. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, we love it, so much so that we have already booked again for June next year.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its best”
Reviews.Author: RideIndian
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is situated near the business district and has some of the loveliest views of the Old parliament house and cricket pitch besides the marina . The room interior takes your brath away with the luxurious feel and trappings ...many hotl rooms would fit inside the bathroom of the conrad and that speaks of the luxury and comfort this hotel offers. A great buffet breakast with local delicacies overlooking the pool and certainly one i will remember for a long long time.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best.”
Reviews.Author: dr_iggy
Reviews.Content: I have to sing the praises of this place. i stayed here a few years ago just after it first opened, and was very impressed then. I think it is even better now. Amazing staff, beautiful rooms... and the new Esplenade train station just under Suntec City. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A true home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: anncie10
Reviews.Content: A stay at Conrad Singapore, I can say is an added feather to the entire pleasure visit I had to Singapore. I have also had a chance to stay at a few other hotels located at Tiong Bahru, Yet i am happy to come back to Conrad, if i get a another chance. Though the pricing on the higher side, it is really worth every penny you spend. The artifacts, the collection of cutlery, the choice of color in upholstery, the laundry service, the housekeeping service and the amicable nature of the hotel staffs, the minibar at the rooms, and the list goes on the pros of this huge 'monument' I would say admist the tall buildings of the city. I wish you also enjoy the same enjoyment i had. Have a happy trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: GandTonArrival
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times on short business trips to Singapore. The hotel is close to the 'financial district' and not too far from the new Marina Bay Sands development. Rooms are nice, quite large with good sized TV, desk and wireless (expensive unless you get included). My only complaint is the very limited room service menu. Yes it's Singapore and there is a good food hall near-by but at the end of a long work day, good room service is a necessity for the business traveller. My meals were below par and very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Omkar19
Reviews.Content: Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent Excellent

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourites”
Reviews.Author: Bunehop
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Conrad more than a dozen times and despite staying at some very good rival hotels in Singapore I keep coming back to the Conrad. It is first of all convenient for me being close to my company office in the Centennial Tower but it is also a favourite in its own right. My corporate association with the hotel gets me into the executive lounge which obviously makes me positively disposed to the hotel. It is a wonderful experienced after a long flight being escorted immediately on arrival to the separate executive lounge check in and if on the rare occasion there is a delay on registering tea, coffee or anything else you want in the way of refreshments are immediately provided. There is pretty stiff competition in Singapore among hotels so when I talk about a favourite I am talking about something special. The nearby Mandarin is also first class and if anything its service is even more personal but a little too over the top for me. The Conrad has the right balance but this is a personal preference. I have seen one comment that the rooms aren't big but the standard rooms are about average for 5 star hotels in Singapore. I have also seen a comment about the high price of rooms and this is true but again the rate is similar to the 5 star hotels in this area and about half the price of Raffles and cheaper than the new Marina Sands. It is really a cost benefit equation so when I get a good breakfast, cocktails and the rest in the mix I still see the price as competitive in the market segment. This is foremost a business hotel in the business district, the package hotels of Orchard Road are not a proper comparison even if they claim a similar star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service , small rooms and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: M_Coxell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for couple of days on business. Had a few issues with room - two single beds rather than Queen which would've preferred , room on small side compared to Other 5star chains,lighting controls antiquated . Room service requests took too long. And No free wifi Internet which is poor given the high price of approx US$350 per night. Unimpressive product overall, expected much better and would stay elsewhere on future.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: go4bows
Reviews.Content: I was on business but my husband was able to join me. We were in a club room, since we are diamond members. And wow .... The Club was fantastic, with a great breakfast, mid-day, and evening spreads, with plenty of good food and drink. We went down to the restaurant for breakfast on only one morning, and although that was really nice, I preferred the gorgeous view and intimacy of the Club. The room was very nice and very comfy, though not very big. I think someone made a comment about 70s decor ... Hardly!! I thought it was very nicely decorated. The location absolutely could not be beat. I like the Marina area where the Conrad is located MUCH better than the Orchard area. I would definitely stay here again, no doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine198
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by the room. It was excellent with a great view. Service was outsanding starting at check-in to check-out several days later. Room was spacious with all the amenities. The gym was actually quite good for a hotel gym, and the outdoor pool is very nice. Hotel is located in a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and high quality.”
Reviews.Author: lightTravelerAU
Reviews.Content: This is not the cheapest hotel in Singapore. However, it is great value for the quality of service they provide. Staff are very helpful. Make sure you get the breakfast included in the room. It's great value and a very high quality breakfast. Location is great and close to shopping / local sights and some great choices for food in the local area. Great for business / shopping holiday and sign seeing. Concierge are always very helpful and offer great advise.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to my Conrad expectations- would stay there again on my next visit”
Reviews.Author: farawaymum
Reviews.Content: Except for the front check in staff who seemed clueless and tried to downgrade my room , the hotel and other staff were very good. I stayed on the top floor in a room with club lounge access- the layout of the floor is excellent - it felt very private and safe. The price was reasonable representing excellent value. The lounge itself is outstanding in terms of the comfort, attentive service and quality/range of food offered.I was only there for 1 night but found the location of the hotel to be convenient to the airport - plus taxis are very cheap- I paid $14 SGD for a trip from the hotel to the airport on a Sunday morning. As an aside , Singapore Airport has to be one of the most efficient and fast I have been through- Hong Kong airport immigration please take note!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Patrick S
Reviews.Content: The main reason of picking this hotel is because of the location. It is just next to the convention centre which I was attending the conference and trade shows. The MRT network makes this place is even more convenient to any other part in Singapore. There are also a few shopping malls nearby which made us never feel bored. Service provided by the staff here is great. They are all professional with efficiency. Always wearing a smile when I see them. If there is anything to complaint about this hotel, may be its the room price. The price I was paying is way higher than what I was paying last year at one of their compeitors nearby.

Reviews.Title: “This must be THE hotel in the Marina area!”
Reviews.Author: andrew23
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor has this hotel ranked third, but I reckon the Conrad is the best in the area. Everything here at this is hotel is just flawless. The rooms whilst it may show signs of age, they are very well maintained. The beds are so comfortable, you'd find it hard to want to leave the bed in the morning. The buffet at Oscar's is ever-changing and the Golden Peony is truly a Chinese fine dining restaurant. To top it all, the staff are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty76Australia
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Conrad Singapore which was for 3 nights. The room was lovely and the bathroom nice and clean. They included everything you would need. We were offered the upgrade to executive room when checking in. My recommendation is to fully read what you are getting before saying yes! We had the spiel from the reception staff and thought it sounded good but when we got to the room and read the full details we realised it wasn't going to suit us. We have just spent 3 wks travelling the Himalayas so was short on dressy clothing. There is a dress code for the executive lounge which was smart casual with no sandals or shorts. My husband rarely wears anything but shorts plus this is Singapore where it is hot. We were also told that internet was available at the lounge but upon reading the form it was only 1 hour per day. For the cost of the upgrade SGD120++ per night we could've paid for internet in the room and breakfast. We tried the breakfast in the executive lounge the first morning and Oscars the second morning. Oscars won hands down. Although it was noisier there was a lot more variety plus a fresh egg and waffle station. The staff were all very friendly which was really lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: scruffydog79
Reviews.Content: Booked the suite to accomodate my wife and family for make-up before proceeding to a restaurant outside of the hotel. Despite the fact that the hotel staff knew I was not using their restaurant for the wedding dinner, they made us feel very welcome and were generally accomodating to our requests here and there eg, asking for extension plug and wine bucket + glasses etc. Executive lounge was very nice, quiet. Peaceful ambience and definitely above average quality food. Only thing was I found out later online that my guests staying the room next door were entitled to the use of the lounge as well, the front desk didn't seem to make that clear and our friends could not join us upstairs for breakfast and tea breaks. What a waste! Only regret was our stay was too short, and we could not sample the hotel restaurant's food more closely. Look out for guest executive Xinyu, Maria and conceirge Ron. Very courteous, attentive towards hotel staff. Much better than my experience at some other 'good' hotels. Their staff training must be good as generally the hotel staff were generally helpful without being too intrusive. We'll definitely be back for another stay!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: snokie
Reviews.Content: I stayed there again for about 4 weeks and enjoyed every single day. They really care for their guests with an honest aspiration to let you feel beeing very welcome. It´s a perfect hotel for business meetings and well located close to two MRT stations and huge shopping malls. Taxis are always available also. The views from the hotel are very nice actually to both sides, the fountain of wealth or the city skyline. I discovered that most guests choose to have their breakfast inside but if you stay there you should also have your breakfast outside. It´s just wonderful sitting in a sofa enjoying the pleasant Singapore climate below the soft breeze of a classical ventilator drinking a freshly made cool orange juice. The rooms are always kept very clean and the staff is just amazing. Asked for topics to impove I´d say, there is nothing really to mention. My personal wish would be some new sharp knifes or a selction of some different butter for breakfast but these are really minor things. Compared with other Conrad hotels I stayed so far this one is the best of them. Overall they do an oustanding job individually but also as a whole team. I am very much looking forward to my next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Some of their service going downhill”
Reviews.Author: piggy_pig
Reviews.Content: usually stay in the Conrad for business trip, have not been here for more than a year and noticed that the service is going downhill. This time I asked the concierge to make reservation for dinner on the next evening, told me that will leave a message in my room after it's done. Nothing came until the next morning through so went back and asked for the status, dig out a piece of paper and told me that it's fully booked and said that they planned to leave the message in my room that day, again nothing. Second incident, asked me for the choice of newspaper in the morning, but not a single one show up, why bother asking me. Third incident, charge me laundry service which I did not use. very poor service standard! But need to give credit to those looking out for taxi, take good care of the guest!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maryamac1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Conrad on our first leg of a holiday to attend the Rugby World Cup in New Zealand to celebrate my husbands retirement. Our stay was faultless. The attention of the staff was outstanding and on our second night a bottle of wine and box of chocolates were left in our room as a gift to celebrate his retirement. Breakfast was exceptional with so much choice it was dificult to know where to start. We had only booked two nights but wish it could have been more. The location of the hotel was perfect. Close to shops and many major attrations. The customer relations staff in the lobby could not do more to help and were on hand all day. There was a nice atmosphere in the bar in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Consistency breeds perfection. Almost.”
Reviews.Author: mdns
Reviews.Content: This is my -nth time staying at this hotel. Reserved an Executive Room, however, it felt like this is the smallest Exec room I've been in at this hotel. Luckily the view out of the grand windows are still great. Good food and service still at the Executive Lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel (from a Diamond level perspective)”
Reviews.Author: larevue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel the last week of September 2011. Please consider this review is from a Hilton Diamond member. Entering a stunning lobby - although there was a semi long line to check in, as the staff brought over a juice while we waited - I slipped that I was a Diamond and lucky to score a room considering it was the week of Formula 1. I was quickly whisked away to the executive floor for check in...service, room, and food - all outstanding. Decent location - close to Singapore Flier and Marina Sands - China Town. Executive Floor social hour was among the best of Hilton - and the breakfast in either Oscars or the lounge was delicious - SOOOOO many choices. P.S. In your room, you could choose from 16 pillow choices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BunyipJr
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is in a great location and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast was outstanding! We unfortunately were given a room with two beds instead of the king suite we had booked.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Thomas M
Reviews.Content: I usually visit about 10 hotels per year in a variety of continents and star ratings, and this is one of the very best services I have ever met (along with most Taj Hotels). Arriving at the hotel quite wet from a sudden shower, I was immediately handled a towel at the reception, and got an upgrade to the Executive level. There were lots of small marks of attention every evening: a small gift on the pillow (different every evening: some chocolates, a small teddy bear...), a note on the weather forecast the next day, huge choice of pillows... Only small drawback is the location, not necessarily the most practical depending on your interests.

Reviews.Title: “This was so wonderful”
Reviews.Author: holidayhappiness76
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Marina Bay Sands and being so disappointed we moved to the Conrad Centennial Singapore. This hotel was amazing. The service was so amazing and very personal I had to tell the manager myself how impressed we were. At check in the lovely young lady took us personal up to our room showed us how to operate everything and told us that if we needed anything at anytime to just call. It did not stop there. From the magic person who put the music on in our room when we were out, to the bed being turned down, the chocolates and the fruit beside your bed, the slippers on a silk mat this was all part of the service. I truly felt like royalty. If in Singapore I would highly recommend you stay here. Yes it gets better. A Gym were they give you gym clothes to wear if you want. Free cold water in bottles to drink a very special looker room with amazing showers, creams and everything that smells so yummy to use as you want. It was so good that we would stay there again for sure and recommend our family and friends to stay there as well. They have a departure lounge by the pool with tea and fruit and biscuits to eat. It was really a great place to stay. It had affordable eating places right next door at the Suntec building and shopping and endless shopping close by. It ticked so many boxes and created some new ones and ticked then too!!!

Reviews.Title: “True Business Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesnLizby
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore for a conference at the Suntec Exhibition Centre and stayed at the Conrad Centennial just 5 mins away.. Though the facade of the hotel may not be appealing, but the interiors are true to the Conrad brand.... The experience was good and the business centre was well equipped.. Reception, Housekeeping, business centre people were all fantastic and friendly...

Reviews.Title: “Simply faultless”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas C
Reviews.Content: Three nights in August 2011: credit where credit is due, the hotel and service were quite simply, faultless

Reviews.Title: “Simply devine”
Reviews.Author: Veryhappy75
Reviews.Content: What a sensational room. Great service. It was our 20th wedding anniversary and once we had checked in the room. The reception sent us a beautiful roche chocolate cake. Housekeeping, club reception people were all fantastic friendly and oblidging. The room you could not fault. Very very clean bed fantastic and overall. We stayed in a refurbished room and was great. Great for family, business, romantic couples.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a little update”
Reviews.Author: berray
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but afraid it's looks a bit tired. Pool area is not good and gym needs updating. Buffet is avg. But service is outstanding. Also prefer to be walking distance to orchard rd

Reviews.Title: “Great room, fantastic staff, good location, i've had better breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: dougly
Reviews.Content: Spent Labor Day weekend with family in Singapore on my way to Indonesia. Some may find the Conrad poorly located away from Orchard Road but I loved having the underground malls (and restaurants) so close to the hotel to avoid SG heat. The room was quite large, very clean and beautifully appointed. As expected in Singapore, the staff was lovely and welcoming. There was a modestly sized fitness facility with good cardio machines. The pool was fine- I like the pool at the Pan Pacific and the Fairmont/Swissotel more. It is a pretty small pool area for a large hotel. Breakfast was fine I think the Swissotel has much better selection at its breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Icy483
Reviews.Content: We stayed last april 2010 for 3 days.. We were in the executive suite and everyhing was just fantastic. Staffs were all friendly and helpful. I love having breakfast in the executive lounge..food was YUmMY!! Our room was facing the fountain of wealth :) love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good but has been better...”
Reviews.Author: Punkyoz
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times over the last few years and while it is still good, and great value, I think it may be on the slide a bit. The good - great rates, Mimi's Calamansi lime margaritas at the pool (not on the menu - you have to ask. But she will do her best to get it for you), fast and friendly check in service (my feet did not touch the ground from getting out of the taxi to being escorted to my room) and a not too bad location now that the Promenade and Esplanade MRT stations are open and it is directly linked to the Marina Shopping centre. The not so good - I think "too reasonable" room rates are attracting a 3 star kind of guest to a 5 star property. At breakfast I saw a women forcing food into her mouth with her finger and another man gnawing on a chunk of bread like a beaver. Not a good look over breakfast. They do still have the waffle and icecream station at the breakfast buffet - just what you want on holidays! I'd probably give this property one more go.

Reviews.Title: “Boomerang Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claire298184
Reviews.Content: Throughout the year I manage to travel a fair amount and stay in a variety of hotels in different locations. However this is one hotel I find myself returning to again and again. There is nothing I dislike about this place. The staff are friendly, helpful and usually very cheerful. The rooms are great and the breakfast is divine. The pool is great, so is the gym when I feel so inclined to visit. The rooms are big with all the amenities you want. For me the location is ideal. Close to the airport and easy to get around. Suntec is just opposite and many shopping malls are within easy walking distance. Orchard Rd is a short taxi ride away or a few stops on the metro. For some strange reason I always feel sad when I leave this hotel. The ambience for me is just perfect. I thoroughly recommend this place and I am already looking forward to my next stay in December.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Convenient & Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum7078886
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for a week, executive floor. It's our second time there. Great family place and would highly recommend for families. Service was impeccable and the rooms were very comfortable. Convenient location as you are surrounded by shops, food, and the MRT. About the only thing that I thought odd was breakfast at Oscars (main floor dining). There was not much local fare served for breakfast. They had the usual American breakfast buffet, but not much local food, which I much prefer. Not to worry though as you can always cross the street and head to Food Republic for the local stuff. Pool was excellent, and the gym was well equiped. Again, the staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 5 star”
Reviews.Author: cmcmcm1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Centennial the past weekend for 2 nights. Due to a late flight we did not arrive until past midnight and they immediately offered a late check out until 4pm, which was much appreciated. Sadly they did not have a double-bed so we stayed in 2x singles. This is a solid 5 star property and the location and views are great. You are connected to the Suntec shopping strip so pretty much access to all the major shops, restaurants of all sorts, cinemas, etc. on your doorstep. As stated previously, service is excellent. Breakfast is great - the only place I have stayed where they have ice cream for the first meal of the day, awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Supercalifragilistic.......!!!!”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaniacGoa
Reviews.Content: Boy oh boy what an excellent holiday I've had in Singapore and at Conrad!!! The hospitality par excellence is so natural,warm and comfortable. The stay there is indeed an unique world of style, service and connection.The staff is so polite,hospitable and service at it's best from housekeeping to concierge, Executive lounge to guest relations and the staff at Oscar's and room service( all I experienced) upto duty managers....hats off to the service offered! As bubbly as the overflowing champagne to as healthy as the green tea and sinfully delicious as the chocolates was the service and platter offered.I think the Lounge service is the best that I've experienced. Ha...ah...my favourite day dream...only to be at Conrad, Singapore again.I felt so special from the moment I stepped out of the cab..to the departure.Concierge is excellent , helpful, warm n courteous.House-keeping was meticulous and the bath room...oh so large and well provided. I could have done with a lower bed though!I suggest one books through the front office or duty managers...they were more approachable than reservations over the phone. It was my birthday during my stay and I was pampered to say the least! On my return after two nights....I was floored and honoured to be upgraded to the Centennial suite!!! Anybody who works hard and wishes to splurge on themselves and have a supercalifragilisticexpielidocious (to say the least).....Conrad Centennial Singapore is the place.....believe me! The duty managers are uniquely adaptable and hospitable. Go right ahead...living there is experiencing and believing and wanting to come back more and more and everytime you enter..any time of the day or night, at the door itself you are greeted with a "Welcome back" and most of the concierge staff will even address you by name (some training this!!!) Until my next...Conrad's teddy and ducky cheers me night and morning!!!.

Reviews.Title: “5-star stay!”
Reviews.Author: gjchan
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Conrad. The breakfast was hearty and the room was great. The bathroom was spacious and the bed was sooooo comfy!!!! It's a great place to stay in,esp if you're an F1 fan or if you want to be near the Fountain of Prosperity, which my husband and I wanted to visit as soon as we arrived in Singapore :)

Reviews.Title: “True 5-star”
Reviews.Author: Armadillob
Reviews.Content: I stayed for multiple weeks in Conrad in Singapore and have to say - it was extremely pleasant every time. Service was outstanding and the ladies in the exec. floor came to know me quite well. Breakfast options are amazing and food service in exec lounge in evenings is best I've seen. The only minus comes from smallish rooms but that is covered by the amazing view from the hotel! Overall, one of the best hotels I've stayed in

Reviews.Title: “The best business hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Sfran10536
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate to travel to Singapore on business over the since 2004. I have stayed at other hotel and I have no complaints with the previous hotels I have stayed in Singapore. I was upgraded to the Executive rooms and had a bay view room. The room was excellent and the bathroom was luxury. The two things that impressed me the most was the standard and quality of the Executive Lounge and the standard of service. The breakfast was just right for me and allowed you to start the days in a relaxed fashion with wonderful views over the Marina Bay area. The evening buffet was as good as any Exec Lounge I have been in. The quality of service was beyond anything I had experienced in any hotel. If others reading this review are considering booking an Executive room, do so without hesitation. Another factoring in choosing this hotel is the location. I believe this is as good as you get in Singapore. Hopefully one day I will get the chance to return.

Reviews.Title: “great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Ikura
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across from the Central Station subway entrance, adjacent to a mall and an underground food court, and walking distance to the Convention Center and water. Very convenient. Excellent service: the receptionist remembered my name two days later when I ran into her. Nice touch. The room was spacious. The all-marble bathroom was luxurious. The only complaint I have is the lack of a nightlight and a light switch outside the bathroom. This meant that middle-of-the-night visits woke the other person because one had to turn on the light, then close the door.

Reviews.Title: “great stay-will come back”
Reviews.Author: patu7
Reviews.Content: spent 6 days at the conrad.Welcome inviting atmosphere. helpful and polite staff. Close to the subway and is walking distance from thr marina bay sands and 2 large shopping malls. HOuse keeping done twice a day,clean rooms. Breakfast buffet has many options. One drawback was that the food ordered via room service on one occasion was bad and was sent back-but the money was refunded without any problems

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic fantastic service!! although tired and outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: kaneblack1
Reviews.Content: I am now at the Conrad on my last night of 3. I must say that having read all of the other comments here only goes to prove how much great service wins the day in any hotel or restaurant. The service here in the Conrad really is superb! the staff are fantastic and go way out of the way to help, which is amazing. Compliments of my Diamond Hilton status, we are staying on the executive floors. The lounge at the hotel is great with a wide choice of wines, food and again great service. We have chosen, due to the wider selections, to eat breakfast daily downstairs at Oscar's. The buffet breakfast is a little limited compared to others, but more than adequate. The issue with this hotel is that the rooms are tired! the rooms while very comfortable have been furnished in the late 80s/early 90s and unfortunately while the hotel owners have spent money on other areas of the hotel, they have hardly spent more than £5.00 on the rooms, gym and pool area since the hotel opened. This is a real shame as the service received here is right up there as the best I have seen! So all in all.. I have stayed here before and will stay here again due to the fabulous service... but be aware.. the rooms are old 90's style and a little tired. but alln in all a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: GRDorkings
Reviews.Content: Usually stay at the Hilton Orchard, but their rates are getting out of control, so saw the Conrad on the Hilton website and the rates were much more realistic. This hotel knocks socks of the Hilton on Orchard!!! The place is much more modern, the staff are great, the breakfast was good and the overalll value for money is much better. I will be back again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: adymu
Reviews.Content: We were for the first time in Singapore. As I am a HH Diamond member, I decided to stay at Conrad Singapore - and I will definitely not regret that. Everything is just perfect at this hotel. The staff is really helpful, they helped me even after my check-out! (I had a problem with a luggage so I had to buy a new one. They kindly assisted me, they offered me a private space for that, a drink, a coffee, and they helped me also to get rid of my old luggage. The staff was really friendly and helpful, and all those even AFTER I checked out!) The room was very nice, with a really nice view (25th floor, with a nice view at the Wealth Fountain). I was surprised by the bed size (it's really huge, and probably about 1m height - the biggest bad as height I ever had :) ). It was also probably the cleanest room I ever saw in the Hilton Chain. You can enjoy at Conrad Singapore a really good breakfast, a combination between asian food and Hilton traditional breakfast. If you have a complementary lounge access, you will be also impressed - from the service to the great view, everything is made just to be perfect. (the Lounge is at the 33rd floor, with a nice view to the Marina Bay ) From all my stays ever, I can definetely name this one as my best stay - the staff is the most polite, kind and helpfull staff I ever met! Geat job, great hotel, probably the best one in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Still great ... after all these years !!”
Reviews.Author: GDDSydney
Reviews.Content: I used to travel to Singapore regularly for work (several years ago) and always loved the Conrad. So when we decided to spend the weekend in Singapore earlier this year, I was automatically drawn to Conrad - despite having other (newer) hotel options around the 350 price mark. It was a familiar feeling walking into the lobby; the check-in process was smooth and we were escorted to the room by one of the attentive staff. The room was nice; we had booked a king bed which was very high to get on/off. However, the city views from atop this giant bed were great. Breakfast in the restaurant had a wide range of options. Internet access in-room was a bit fiddly - but lobby's free wifi was a decent alternative. Overall experience was great ... but I couldn't help thinking that a room refresh (bathroom fittings in particular) would help keep the Conrad above the rest.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Needy elephants
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels and i go out of my way to spend a few nights here when travelling. It's well located,next to a bunch of shopping malls and a lot of day tours start across the street at suntec. Executive lounge access is worth the extra money and really love the extra high beds.

Reviews.Title: “The best.”
Reviews.Author: Coghlan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel a few times over the past couple of years and always in their Executive rooms with club lounge access. This would have to be one of the best hotels in the region in every aspect, simple as that. It is a must try if you think you have stayed in a very special hotel, this one is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: TheWebsters
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times and have never been disappointed. Executive lounge is very good, buffet breakfast is superb and staff are very attentive. Location is in the business district, but not too far from main shopping areas. We are always made to feel welcome every time we stay and are hoping to return next year. The teddy bears are a nice touch. We are hoping to add to our collection!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and food but small rooms and discriminated business lounge.”
Reviews.Author: Kontirom
Reviews.Content: Great staff with rich buffets. I have stayed at the 31st floor as I had been upgrated due to my diamond status. The rooms are small and rediculous dress code for entering the business lounge. While maybe on your vacation rubber sandals and shorts not allowed. Ok next time I will bring my tuxedo along. The definition of smart dressing code at this hotel has stayed back at "Governor Raffles" era !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a great and quiet service”
Reviews.Author: French_Aussie
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights in this hotel and was very happy, every person was helpful and friendly, for example when you ask for the ATM, they don't just show it, they come with you outside to make sure that you will find it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dbabaran
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and 2 sons, staff was wonderful upon checking. Lobby is large and elegant. Requested an upgrade to the executive rooms as we are gold members and were given a great room with pullout couch. T His helped lots for our 7yr old. Rooms and bathrm were large and elegant. Preferred to have breakfast in restaurant vs executive for as more variety and with the kids it would be easier. Coffee was excellent. Hotel provides a free shuttle to central bus district at 7:30 & 8:30am, this is noted in the information of hotel in room but I found out here on this forum from another reviewer. House keeping was great as well. This hotel is 5stars all around. You will not be disapointed. By the way another reviewer suggested eating at italian resto across from hotel and I 2nd that! Delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Marie_Calary
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - exactly what one might expect from a Hilton chain

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, great bathroom and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ezgoing77
Reviews.Content: Right from the moment we checked in, where the front desk officer showed us to our room (not too sure if thats the standard treatment or not because I used my Hhonors rewards stay), we liked the service already. Bathroom is spacious and luxurious. Only slight complaint is the bed is a bit too high, but it is still very comfortable. Breakfast served at the 4th floor salon was good in terms of variety and coziness too. We went with our two-year boy, and we could tel he enjoyed the 2 nite stay too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, good perks”
Reviews.Author: MTRose
Reviews.Content: First trip to Singapore. Stayed 4 nights here and were very pleased with the service, the room, and perks you get being a Honors member. The welcoming fruit basket and constantly stocked free bottled water was nice to have. Very comfortable bed, clean room and bathroom. Close to subway, lots of shopping, the esplanade, and historic district. Lots of choices for restaurants nearby, starbucks close too. Staff helpful with money exchange, and holding our bags (since we had a late flight out). Pretty good rate too considering what we got. We'd stay here again as long as the price stays reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and service - rooms a little tired”
Reviews.Author: 20clicks
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is near the main conference venue in Singapore, and reasonably well located for business meetings around the island (although the MRT is 10 mins walk - taxis are generally plentiful). There are good restaurants nearby, and even an up-market hawker centre (worth a visit), as well as shopping and cultural. Downstairs there is a large restaurant where breakfast is also server - quite a good breakfast, although it can get crowded / feel rushed. There is also a quieter venue on the opposite side of the lobby which is great for a coffee, tea or a light snack. Service is excellent - and check-in generally efficient. The rooms I have stayed in have tended to be a bit 'traditional' and tired - nothing to write home about, although they are a good size and seem wider than longer (so plenty of outlook). The bed is great, and the desk large, although I always seem to have problems with power outlets and internet cables reaching the desk (why is this so hard?). They leave lovely tea 'bombs' and chocolates in the room, as well as a couple of bottles of water (good for Singapore). The fitness centre is a bit small (and often crowded), but the pool (adjacent) is quite nice. The lounge has a decent breakfast (but no where near the range of downstairs), and the drinks and canapes usually quite good (but beware - the lounge is small and can get quite crowded). Price are generally not cheap - there is arguably better value to be had in Singapore (although prices vary wildly - including nearby - so worth hunting around), but if you can book a little ahead it is generally reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: WakeUpHappy
Reviews.Content: The reception area in this hotel is very nice, but our room look a bit dated. The room was however spacious and the beds were really comfortable. Breakfast was amongst the best I've had in any hotel, and the hotel service was top-notch. Location was good with easy access to taxis and the metro. Internet was expensive. We had a great stay at this hotel, and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: moobaby214
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and great rooms! Service with a smile! Great executive lounge. Grand bathrooms with everything you need. Employee's who really do go the extra mile to make sure you are satisfied. My 2nd home in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel and Excellent Loation”
Reviews.Author: ATLconsultant
Reviews.Content: I read the disappointed reviewer's review and I can see why some things would bug that reviewer. What s/he had to say about the electrical outlets is spot on. Very very few and you have to sit down in a chair to dry your hair because your only option is by the TV and the plug is so low to the ground and cord so little that you can't stand and do it. So, that does bug a bit. I think because the property is older...that it has few outlets. I'm actually surprised during the re-model (looks like it was re-modelled about 8-10 years ago) that they didn't add more outlets. Maybe the infrastructure wiring wouldn't support it and was way too costly to change the infrastructure....i dunno. The rooms are nice and spacious but besides the 46" Sony HD TV, it's not as modern as many of the other 5 star hotels I've stayed at in Asia. For instance, the curtains and shades are all manual. A bit rough as they've planted the work desk directly in front of the curtains. The carpet is high quality berber (with nice padding) but not the thick artfully designed carpets you see like they have in the walkways and lobby and like most 5 star Asian hotels have in the guest rooms. It's like a variation of tan and matches with completely tan chairs made of light wood. So, it becomes very bland very quickly -- too matchy matchy. Clearly a gay man did not decorate this joint. Haha! They need to hire a gay dude!! But if you compare it to Hiltons in the states, it's quite definitely 1 to 1.5 stars higher in service, quality, and decor. Plus the bed was SO comfortable as were the high thread count lilnens. I got upgraded to an executive room and the lounge is uber posh. Probably tied with JW Marriott in Mumbai as the nicest executive lounge I've ever been in. Tasteful and plush carpets and art. I'm gonna give the award to JW Marriott due to its size (roughly 3,500 square feet and options for seating) but this one isn't far behind. There were fireworks last night and you could see them SO well from the 31st floor executive lounge. The wine there was of good quality and the food items were also quite nice for a nosh. The lobby is very opulent and the service is friendly, kind, and sincere. I had housekeeping bring me an iron this morning and before she came in the front desk called me and said that the housekeeper was outside my room but could not knock as my "DND" light was on.
