Nice touch. I let her in promptly and apologized. Haven't eaten the food. There is a substantially sized food stall in a mall across from the hotel (where you get on the hop on hop off buses) and the food there is terrific plus it's SO much cheaper. It's actually affordable. That's saying something in a country in which a Big Mac is approx. $7 USD and a Heineken beer at a bar is about $14 USD. OUCHERS!! I'd stay at this property again, being a Hilton Gold member. The hotel is adjacent to the Mandarin and the Pan Pacific. The PP hotel, from the exterior, seems to be more posh than either this property or the Mandarin...they definitely have a nicer pool than the Hilton....but....don't know about the rooms until i actually can see into them! My hope is that they'll modernize the decor in the next 5 years. Right now it's very 1998 Old Money decor. Get hip, Conrad! I've seen some of your other properties. You can do it here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: amirali10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the centennial suite at Conrad for 3 nights during our recent family vacation to Singapore. We found the hotel location very convenient, right next to Promenade MRT and the Suntec City mall with a host of shopping and good eating options nearby. The suite had a separate sitting area with a large screen TV which allowed us some alone time after the kids were asleep. We had a partial view of the Marina and full view of the fountain. Hotel staff was OK. Great breakfast with highlight being the amazing ice cream they served, which our kids had with the waffles. All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: DD12345_00
Reviews.Content: Well, disappointing…I stayed in a double business room (single use non-refundable was over USD 300.00 per night, breakfast not included). So… yes the reception looks expensive and stylish, but the room …well I could not escape the feeling of “back to the 80’”; the furniture and bathroom looked a bit dated. Plasma tv was refreshing the impression in a way, but the room did not look like a business room in a 5* star hotel. The hardest time I had – was with sockets. After I disconnected plasma I hardly managed to find 2 I guess. So if you have a notebook; ipod; 2 cell phones and a camera to charge and at the same time you want to boil some water for the tea and use a hairdryer it’s gonna be a bit complicated; and even more funny if you’re in two. I mean, hello, it’s 2011, it’s Singapore where people are changing devices and gadgets like socks and you have 2 sockets in a business room. It’s certainly not a disaster but they are definitely loosing a few points here. The breakfast: the buffet is about USD 30-35 (no comments); the food is ok; but there were a couples of times when I had to look through the whole stack of plates to find a really clean one as some of them were badly washed! I mean you could see the traces of food left! That’s the first time I come across such a thing in a hotel; and I used to stay in quite a wide range of them from guest houses in India to luxury hotels in Dubai. The pool: the pool area is ok; but again there’s “but”. If you wanna have some sun in the morning (i.e. till 12:00) you will have to drag your sunbed into the corner close to the exit from the gym which is at a certain distance from the pool and cannot even be considered a pool area. The pool itself and pool terrace are overshadowed by the hotel building till 12:30-13:00 when it’s already too hot. Besides if you want to order a drink you will have to spend some time trying to find someone from the staff who could help you with that. Some time ago we were staying at Madarin Oriental in Kuala Lumpur – we had a deluxe double with park view for around USD 200 per night and the whole impression (I mean everything - service; rooms; food; hotel amenities) was impeccable. I know Singapore is more expensive than Malaysia, but still I don’t think Conrad lives up to declared standards and certainly not to prices charged.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent comfortable and convenient hotel in heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: CeliaPerry
Reviews.Content: All of the personnel were excellent and hepful, we only had one minor problem at the hotel itself which was quickly and thoroughly resolved and one day when the servicing of our room was sub standard, but again, quickly corrected. The only poor service we had was from the central booking service and Hilton Honors from which we had mis-information and contradictory figures. It was a struggle to book and we' had to make long and expensive international phone calls from both Belgium, where we live and Australia, which was our first destination before things were sorted out. One warning: there are two Hilton hotels in Singapore so make sure you say Conrad and /or Centennial if you use a taxi to get there. Tour buses leave from a point just opposite the hotel, where there is also a huge shopping centre with a food court, so you can adventure out or stay near the hotel and find everything you need. Food at the hotel is excellent. I recommend the Changi Museum which gives a good overall history of Singapore not just of the infamous prison. For spectacular views, take the cable car or visit the Sky Park which is on top of a tall building you can't miss seeing on your way into the city from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: LU39
Reviews.Content: Had a five night stay at the Conrad and enjoyed it lots. Staff are friendly and trying to help wherever they can. A question that did arise was how the daily newspaper allocation was done - one day there was on the other day not - no big issue though. room was spacious and the bathroom wonderful. Unfortunately the doors of the rooms cannot be closed in any silent way and hence one might be woken up in the middle of the night by a door getting shut. Being in jetlag this was a bit annoying and hence there are only four stars on this rating. Did enjoy the fitness centre multiple times and would have loved to take a dip in the pool which is not small.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and well located”
Reviews.Author: joycekwong
Reviews.Content: It's the second time I stayed at the hotel, it is well located and service is good. The rooms were quiet for a good night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Comfort”
Reviews.Author: PackToGo
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Centennial continues its tradition in providing genuine comfort in the Lion City. If you wish to avoid the crowded Orchard Rd. tourist area and won't mind taking a short stroll from the subway stations, its location is ideal for a quiet hideaway. Its top floor executive lounge offers outstanding views and a more exclusive private setting for breakfast, (very nice) afternoon tea and evening treats. I prefer this over Oscars even though it may offer a wider food selection. Perfect spot to unwind or escape the heat. This is the only hotel in Singapore I would repeatedly stay in over the last decade and was not disappointed. Choose a room facing the Merlion and be captivated by the skyline's night view!

Reviews.Title: “Sublimely elegant hotel...”
Reviews.Author: rIcK1985
Reviews.Content: This is a very polished, high end hotel as you'd expect from the Conrad brand. It's a large hotel yet still manages to have a personal feeling to it. What I would say though is that the hotel is more adept in dealing with business clientele, though discerning leisure travellers would easily feel at home too. We stayed in the club rooms which were fine, large and comfortable, with all the amenities that you'd expect. For a hotel this size, I thought the breakfast was a bit underwhelming, not in quality, as everything was pristine and as you'd expect from a high end hotel, but it lacked variety. I have stayed in a number of 5* deluxe properties, where breakfasts have been far more superior. Nonetheless, this is a minor point in the wider scheme of things. The hotel's well placed for seeing the sights with shopping centres and countless restaurants within walking distance. The service is top-notch!!! Really polished, and attentive. I wouldn't hesitate booking this hotel again, but perhaps families with young children should steer away, unless you are after a more sophisticated 5* experience. This hotel, whilst still 5*, is at the upper end of this scale and therefore not as leisurely as, say, the Marriot or sister property, the Hilton, which I'd say are standard 5* properties in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Roberto275
Reviews.Content: Centralized location near to office buildings, great shopping mall (suntec nearby) and a short walk to the newly build marina bay sands area Stayed here numerous times and the service is always impeccable. Staff are always friendly and smiling, doing their best to provide and help hotel guests to the best of their abilities

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: trippingpig
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Centennial Suite and really enjoyed fabulous luxurious facilities and service. The bed was a bit high for wee ones - we had to keep reminding them not to fall off it, but extremely comfortable. They have a pillow menu where you can choose from 13 (I think) different types of pillows, including the porcelain pillow! The kids loved the complimentary matching bears and trademark rubber ducky. The fresh local fruit, and complimentary bottle of wine and truffles at turndown were very welcome! The hotel is more of a business hotel, with a relatively small pool, but certainly adequate for a city hotel. The food at Oscar's was great, and we'e dined at the excellent Peony restaurant before too. It was our 5th wedding anniversary and we had held our wedding dinner there 5 years earlier. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a wedding dinner with excellent food!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: yss97
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night for a meeting and was very impressed with the service generally. Nice breakfast and lunch buffets. Could be improved if there was free Wifi for longer than the first 15 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Service was great could not find one thing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: vickidfenton
Reviews.Content: Awesome awesome place to stay, service is impeccable every detail is looked after for you. Lucky enough to get an upgrade so use of the business lounge was super, great food and drinks and a wonderful view of Singapore. Good location for shopping and catching the MRT.

Reviews.Title: “My Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Vardomannen
Reviews.Content: Singapore is one of my all time favourite cities, and the Conrad is part of the reason why. I have stayed at several of the 5 star hotels in the Lion City, this one just has that little bit extra. The staff are great, and always welcome you back to the hotel on arrival. Rooms are spacious, beds soft, and if cleanliness really is next to godliness, then the domestic staff really deserve halos. Bathrooms are huge and well stocked. The views from the higher floors of the hotel, especially at night, are great. Location: opposite Suntec and the convention centre. There are two huge shopping malls in the immediate vicinity, and several smaller ones within minutes of walking. A new MRT station has now opened since my last visit, and is accesible though an underground tunnel from Suntec. I stayed on the executive floor; love being spoiled with their afternoon cocktails and snacks, and to judge by the amount of people who were in the lounge during cocktail hour, so do a lot of other people. And here's one huge, huge plus; children under the age of 12 are not allowed in the lounge! It's not that I am a child-hater by any means, but for me the mix of alcohol in free flow and small children just doesn't quite gel. Ate breakfast in the lounge one day, and downstairs in the restaurant the two other days simply because I love the choice that is on offer down their (including nasi lemak). The Conrad isn't cheap, but then Singapore isn't a cheap city when it comes to accommodation. However, you do get what you pay for here, and the service is impeccable. This was my fifth time staying here, and it won't be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Real 5* quality, amazing Executive Lounge.”
Reviews.Author: maved
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at slightly lower standard hotels; maybe 4* Hiltons and the occasional 5* property. Well, wow, the Conrad blew me away. The service from every staff member I encountered was excellent, and can hardly fault the hotel. As a Hilton HHonors Gold member I was given executive lounge access on the 31st floor; the service in the lounge was excellent, with top-quality food and drink. The room literally had everything I could ever want; and this was a standard 'Classic' room. Huge bed with top-quality cotton sheets (so smooth!), massive 47"(?) TV, huge bathtub, etc. I cannot fault the room. The location was not perfect for me as a tourist, but taxis were cheap and there is also a subway station nearby. Thanks Conrad - for a great time in Singapore. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “My new 'regular' hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: FrankDrebin
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller to Singapore and have typically stayed at the same 1 or 2 hotels during these stays. The frustrating thing has been that I have never been able to take advantage of my SPG status either for redeeming nor earning points. Subsequently I have started to build up my points/status with Hilton Honors and I was very excited to try the Conrad Centennial on this last trip. Well located in the Suntec City complex of shops, office buildings and hotels, the hotel is in a great location for not only this area but also central to the financial area, Marina Bay Sands, Clarke Quay and more. First Impressions: * Great location/easy to/from Airport..Suntec City etc etc * Grand lobby and very attentive valet/doorman etc * Check in was courteous (a little disorganised for my particular reservation but it was a last minute reservation so it hadn't hit their system properly)(was asked to join Hilton Honours despite my # being on file! etc.) Room: * Not huge but spacious. Nice clean/modern/functional bathroom with separate tub and shower. * Modern flat screen tv, central lighting etc.. * Good work desk facing out the window and highly functional. * Con: Another hotel that doesn't seem to have 'preferred' floors for it's status members or for Exec Lounge guests..so you could stay on the top floor or the bottom one and still have the same access and room type..very odd considering most hotels reserve their top floors for their top guests etc. Bathroom: * Not huge/not small..just right! * Seperate bath and shower (with good pressure) * No complaints Executive Lounge: * Top floor..amazing views * Upscale but not overly so. * Very generous 'all day' drinks (including alcohol)..quite unusual for most Exec Lounges. * Great service and despite getting quite busy later in the evening, service always regular and professional. * TIP: Arrive at 5:30 or close to it to get the preferred tables by the windows! Pool & Gym: * Open to guests and public 'members' (not great and makes busy times even busier!) * Decent machines although they look a bit dated. * Chairs are a bit cheap but otherwise great pool area with plenty of space. * Wonderful bar staff..very attentive and accommodating! (Tip: Chicken/Mango wrap is delicious!!) * Good strong WiFi signal out around the pool * Poolside food service was great. Summary: Overall this is a great hotel and can't really fault anything about it. Highly recommended, especially for business travellers and looking forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: MaximusOliver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, and exactly what you would expect from a Conrad. Due to status, we were upgraded and had access to the executive lounge. Definetly a great place to work and relax. Staff was amazing as expected

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TonyB_au
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently when I travel to Singapore. I have business in Suntec City and this hotel is just across the road from the office so it's just perfect for me. Basically, it's what you'd expect from a Conrad hotel. Excellent service, rooms, food - everything. Faultless.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel that is centrally located and provides great service”
Reviews.Author: Leedertoy
Reviews.Content: I often travel to Singapore on business related matters and this is the hotel I prefer staying in. Its location is central. You can get to major places of Singapore from here quite easily. The hotel is well maintained and the management does a great job. The staffs are highly professional and perform their duty well. The services offered are great. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with king sized soft beds. The atmosphere is clean and peaceful. The bathrooms are provided with adequate amounts of high quality toiletries. There is a nice swimming pool and a good fitness centre at this hotel. I rarely use the fitness centre, but the swimming pool I never miss visiting. I always have loved my stay at this lovely hotel, and so I recommend it to my friends and relatives too.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the room”
Reviews.Author: riteshsuneja
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, varied menu, room service is excellent and facilities provided for stay are maximum.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Executive Club”
Reviews.Author: Thompsons-Abroad
Reviews.Content: Great location and very efficient service- we were sipping wine in the excellent club lounge within 50 minutes of touchdown. Plenty of shops and dining options on the doorstep and close to two MRT stations. Big rooms ( for SIngapore) and very comfortable. Our only gripe was the lack of a night light to guide you to the bathroom - all or nothing bathroom lights at 3am is a bit much! But that's being ultra-picky. This is the nicest city executive club hotel we've stayed at after the Hilton in KL. Really generous with the food and drinks and first class service all the way. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “It's like going home!”
Reviews.Author: Davred
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed this hotel before, but having stayed there half a dozen times in the past 12 months, and never being let down in the slightest way, I felt I just had to sing the praises of this property and its team again. I work quite regularly in Singapore and, if my clients will permit me, always stay at The Conrad. As you walk into Reception you can just feel the tension of the flight begin to melt away because, frankly, they make their hotel a home away from home. I know everything is recorded on the computer, but there is always a friendly and genuine "welcome back", more often than not I get a room at the end of a corridor because my sleep is easily disturbed, there is a contoured pillow all waiting for me, and staff members actually come up to me and converse. It is all just done so naturally and easily that The Conrad becomes a haven away from the pressures of travel and work. OK, I know I travel a lot and I know I'm a sensitive little traveller who delights in being looked after. The Conrad just meets my needs every time, and even though there are new hotels in town, it is the service and the sheer ease of staying here that makes me return again and again....well, you've got the picture!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Saksatien
Reviews.Content: I spend two nights in June 2011. I stay in a standard single bed room. The bed is quite high than usual. So if you have a small children, watch out from falling from the bed. But that is not a problem. The bedding stuffs, pillow and blanket, are so comfortable. The sleeping quality was so well. The bathroom is roomy, clean, and classy. The bathtub and shower are separated. There are a wide range of bathroom amenities, and the quality are good. I only had a breakfast at the hotel. The breakfast is just about average, not so much selection, and there is nothing special. The only negative side of this hotel is the location. It is quite a bit far from the MRT, and a bit far from the main shopping area at Orchad. It takes about 15-20 minutes by walk to go to the MRT. It is quite close to the Marina Bay Sand, the casino. You can take a cap, or even take a 20 minutes walk cross the bridge over Singapore river. The service is excellent. The staffs are so friendly, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but very good”
Reviews.Author: bcheong
Reviews.Content: Check-in was ultra friendly and perhaps I'm a hilton gold member, got escorted to the room by the front desk staff. The business floor room was large and 1 of the first things you notice is the super high bed. Thankfully there's a shower stall. The flat screen tv is huge but alas the channel selection is somewhat limited for a 5 star. Conrad has the special teddy bear and rubby duckie for you to take, good for kids and the young at heart. Internet was also free for gold member or business floor guests. Good room but the small pity is that it looks a little worn. The room service was good , as to be expected. The business floor breakfast at the Salon by the pool was great; selection was amazing though the only slight downside was some of the local items pale in comparison to taste compared with the hawker stalls

Reviews.Title: “Good property, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: eton1970
Reviews.Content: Well managed and maintained property. I always tend to see the General Manager around which is a good sign. Gym and rooms could stand a bit of an update but overall an excellent business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best in my book”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Drew2
Reviews.Content: Over the past 4 years, I have been to this hotel 3 times and I still love it. The service is impeccable. They don't skip a beat and it is a class act property. From check-in to check-out, I always feel welcomed and taken care of. The rooms might need to be renovated/updated in the near future but they are still very nice. The executive lounge is the best I've encountered in the Hilton family. No matter the time of day, they always have snacks or fruit available. Now that the Promenade and Esplanade MRT stops are operational, it is even more convenient to get around Singapore. It's also a nice walk across the Helix Bridge to the Marina Bay Sands. The breakfast at Oscar's is just amazing and the service is the best. When I think of Singapore, I automatically think about the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from a Conrad”
Reviews.Author: DDCHK
Reviews.Content: I typically stay here for business and have done so many times over the past 5 years. Everything you need as a business traveller with a bit of luxury. Staff are professional, rooms are a decent size. All rooms, except for the suite, I believe are the same. The difference between an executive and standard is access to the executive lounge, which is a welcome break for free drinks and snacks. I would recommend this hotel, even for tourists, unless you'd like to be in the middle of the shopping area which is Orchard Road. However, around this area are other hotels surrounding the Marina Square mall (mid-scale), the Sunted City mall and is not too far from the new Marina Bay Sands hotel and shopping mall (with high end as well). I like the understated elegance of the Conrad; It is positioned as the more luxurious brother of the Hilton and rightly so as the staff is more professional and attentive without being overly familiar. However, with the recent renovation of the Hilton on Orchard Road, that hotel now charges higher than the Conrad. I believe that has also something to do with the Conrad beginning to show its age, which is why I rate it a 4 instead of a 5. But the service here is dependable. A tip on the bedding. I don't know why hotels in Asia insist on placing duvets on the bed when it is warm here in the region thus requiring airconditioning. I usually ask the duvet to be removed and replaced by a bed sheet and a blanket. Also some may like feather pillows which I find too soft and without support for my head. I ask the hotel for foam pillows in addition to the spare one they keep in the wardrobe.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the experience and the culture”
Reviews.Author: Wru61
Reviews.Content: Very very customer oriented staff members, convenient location (close to my work place) and my the view from my room made for a great stay at the Conrad. I had a room facing the fountain of wealth which might have been just another fountain (except from 8 to 9 pm) but was a source of a feeling of abundance and plenitude to me. I especially loved the Hotel Toiletries at this hotel. The frontdesk staff was very well trained and made for a smooth check in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: YvKatJu
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed at the Conrad while on a short shopping trip to Singapore. We had never stayed here previously and decided to book because of a great deal we found on hotel.com. We arrived very early in the morning ( 3 am) and were checked in reasonably quickly. The room was lovely, the bed super comfortable and the pillows magnificent! Our room was part of the Executive package... breakfast was delicious, the complimentary lounge for drinks and nibbles superb! The staff were very happy to help and always friendly. We loved our stay and all the hotel offered. I will definitely book again on my next trip to Singapore. Suntec has some great eating places and lots of market type stalls. Love KuishinBo Japanese at Suntec. Hotel is very close to all amenities if using the MRT. Just as cheap (or cheaper) to take a taxi if more than 2 travelling locally.

Reviews.Title: “they are outstanding”
Reviews.Author: snokie
Reviews.Content: I just have to write the review allthough I still stay in this hotel at the moment. Yesterday I sat in the lobby just relaxing and observing and saw that an elderly couple had problems with the stairs in the center. Immediately one guy from the staff rushed over and helped them kindly accompanying the couple to the elevaters. I liked very much to see this kind of attendance and when I later used the lift back to my room, I commented to a staff member also using the lift that I like the service quality here in this Hotel very much and she really left me speechless behing when she responded, "Thank you Mr. S........" Wow, she knew my name and the hotel is definately not very small. I´m still impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Service excellence!”
Reviews.Author: Burpy
Reviews.Content: The best hotel with the best staff ever!! ESP those in the club lounge! Staff are so friendly, attentive and sensitive to needs! A must try if in Singapore!! I'll definitely be back!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “A decent 5 star hotel well located in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Manoj_Poddar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in their basic king size rooms for 4 nights in May 2011 at about 350 SGD a day. The hotel is nice, centrally located next to promenade station and sun tech city - the premier mall. The rooms are nice, clean and well maintained but the room ssize does not seem to be anywhere close to what appears on the pictures online. The stay was without breakfast as breakfast for an indian vegetarian at propmotional cost of 30++ SGD is too high as one can easit get decent meal for about 10-12 SGD at near by sun tech restaurants. The staff was courteous and room service slow. House keeping was good and the hotel had all the basic amenities, It was surprising that the hotel does not have a decent health club with sauna steam or jacuzzi. At about 300++ SGD i would rather suggest Pan pacific to those who want to stay at this location or at 250++ carlton, Goodwood, peninsula, would be better choices as one can get cheaper or complimentary breakfast there. Intercontinental with bugis street shops and plaza would also be a good choice, My advice to tourist would be not to get carried away by advertised rooms sizes as in terms of carpet area, rooms are pretty much the same size in all these hotels. I am thankful to the hotel staff for providing us with few complimentary beds and not charging me extra for the 18- kids accompanying parents. The hotel wads decent value for money but ideally i would not wanna pay more than 250++ for this hotel. They also provided us with unlimited drinking water at no cost. The rooms are with a big tv and dvd payer, one may easily get movies from the front desk. There is also a writing desk and good view but swimming pool is quite simple. Overall i would rate this hotel as 7/10 in general and 8 /10 for being gracious enough to provides us a few special leverages. Taxis/ Cabs in Singapore are expensive given the various peak hour surcharge, city surcharge and erp etc so for those wishing to move around using MRT (the underground metro rail system) i would suggest staying close to Dhoby Ghaut MRT in hotels like regent, inte continental, pan pacific services suites etc if they can get the same for under 300 SGD++ as this would reduce traveling time and cost.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed, we will be back everytime here only"”
Reviews.Author: rachnasuneja
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business meet at singapore, his was an official trip, i had planned to join him on 2nd day i.e. which we had planed to convert his stay into couple stay after his official work is over. Day 1: So to begin with, his initial stay with hotel during hi office hours was very professional and best. As is evident, after days work he enjoyed the hoth bath and a wonderful sleep in his most comfy bed. The room was equiped with wireless internet facility so was great with his official work also. Day 2: When i arrived at hotel, irrespective of my any kind of introduction, i was greeted by staff in my first name, that made me very comfortable as i was in foreign land. The lobby was awesome and tastefully decorated. The room was decorated in very comfortable manner. bed linen and curtains were perfect. From our room, we got a spectacular view of Fountain of wealth. Day 3: As it was our first trip to singapore, conceirge staff greatly helped us in location various places of our interest and finding suitable transport modes. The conceirge staff after my brief intro of interests, promised to make an itinary of places we coul;d visit in holiday duration. the itinary covered all type of places. The Food: Ahh the delectable one. After coming from city tour,me and my husband had a hot bath and then watched some dvd. Around 1 pm, we both felt hunger. We were surprised to find so many dishes on all time menu. We ordered fish n chips and pasta and told them to make pasta a bit indian style i.e. spicy. To our surprise fish n chips were yummiest we ever had. so soft n mouth dissolving was the fish. the pasta was made out style.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad - Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: parekhbhavikc
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Conrad Singapore. My previous stay was at Shangrillas. But I was quite impressed with the hospitality. The buffet and menu was quite elaborate for vegetarians like me who generally face lot of issues getting the right food while travelling abroad. The staff was very courteous and helped me a lot with umbrella and arrangements for my business meet on a rainy day. Look forward to come back

Reviews.Title: “re: Such Luxury”
Reviews.Author: KilbroganHouse
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Centennial is a wonderfully luxurious hotel in a very convenient, central location close the MRT. My room was very well appointed and the bathroom had all the expected luxuries. I chose this hotel as a night's stop over en route from New Zealand to Ireland. I stayed in the Fairmont on the way out and if I had to choose between these two amazing hotels, I would probably favour the Fairmont only because the view directly over Raffles is so amazing and secondly because of its wonderful spa facilities. As far as the bedroom was concerned, the room at the Fairmont was more spacious but both were really excellent in terms of comfort! I made this choice based on tripadvisor reviews so thanks to other reviewers as well as to the hotel itself for such a memorable stay. This hotel lived up to the reviews!!

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing property!”
Reviews.Author: BiztravellerSydney
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Centennial Singapore is an amazing property, stylish but full of personal touches and service. We stayed on the executive floor (a must for great value and attention) and found the accommodations plush, and the service personal and attentive. The executive floor rate includes breakfast, afternoon tea and evening drinks and canapes, so was terrific value. What I loved was the attention taken by staff to remember our names and offers tips and advice suited to our travel needs. On each occasion, they went the extra distance to meet our needs. The room service menu was excellent/varied, and very cost competitive (Around $19 AUD for a signature burger!). When the pianist starts playing in the bar/reception area at night, you know you are somewhere special. I will make this my Singapore residence for future trips. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Conrad with young child, exec lounge, free taxi shuttle to CBD, shopping/tours across road”
Reviews.Author: onstam
Reviews.Content: We were warmly welcomed by 4 different staff "Welcome to the Conrad" as we took the short walk from getting out of taxi to reception desk, and our daughter was welcomed with a Conrad Teddy at reception. A colouring book set was in the room awaiting her. Executive Lounge - no kids policy - but allowed us to book the meeting room so we can enjoy the exec lounge with our young daughter with us. They had food offering at breakfast (you can swap it for the breakfast at the main restaurant which offered so much more choice), 2-5pm afternoon tea and 530pm - 8pm canapes. The seating for us with our daughter in tow, was in a private sofa lounge room or a dining area that was attached to the meeting room. It was more private than sitting in the main exec lounge. M-Fri they had a free morning taxi shuttle at 730am and 830am into the CBD. My husband found this useful to get to work as he didn't have to join the long morning taxi queues with other hotel guests. Depending on which side you exit the Conrad hotel, but for the Suntec shopping centre/ tour compayy counter (and departure point for Duck bus/boat tour and and open top sight seeing bus), you just had to walk across the road. If you take the Conrad exit on the other side, Millenium? Walk shopping mall (not great) is infront of you. That is linked to the Marina Mall (great shops/restaurants). AThe MRT is a minute's walk (if that) and an underpath that takes you right into Suntec City Shopping mall. If you have a stroller, look out for the lift to the underpath opposite the Conrad. Before I booked, I hesitated staying at the Conrad due to their no kids policy in their exec lounge but I went with it anyway based on location for touring, shopping..and with the hope of getting a Mandarin Oriental/Four Seasons quality & service. It certainly delivers and I am pleased we stayed here. We did the Fairmont before arriving at the Conrad, and the food quality in the Conrad's executve lounge is much, much better. Also for the same room category (one bedroom suite), Conrad's suite was by far bigger, newer and cheaper than for what we paid at the Fairmont. We look forward staying at here again on our next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Admirable Service”
Reviews.Author: traveller_sangee
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Conrad, and the last i visited Singapore was 9years ago. Many things has changed and i prefer the City Hall rather to the Orchard shopping district as it was away from the hustle & bustle. Conrad in a small hotel compared to the surrounding hotels however the service was certainly excellent. I had slight issues with the reception as i came on an early flight at around 9am and the rooms were not ready yet. When requested for a best view, they told me that all their view is nice and when requested for a king bed, they told me a request was a request and it was subjected to availability. The reception did not even try to check in her computer, her answers came very spontaneously. The check in process was very slow despite the number of staff that they had behind the check in area. Since my room was not ready, i was assisted to a shower and changing area by a lady name yuana from the concierge counter. I would not know that conrad offer a changing and shower area if i had not asked for a map, the reception counter staff did not take the initiative to ask me if i needed any assistance. Since i was on business and only had the evenings and weekends free, she gave me very good suggestions on how to maximize the opportunity with the little time i had. Her knowledge about the surrounding area, the culture and the attractions was truly admirable. She was always cheerful and polite. On one of the free evenings that i had,I was recommended to try the night safari by the same lady , instead of whisking me into a taxi, she took time to explain that there are other way to get to the Night Safari. Since i was alone, i took on her advice on taking the zoo bus that was a 5min walking away from the hotel. As i was new to the area, she even showed me the way to the cash machine and later walked me to the area. Another gentleman, Roy also made me felt really welcomed he always greeted me and asked how my day was. This was one of the best business trip that i had. Both the staffs made me feel very comfortable in a new place.They were very warm and sincere. The suggestions that she gave me like visiting the Botanical gardens, having my lunch at Maxmel Market, the night safari and having my jog at the east coast park on the weekend had allowed me feel like i was on a holiday. Although the room that i got was a twin bed, the view however was stunning it was the marina view on the 20th floor. They also had fruits and chocolates in the room. A plus point was the gym was open 24hrs. I had a great stay at the Conrad despite the slight problem that i faced upon check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: pauly1976
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel and will def be back in the future. Right near the marina and has lots of restaurants attached

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with excellent service for city visit”
Reviews.Author: Brianluxury
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Singapore for many years and knowing that service standards can varies quite a bit in Singapore, Conrad definitely deserve a mention on their friendly and fantastic service. The staffs are extremely well trained and attentive and you are greeted with big smiles everywhere you go in the hotel. The rooms are big in Singapore hotel context and the bed is excellent. Definitely, will stay here again when we come back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but more suited to Business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Pikelhead
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late at the hotel (midnight) and stayed in a twin bedded room. Travelling with 2 Adults / 2 young children (3 & 5). Unfortunately, unlike most other twin bedded rooms I have stayed in Singapore, these beds are only 4ft wide so not ideal if sharing with small children. We booked our stay for 2 nights through Thomas Cook, and on arrival they took a copy of our booking for their records. Our booking included the breakfast buffet. When arriving for breakfast the next morning, the dining room team said our room did not include breakfast, so I had to go back up to the room to show them the paperwork which was photocopied the previous night. There is a pool at this hotel, but it is nothing special and definitely not ideal for children as there is no shallow end. The location for this hotel is great, surrounded by fantastic shopping complexes with a variety of restaurants. 2 minutes walk from the MRT / Fountain of wealth. I was concerned about taking Taxis in Singapore but need not have been. It cost less than SGP20 from Changi T1 to the hotel which was great and took about 20 minutes. I would say that this hotel is best suited to Business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “good without anything outstanding”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: It fits the Hilton chain with all the usual good things about the chain but we struggle to say anything memorable. Executive lounge (service and variety) was better than many Hiltons, staff greetings were profuse at all times, everywhere. We took it because of special offer of $280+++. Location is good but getting taxis in the morning not easy (like many S'pore hotels)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable good hotel”
Reviews.Author: iznogood
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business. I was not so happy with the room allocation as it was next to the lift so bit noisy. Also did not receive the usual upgrade to executive room. Rooms are good but a bit conservatively styled. Would be better to have iPod dock rather than cd player. Staff is pretty friendly. Hotel is a little big and busy not a very intimate feeling. Lounge closed too early at 23pm. Should really be midnight. Healy club and pool are good. The Tokyo conrad gives more luxurious impression and the nearby ritz Carlton also looks more modern but overall Singapore Conrad is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: deefletch
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at some top London hotels but this was the best hotel we EVER stayed in. All the little attentions to detail made the stay special. The staff are very attentive and courteous. The furnishings and decor in the hotel were excellent, and the fresh flower displays everywhere (also in bedroom) are beautiful! There is a huge tv (+DVD) in room and even a volume switch for TV in the bathroom! Bottled water is left out for you everyday; a bathrobe and slippers supplied, tea/coff, safe, beautiful marbled bathroom with huge shower, and lots of bathroom goodies. A huge, sumptuous bed with landscape windows with city lights view were great at night to look at! There are even MANY different types of pillows you could order ! The pool is a delight and very big for a hotel. Towels and bed coverings are changed as soon as people leave pool area, iced water supplied to sunbathers constantly as you lounge in sun! Theres a departure lounge next to pool with free drinks and biscuits for you to use after check out. Outside the hotel there are even cold flannels and water for returning joggers! Even the lifts have beautiful shattered glass on the walls! Its very central to the hop on hop off buses, just across the road. EXCELLENT choice of breakfast foods and great service. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone. If you go to Singapore, book this hotel. Its worth more than the five stars its rated as.

Reviews.Title: “Old but Gold”
Reviews.Author: kleeym
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights recently for company training - loved the location, just a stroll to Suntec and there is a nice German pub opposite the hotel that plays good live music. Back to the room, impressive size, not just the room but the king size bed, quite high in my standards but I slept like a baby for the next 3 nights! Loved the size of the bathroom too. Reception staff was friendly and even the room slippers were so comfortable. Didn't like the look of the pool though compared to the one I saw over at Mandarin Oriental. This hotel is 25 years old but still provides a modern environment and I did not notice too much tear and wear. I stayed in room 1216 maybe thats the most basic one as the fruit selection wasn't as fantastic compared to what other guests have reviewd. Overall, fantastic business hotel with a memorable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Quality, Location - This Hotel Ticks All The Boxes!”
Reviews.Author: Tomo119
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days in March 2011 (Room 2219 approx. 40 sqm.) overlooking the fountain & Suntec and thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our holiday. We booked a King Bed Business Room (incl. breakfast) which also included Pralines and fresh pieces of fruit & 2 bottles of Spring Water daily. Wonderful. SERVICE: From the moment we arrived at Reception, consistently throughout our stay until the day we checked out, the attentive staff were top class and nothing was too much trouble or a problem. We met some staff we had come to know who walked to our taxi chatting to us and to say good-bye - we were made to feel special. QUALITY: Our room furnishings, linen, bathroom amenities; all were spot on. Special touches: e.g. a linen mat with our bathroom slippers placed at each side of the bed each day. The bathroom was fully replenished and spotlessly cleaned daily which also made it a very comfortable stay. The ice bucket was filled late afternoon every day, very convenient. Dry Cleaning was always ready overnight.. Oh yes, the Buffet Breakfast (included) absolutely fresh and great variety - impeccable service! LOCATION: MRT, Suntec, Singapore Flyer, Marina Square Mall, MileniaWalk Shopping Mall, Marina Bay Sands and lots more are all within walking distance. Great restaurants surround the hotel (& within the hotel, including great room service). SHOPPING: We shopped at Suntec (opposite the hotel) with every store you need, including a supermarket and lots of restaurants, cafes. Use the close by MRT to go to shopping malls on Orchard Road, i.e. Paragon, Tangs, Mandarin Central etc.; Little India and the Mustafa Centre (24 hr. shopping & it gets crazy) perfume, electronics, clothes - everything! GENERAL: Walk down to the Singapore Flyer and visit the Kenko Fish Spa. A great experience with the little fish nibbling the skin on your feet. SURPRISE: We were celebrating our Wedding Anniversary and were amazed when a gentleman (The Customer Relations Manager, I think) arrived with a platter of fresh strawberries and luscious dipping chocolate together with a bottle of wine with his compliments. AMAZING and so thoughtful - where does that happen these days? Join Hilton Honors and receive reward points. This stay gives us a free night for our Cairns (Australia) holiday. I rave on, but I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here many times and still keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: NoneNixNada
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Singapore Conrad probably 15 times since 2005 and keep coming back. As a member of Hilton HHonors I have stayed here while as a silver, gold, and diamond member, and while the perks are certainly better as a diamond member, the service level has always been excellent, no matter what my level. I have stayed at the hotel as both a business and leisure traveler, and the hotel has met my needs in both cases. The hotel is relatively close to both the central business district, the shopping around Orchard/Scotts Road, and the Marina Bay Sands Casino (if you like to gamble), with all areas quickly reached by taxi. And, if taxis aren't your thing, with the opening of the new Circle Line section of the MRT, all areas are easily accessible via public transportation as well. I have always found the standard rooms large, well appointed, and clean, with comfortable beds. The suites, as expected, are even nicer, and the executive lounge, if you have access, has friendly attentive staff and excellent services throughout the day. Overall, based upon my experience I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great area, nice hotel but bad hygiene”
Reviews.Author: AnnieSKY
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, it's in a quiet area, but still has 2 malls surrounding it. De MRT station is very close. Check-in and check-out went smooth because we prepaid for the room. The room was cleaned each day and in the evening the turndown service left a neat an tidy bed. Everyone in the hotel was very friendly. The pool is not deep at all. The doormen at the frontdoor have often desappeared. The hygiene of the bathroom is awful. Even after complaining about it, nothing could be done cause the black mold has been there for years! Everytime a someone in the neighbouring rooms take a bath, you can hear the water going through the pipes. You get 2 bottles of water every day and fresh fruit. The last day you can freshen up yourself in the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “World Class hotel in the heart of the business district”
Reviews.Author: JasonFSydney
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Gold Member i had high expectations of this hotel and i can honestly say that this is probably the best Hilton/Conrad hotel i have ever stayed at. The rooms are perfect, the bed is amazing and the check service from start to finish was perfect. The pool area is great and well serviced and the gym is fully functional and full of machines. I was upgraded to the executive floor and had the benefit of breakfast, afternoon tea and drinks and canapes until late at night. In my opinion this is the only option for anyone staying in Singapore. Can't wait to get back there in a few weeks. Conrad well done you truly offered a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Seamless, Professional and Carefree”
Reviews.Author: PeterRipley
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Conrad for the first time. At first I felt disloyal to our favorite hotel, the Swissotel Stamford and its wonderful staff but they are pricing themselves out of the value/price category.We booked on Expedia but in future I would book directly on the Conrad website. On gets Hilton Honor miles and there are promotions that are as good as Expedia. We checked in after midnight and we were in our room with our luggage in about 3 minutes!! The next day we had our first of 5 breakfasts. Amazing, wonderful healthy choices, well-prepared Asian specialties, a nice cheese, salmon, smoked meat selection as well as regular breakfast items. We sat on the terrace and the same staffmembers waited on us every day. Lots of newspapers and warm and prompt service. Housekeeping twice a day and I mean complete housekeeping made the staff very relaxing. On arrival there were truffles and fresh fruit is replenished daily. Some guests have commented on the configuration of the TV but we really didn't mind. The screen is huge so the fact that it is on a side wall is not really an issue. Concierge service was also seamless. Forgotten eyeglasses on the plane and dinner reservations were handled quickly and more importantly effortlessly. We didn't have to worry about a thing. We only sampled poolside food and the late dinner menu at the bar. Extremely high quality. Have the Oscar burger. It's worth it. AS well the house wine is well chosen and the poolside attendant while not only charming was knowledgeable about the wine. We used the gym every day. It was never crowded and perfectly adequate. The machines all have TVs and it is a good incentive to keep exercising. We don't have the Hallmark Channel or DIVA here in Tokyo so some days I exercised longer I enjoyed watching so much. The gym's staff are extremely attentive and friendly. The gym has bottled water, juice and cold towels. Nice touches. As for sun, it is now around 1 PM poolside but if you move the chaise to the back balcony one can get the sun from around 10. Finally not one staffmember failed to greet us or open a door. Usually this is a bit much for me but after 5 days of no thinking and total relaxation, we came home rejuvenated. And isn't that what a vacation is supposed to do. Congratulations to everyone for a job well done and making our stay truly enjoyable. We

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: crwahwc
Reviews.Content: Hey, we hv had a wonderful 5 nights stay. It's only 1 min from Promenade station and sitting in between the Marina square and Suntec city. The hotel service is great! The swimming pool is nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: Magere1_2
Reviews.Content: Well deserving of 5* rating. Booked through Tripadvisor and more than happy with price. The place to stay in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location good room”
Reviews.Author: hwonder11
Reviews.Content: The bedding service is quite good. With the default setting music, warming Conrad bear doll on the table. Like this small details very much. Too bad the bathroom's lighting seems hasn't been checked for a while. The florescent light in the bathroom makes annoying sounds that eventually I have turn off the light to take a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Oaties
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for one night during our recent week long vacation in Singapore. We booked the Club Room and were not disappointed!! The wonderful staff at the Club Lounge overheard that it was my birthday and they went above and beyond the call of duty to make my day a most memorable one! Nothing was too much trouble, a surprise birthday cake arrived, box after box of chocolates, wine and big teddy bears. The lovely pool attendant made sure I was spoilt rotten with freshly popped champagne and more chocolates!! We have stayed in many hotels over the years, but the service received at the Conrad surpasses them all!

Reviews.Title: “Still good!”
Reviews.Author: Hburn10
Reviews.Content: I had another staycation here as my first was quite enjoyable. We stayed again at the Executive floor but at check-in at 2pm, we were ushered to a room on the 30th floor, but it looked way too small than my previous stay (although they kept saying it was the same room size) and the aircon was not working. After a few rounds including getting someone to fix the aircon, we were granted our request to be transferred to another room. The new room was on a lower floor but defintiely bigger, so the rooms are not all of the same size like what they said. Roy at the Club Lounge recognized me again, and I did not expect him to. His service was once again execellent and impeccable. The other staff we were served by was excellent in their own ways too. But I just want to highlight 2 grouses I had for this time: Pressing of items Offered complimentary to us at part of the package. It had slipped our minds and by the time we remembered, it was close to midnight. I called the concierge to enquire if the offer is still valid, and it was. I was asked what time could they return the pressed items, and I told them anytime the next morning is okay, to which I recieved an affirmation on. By about 12pm the next day, I still didnt get my items so I called the concierge again but this time was told that because I did not request for the express service, I would only get my items back at 7pm, which is after my check-out time. I told the lady so, and finally she said by 6pm then, in accordance to my checkout time. I had to call again at 5:30pm to ask for it before I eventually got them back. This small miscommunication ended up being frustrating because I was given different information that led to false expectations. Even more so, I had to contend with my sleep-wear Tshirt on the whole of the 2nd day because of this. Pine nuts offered at the Executive Lounge My guest and I are experienced the 'pine mouth syndrome' which is the experiencing of a bitter taste in the mouth which is caused by apparently certain types / species of pine nuts, and can last anything from a few days to a few weeks. We have narrowed the cause down to the pine nuts offered by the Lounge as our other visiting guests did not eat them and are spared from the annoying syndrome (we didnt eat outside out the hotel throughout the stay either). I came to this conclusion after doing some research on the syndrome. I alerted the hotel but all they could tell me was that they had investigated and didnt find anything wrong with their nuts. Admist the above incidents, I had yet another wonderful time and hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: SiljeVanilje
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 330am to find friendly staff ready to take us straight to our fantastic room. This hotel is a very nice 5 star hotel. Room service shortly after brought us food and we slept wonderfully in the nice room. The bathroom is great with a bath and shower and lovely finishes. The buffet at Oscar's is a must! We had a lovely dinner where we had fresh oysters shucked in front of us, a great range of seafood, hot dishes and great desserts. The wine was a little pricey but that is no exception as that is the rule for the whole of Singapore. Would absolutely recommend this hotel. Not to forget, the hotel gym and pool is also really nice. The gym has exercise machines (treadmills, crosstraininers, step and bikes) all with tv's which is nice. And they have fresh fruit juice if water isn't your fancy too. To top it off the hotel is right next to the best shops in Singapore - Suntec city. And down at the bottom of the fountain of wealth there is a fantastic range of restaurants that offer foods that should satisfy most.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed but Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: trinity72
Reviews.Content: After a 13 hour flight me and my husband had to wait over 2 and half hours for our room. When our room was finally ready it was 2 single beds not a kingsize bed which we had previously booked. There was a major error they had obviously overbooked rooms. Also we were disturbed several times even though we had the privacy light on. They offered us free breakfast that morning but that just doesn't cut it. We spent over £1000 on the hotel stay. It was a shame because on the positive note, all the staff were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Frenchyinhampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Singapore for three nights. We had booked an executive room, but as my partner used to be a very regular guest, they had upgraded us to a Centennial Suite. The room was lovely, the housekeeping staff were very efficient: the room was cleaned while we were out each morning and the turndown was done every evening without fail. All staff seemed to be wanting to do all they could to make our stay special. We did not try any of the restaurants as we had access to the Executive Lounge. The service there was also superb. They serve alcoholic drinks until 11pm and canapes until 9pm. The view from the Lounge is lovely. The hotel is well located, it has a good gym and a very good size pool. But it's the service from the excellent staff that make staying at the Conrad Singapore such an amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “TRULY MY FAVOURITE HOTEL IN THE WORLD”
Reviews.Author: emzamia
Reviews.Content: Truly the best hotel I have every stayed in ! I never forget the stay I had here and I am always wishing to be back. Have never been so well looked after at any hotel in the world. The decor was superb and the staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The hotel was cool and comfortable and a great place to arrive back to after a day out in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A comedy of errors – almost”
Reviews.Author: mmjjbb
Reviews.Content: Past experiences at the fabulous Conrad Hong Kong, along with numerous positive reviews on Trip Advisor made the Conrad Centennial Singapore our only choice when planning the Singapore leg of our vacation. Sadly, our experience did not live up to our expectations. Although we did find a few of the service failures rather humorous! Tried to check-in at the front desk and were told after a few minutes of phones calls we had to go to the Executive Lounge for check-in. Arrived there and other guests were waiting to check in with the single receptionist. Other staff encouraged us to take a seat in the lounge and they would come for us. They never did and we returned to the desk – that was now empty of other guests. The receptionist looked up and said, “Oh, are you waiting to check-in?” Not a good start. My partner and I had reserved a King, non-smoking Executive level room for two adults (I even noticed the same information on the file she pulled to process our check-in). I had also requested a Hilton standby upgrade for an additional $75.00 per night at the time of booking. After taking our passports and beginning the paperwork, she says – very matter of fact – “I have a twin nonsmoking room for you” – as though we weren’t supposed to notice, Upon pointing out we had booked a king room, she tossed out the old ‘we can’t guarantee a king bed at check-in’ response and made no reference to the upgrade request. I asked about the standby upgrade and was told that the upgraded rooms were not available. Seeing that I was not happy, she suggested a twin room for the first night and king room the next night. That was not acceptable as it would mean we would have to change rooms instead of sightseeing in the middle of the day. She then suddenly found a Premium smoking room and stated that ‘people don’t usually smoke in the smoking rooms’. I declined and decided to just take the twin room. Maid service was the most comical area during our stay. The first evening, while at dinner, the maid provided a turn down service for only one of the two beds. One turned bed, one bottle of water on the night stand, one set of slippers, etc…! Although a very minor point, it was rather funny considering our earlier issue with the twin vs. king bed at check-in. We left the room at 8:30A the following morning, returned mid-afternoon and the room was not cleaned. Went to the pool for awhile and the retuned at 3:30p and the room was not cleaned. Went out again and came back at 4:15P and the maid was just finishing up. A little late in the day? Went to the lounge for cocktails at 5:30P (turned the privacy light on) and returned at 6:30P to find a note under the door explaining they could not provide turn down service because of the do not disturb light. Understandable, but they had just finished cleaning the room less than two hour before! Why not just turn down the bed when you cleaned the room? Turned the privacy light off, went to dinner and came back at 9:30P. The maid, to her credit, must have come back around and provided the turn down service since the privacy light was now off. But again…for only one bed! They had just made up two beds a few hours earlier. Does the house cleaning staff not have a list of how many guest are in each room? Again, some minor issues, but for a hotel at the level of Conrad, in one of the most competitive hotel cities in the world, you come to have much higher expectations. Success is all in the details

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: frankik
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice stay at the Conrad mainly thanks to its staff. My only complain is the breakfast area which a bit noisy. I was offered to have breakfast in the business lounge the following day but the quality of the food was not as good. Aside from this I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanna44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my mother and sister, en route to Australia. We had inter-connecting executive rooms, which were ideal. The rooms were spacious and immaculately clean. The bathroom was huge, with every small detail considered. We enjoyed using the executive lounge for a peaceful breakfast each morning. The selection of breakfast was not as varied as in the main restaurant, but the benefits of a tranquil start to the day, with attentive, pleasant staff, was perfect. The hotel is ideally situated and the food was of a very high standard. The staff at the pool were most attentive but not invasive and quietly went about their day, looking after everyone in a polite manner. If I had a criticism, it would be that once turn down had been done, every single light was left switched on, radio playing, bathroom lights, the whole lot. It was just my personal choice to go round turning everything off and trying to save some energy! Would highly recommend this hotel and would be delighted to have the chance to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, well convenient location”
Reviews.Author: travelhappyMumbai
Reviews.Content: Conrad is a good business hotel, convenient location. The food is nothing to write home about though. Service is ok. Value for money. located within walking distance of the Marina Sands and the marina beach.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Juan45
Reviews.Content: I can't find a single thing about this hotel I didn't enjoy. The staff were very friendly, the check-in efficient, the room was large with a huge bathroom, They seem to have thought of everything even down to a jolly little yellow duck for the bath! The rooms must vary in layout as I notice some other reviewers complaining about the TV position, but ours was in line with the bed with the window to the side. Sadly we were so whacked from the flight and the bed was so comfortable we overslept and missed breakfast so can't comment on that. We checked out at midday but were allowed to use the spa facilities later that day to have a shower before we went to the airport. I've stayed in several hotels in Singapore but this was by far the best and I'll certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed! There are better hotels in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: acostin76
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews and knowing the Conrad reputation I had very high expectations of this hotel. I am a Hilton Diamond member so I usually stay at Hilton/Conrad hotels - after the great experience at the Hilton Kuala Lumpur we were anxious to stay at the Conrad Centennial. Before arrival they sent me an e-mail to enquire about my time of arrival - my last name was misspelled. Than, at arrival they gave me a letter from the General Manager (usual Hilton stuff) saying how great that I had chosen Conrad and "that they upgraded me to an Executive Floor Room". But I was not upgraded and was given a standard room with views towards the office towers instead of the downtown. Not being upgraded is OK because it's not a given - but seriously, at least pay attention what you are writing in the welcome letters and if an upgrade is not possible than give a room with better views to your loyal customers. The room, was nothing special. Good (not great) size, very comfortable bed but awkwardly positioned - you could not watch TV from the bed as the TV was wall mounted on the right side of the bed. Actually the entire hotel looked a bit old and in a need of an upgrade. Internet was free because of my Hilton Honors status otherwise was pretty expensive. Executive lounge did not have that many options compared to other Hilton hotels I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Hotel customer Feedback”
Reviews.Author: Itunesjamie
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with excellent staff and immediate shopping locations in the Suntec centre. The rooms could do with a rethink on how the bed is positioned in respect to the TV. The beds are positioned to look over Singapore which is nice if you like sky scrapper spotting. The TV is positioned on the wall to the side of your fed looking bed location. This results in having to watch the TV lying on your side with lots of pillows to support your neck correctly. Also the remote for the TV is in a plastic sleeve that you fight to make work as the sleeve pinchs down all the buttons. I have stayed numerous times at the Conrad and this TV issue has always bugged me despite customer feedback comments benign left. Great hotel and service - just don't plan on watching TV in a comfortable position from your bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot !!”
Reviews.Author: tintin089
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay in this hotel. staff amazing and the welcome outstanding. hotel over 10 years old but looks great. loved it

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Rob007Kent_UK
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel in February 2011, having read the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. We would agree with all of the positive comments in earlier reviews. The hotel is about a 20 minute drive from the airport (taxis cost about SGD $15). It's ideally located for Marina Bay and the MRT (Promennade). Our room was upgraded on arrival and the check-in was smooth and efficient. All the staff we encountered were so helpful, especially the concierge. Our room was modern and comfortable with all the usual extras. The pool is a decent size with plenty of available beds and is in the sun until late afternoon. We ate breakfast at the hotel and in one of the many local Cafes (which was much cheaper than the hotel). We would not hesitate to stay here again and would highly recommend the hotel for a stopover in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “It delivers what it promises”
Reviews.Author: Boristhebold
Reviews.Content: This hotel delivers everything it promises. We arrived at 8.00am after a long flight and were greeted by very attentive staff who ensured we had a swift check in to our rooms. We had a king business room with excellent views, the room was clean tidy and extremely well appointed and big. The bathroom was the size of some hotel rooms we have stayed in in the UK. As i have stated the staff were attentive and nothing was too much trouble not oncde did I see a sour face. We have the buffet breakfast in the pool room on the 4th floor which was fantasic there were so many choices it was difficult to chose. Once again nothing was too much trouble for the staff who greeted you the moment you entered . The hotel itself is centrally located for all attractions, the MRT is a two minute walk, numerous restaurants minutes away and shopping malls surround it. If you are planning a first visit to Singapore or are simply stopping over for a few days like we did en route to New Zealand then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel locatedc in the Business District of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Telusgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad durig one of the Singapore Business trips last year. The hotel is located at the Tamasek Bulavard which was a walking distance away from my office. Hotel is excellent interms of decor and staff...they also have multiple resturants serving different types of food.... They even have some Indian food items in the Menu for the ones who cannot live without taste of India.... The rooms were spacious and very well maintianed....bathrooms were clean and well equiped. Good place to stay if your company is funding it....

Reviews.Title: “Our best hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki22
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Conrad Centennial Singapore exceeded every expectation. The attention to detail from check-in to check-out made us feel very welcome and pampered. The service was an example of perfection from any member of staff. The Guest Relations desk was instrumental in helping us plan our memorable stay. The room and its amenities lacked nothing. The complimentary breakfast was outstanding. The location was ideal and the views from our room were breathtaking. After cruising for two weeks, this was a perfect end to our dream vacation.

Reviews.Title: “for comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: BeHappy001
Reviews.Content: Conrad Singapore has one of the best ambience and interiors. One would feel freash as soon as you enter the hotel. I just loved the room, quite spacious, very bright and neat and high rised comfy bed, which i simply love. And the most spacious bathroom. Overall giving you a very comfortable stay. they give a soft toy teddy for your each stay, which you can also take along with you. It is centrally located so good if you are there for Business or for Leisure. Staff were polite and service was excellent. If you have along day, do opt for their breakfast, lots of variety and best in quality, only on weekends the breakfast hall becomes really crowdy. There are quite a few shopping malls around, so you will definitly find to take something back for your loved ones.

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb!”
Reviews.Author: ferrisgirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived tired and jaded early in the morning from a flight from Barcelona - fully expecting that our rooms would not be ready. They were! Beautiful big bed with miles of pillows and wonderful linen - gorgeous bathroom and product that was restocked THREE times in 24 hours. Plus my room was cleaned fully 4 hours after I arrived. Enormous room with marvellous view - and great location. Lovely welcomne choccies and fluffy toy. Lovely big pool, fantastic reflexology massage, excellent service throughout. I will be staying here again when in Singapore - it was HEAVENLY!

Reviews.Title: “a big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: philippeenrique
Reviews.Content: Since we had god recommendations for this hotel, notably on tripadvisor, we decided to try this hotel. We are very disappointed with it for the following reasons: - the air conditioning does not work properly. You either freeze or sweat. And the bed is not comfortable and the sheet moist. you end up sleeping in wet sheets, or catch a cold - the pillows are bad - the service is poor (so impersonal, and quite rough) - the breakfast is over expensive and the quality is poor, not to say disgusting - the service used for breafast is made of plastic - the chairs at the pool are very uncomfortable (plastic again) - the location of the hotel is not central. It is quite far away from Orchard road - you have to pay internet and wifi connection for each device in the room... so we believe it is totally overrated and its position in trip advisor does not reflect its true nature. Be careful with that.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, dependable, reliable”
Reviews.Author: premierneige
Reviews.Content: Stay here on business regularly. A real benefit for the jetlagged is that the gym and pool are open all night, a feature I've really come to look for as I'm normally awake at silly o'clock in the morning. The rooms are a good size, good desks, comfy beds. Bathrooms can be shabby with poor finish. Room service is dependable, chinese restaurant on the 1st floor is not spectacular, buffet lunch in the restaurant to right of reception gets v busy with local office workers. The Conrad is a short walk from the new marina area and about 30 mins from the airport by taxi. A warm welcome and great hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Executitve attention”
Reviews.Author: SEXYSHOES
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights on route to Australia. We ad an executive suite which was very comfortable. The executive lounge staff were very friendly. The Conrad Christmas tree made out of teddy's added a special touch. Breakfast was lovely staff were lovely and the lovely lady at the pool bar very informative and knew us by our names after only one conversation. The massage I received in the spa was amazing and the staff there very friendly alesha I think was the therapists name fantastic massage. The executive check in staff were so amazing after I was in tears arriving after our airline lost all our luggage! This is our 2nd time to singapore and will defo not be our last. Thanks Conrad your staff are amazing

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: nbmiami
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Singapore for four nights in April before going on to Kuala Lumpur. The breakfast buffet was a great way to start the day and was loaded with delicious food. One of the best breakfast buffets that I've ever had at a hotel. We had several special requests of the concierge/Bell desk and we found the Bell desk to really be as accommodating as possible. Although there were certain requests that were simply out of their control, they really did go as far as possible to seek out our requests. The location of the hotel is very good. For businessmen the Sun-tec city area appears to be thriving, and the location of the new city line MRT station (Promenade) is only a few hundred meters through the Marina Mall. A quick walk through the Pan Pacific Hotel across Raffles Boulevard to the Esplanade led us to the Gluttons Bay Hawker Center. Although not as big as some of the other larger hawker centers, they had a wonderful selection of local foods and the setting on a next to the Esplanade and across from the new Marina Bay Sands Hotel could not be better. I highly recommend the short walk from the Conrad to Gluttons Bay, rather than the train ride or cab ride to Newton center. Also we enjoyed the little brewery directly across the street/corner from the hotel that brewed beer on the premises. I forget the name but I believe it was also a German restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great food!”
Reviews.Author: WestAus
Reviews.Content: We had two adjoining rooms at this hotel from 9 to 16 July 2010. We arrived in Singapore at around 6 am and were at the hotel by about 7.30 am hoping for early access to one of our rooms. We had let the hotel know well in advance that we were arriving early and they had said they would try to give us early access to one of our rooms. While having breakfast nearby, at around 8 am the hotel called us to say one of our two rooms was already available. Having travelled overnight to get to Singapore, this was extremely welcome news. With a breakfast and dinner package for our entire stay, we were able to enjoy first-class meals every time we ate. Apart from full access to the buffet service, for my wife, who required gluten free meals, on some occasions the chefs went to great trouble to prepare special dishes at no extra charge. They did this based on an email I had sent months earlier asking about gluten-free meals - we didn't have to say about it a thing when we arrived. When we checked out we were pleased to see that the rate we were charged for our room for the week was exactly what the hotel quoted to us in an email some 7 months earlier. It is a beautiful hotel, the staff were fantastic and the food was incredibly good. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. We loved the time we had there and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidValeofGlamorgan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in late January. Room and Service were quite excellent.Buffet at Breakfast,Lunch and Evening was exceptional. Position of hotel is ideal for a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: LLJay1612
Reviews.Content: 2nd time staying at Conrad, the first stay had been wonderful but the 2nd time has exceeded my expectation. Check-in was swift, personnel at Conrad has made us feel so welcomed n even sent a birthday cake to us as it was my partner's birthday. Room was nice n clean, with little items that made us felt so at home. Staff came in to replenish fruits n with choice of pillow for a good night sleep. There is a food centre opposite the hotel and a shopping mall. Convenient. Breakfast was delicious with wide variety, including ice cream as well. Bath salt for a nice soak in the tub n how abt a rubber duck for a nice personal touch. How I wish I could have extended my stay there but no worries, I will be making another reservation at Conrad soon

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not excellent...”
Reviews.Author: simbaonsafari
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on a business trip on the business floor. Location, food quality and amenities cannot be faulted. I had a room next to the elevator shaft and at night the noise would be irrirating but not totally unberable and the air conditioning can get noisy. Did not realise for two days that it was the elevator that made the noise all night! And despite complaining to thereception, the a/c could not get fixed.
