Overall an excellent hotel but stay away from rooms next to the elevators if you are a light sleeper!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: omeeda
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days total. Was upgraded to executive room. The stay all together was great. Since there was so much to do, I didnt check out all of the hotel amenities (pool, gym, etc...) but I did check out the executive lounge on the 31st floor for breakfast and for afternoon drinks/snacks. I can say that the breakfast spread was great. The evening snacks were excellent as well. The room was great, with a large flat screen TV and large bathroom with tub and stall shower. Overall a great stay and I would definitely repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Mirror74
Reviews.Content: Stayed in bussiness class room (was upgrated because of my status with Hilton) on 23rd floor. Lovery view, breakfast (which could be perhaps a nod better) included, daily froom plate and so on. Free fast internet, if you stay on bussiness or executive floors. Heavenly sleep experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: travelliingaussie
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying on the executive floor of the Conrad Singapore last weekend after a week of cruising the Maldives on a boat. From our arrival in the lobby, check in, our experience in the executive lounge and our check out, the experience was faultless and superb. I have travelled to Singapore on a number of occasions and the hospitality everywhere is usually of a very high standard but the Conrad is truly exceptional. The highlight for me was having several decent baths and showers after a week of trying to shower on a small boat. The bathrooms at Conrad are very luxurious. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and am looking forward to staying here again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: simonSussex
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves its reputation for style and service. Rooms are a good size with a large bathroom and all facilities you would expect and well maintained and kept clean. The hotel location is slightly out of the way but most things are easy to get to , if need be use taxis they are very cheap in Singapore. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful ,they were without exception polite and friendly and had a can do attitude. The breakfast buffet although expensive was well worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this hotel was first class”
Reviews.Author: Twishy
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the Conrad - we usually stay at another marina fronting hotel, but we had no concerns about our change of choice once we were dropped off at the doors. The hotel was beyond what we expected. Arriving before 9am we didn't expect to be able to have availability to our room until later in the day. However, the staff at reception completed our check in quickly and efficiently and said we could have access imediately. We were taken up to our room which was amazing - and more than matched the perfection we have been used to in Singapore. Everything about the Conrad was first class - and its staff were impeccable, happy, helpful and very professional without being overly formal. When we next return to Singapore - the Conrad will be our first choice for accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - terrific service and wonderful amenities”
Reviews.Author: BostonWanderlust
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for one night at the end of our stay in Singapore. Due to our status with Hilton, we had access to the Executive Floor which provided breakfast in the morning, tea in the afternoon, and cocktails and hors d'oeuvres in the early evening. The Conrad is on par with the nicest Hiltons that we have stayed at in the States and internationally. The rooms are lovely, the staff are very attentive and helpful and the lobby and public areas are well appointed. The hotel is in the Marina area of the city very close to the Esplanade MRT station (3 blocks away). It’s also across the bridge from the Marina Bay Sands, the new mammoth casino in Singapore and not far from the downtown area and down the street from the Singapore Flyer Ferris Wheel and next to a decent mall. The hotel has a spa, fitness center and outdoor pool, which can be nice on the hot humid Singaporean days. The bar lounge and restaurant are nice, but do have hotel prices. Several people have posted reviews about the amazing breakfast at the Conrad – it is pretty impressive for the breadth of offerings, but don’t let this prevent you from going to the great hawker stalls and restaurants in Singapore which are among the best in the world. For a luxurious and relaxing stay with plenty of in-house amenities, the Conrad is a great Singapore choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuperJonny
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Singapore aren't cheap and we would have had to have paid almost the same as we paid for the Conrad to stay in a 3 star, so we thought this hotel excellent value for money (for Singapore). All the public areas are kept very clean, are well decorated and we had no complaints. The rooms too were very good. The breakfast buffet is good, as you would expect in a hotel of this category and we never had to wait to be seated unlike the previous reviewer. All the staff were exceptionally polite and helpful, and for us the hotel location was fine. We walked to many locations (Raffles hotel, Marina Bay sky park, Helix bridge, Merlion..) and for destinations a bit further afield we either jumped on the metro (5 mins walk away) or got a cab (very reasonably priced, and always use the meter). The internet in the room is expensive, but then most hotels seem to charge for this these days. However you are given 1 hours Wifi connection in the lobby per day, included in the room rate, so it's not a big issue here. If you can get a deal as we did then a stay here is well worth it. Alcohol in Singapore is not cheap, so wine bumps up the meal prices. Do visit the botanical gardens they are very good!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Conrad hotels”
Reviews.Author: akiraoz
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Conrad Singapore after 5-6 years. This time it felt the hotel shows some age in the lobby and the bathroom, but the service is still excellent. We had a room facing the harbor and were able to see the New Year fireworks from our room. I also love the $20/day laundry allowance - this is the only hotel I know of that has this particular service. The breakfast buffet on the business louge is also perhaps the best I've known, compared to the continental breakfast you see at the hotels in US. The location is not extremely convenient as it is in the Marina area. But the newly completed Circle line now stops close to the hotel. I'd definitely reommend Conrad to particularly business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: lilspark80
Reviews.Content: There's nothing bad i can say about the Conrad Centennial Singapore. From the time I arrived to the time I left everything was great. The service was great with someone always around to say good morning and hold the lift/doors open for you. The price was quite high, but lucky for me, my company was paying for my stay, so the bill wasn't a concern. To others though, just remember Singapore is generally an expensive place to go to anyway, so I guess the hotel of this standard was about the right price. The location of the hotel is great. Surrounded by exceptional shopping malls and restaurants, you are never short of variety and things to do. It is also close to the MRT which makes it really easy to get around Singapore. The Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands is about 15mins walk. For business travellers, as well as tourists, its right in the middle of everything. The rooms are neat and clean. I had a business room and it was bigger than other hotel rooms I've stayed in. A huge flat screen tv and a massive bed just makes you feel very comfortable. Especially with the complimentary chocolates and fruit on arrival. The outdoor pool is great for a dip. Its huge and was never busy. The fitness centre, although i never used it, looked very modern as well. I was lucky enough to get a free buffet breakfast every morning. There are two places you can have breakfast in. The restaurant on the ground floor is the bigger one and is available to everyone. It has a huge selection of food in the buffet and is definitely worth the visit, even with the crowds. The other restaurant is on the 4th level, only open to people staying on certain floors. It is a much more relaxing environment with much less people but the food selection is not as large. When you are deciding between the two, it just depends on what you are after. For the two weeks I was in Singapore, it was a pleasure staying at this hotel. It was my first trip to Singapore, so I don't know what other hotels in the area would have been like, but this was definitely one I will return to if I'm ever in the area again and would suggest you give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great...”
Reviews.Author: jameskdean
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is fine, but they get in the habit of adding club rooms on other floors in order to boost the prices. The result a packed VIP lounge that enforces dress code one minute and ignores it the second. The result is hit and miss service both in the lounge. The Executive breakfast is ok at best - the service is slow although well intentioned. For the price they charge - you can have a much better room and service elsewhere in the city. Spent all day working with staff to fix the in room internet, took 4 hours for a technician to show up to the room and fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but do sth abt the bathroom plz”
Reviews.Author: BastetNika
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Conrad hotel Singapore for 3 nights in the beginning of December. The hotel is generally fine however it seems that it lacks maintenance. The lobby is wonderfully decorated with a big Christmas tree made of Conrad-hotel teddy bears and has live music every evening. The hotel also has a nice swimming pool. It is very centrally located which makes it easy for you to get around. Our room had a nice view on the city. It was spacious and bright. A small box of complimentary chocolate was a delight. The bed was very funny - it looked more like a tall platform you have to climb up to. For a young person like me it is fun, but seems uncomfortable on the whole. No free internet is provided, which I think for such a place is a great drawback. The biggest problem was the bathroom. The bathtub leaked on the first day after using it. Though it was quickly fixed by hotel staff, I was left with an impression that everything in the bathroom breaks easily. If you look under the sink you’ll be shocked!!! Seems like everything keeps constantly breaking and the staff is just trying to fix it quickly and carelessly without having a proper look. We didn’t experience any outstanding service at Conrad, the staff is more I-am-just-doing-my-job style, other than smiling and being a welcoming host. Next time I would love to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel. Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: FordTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 17Dec to 21st 2010. This is one of the best 5 star hotels that I've had the pleasure to stay at. Staff was extremely polite and accommodating. I booked 2 rooms during my stay. Throughout the stay, we had excellent service. Executive breakfast was well stocked with asian and western choices for breakfast. Superior quality restaurants in the hotel. I chose to eat at the hotel even though the hotel is surrounded by a lot of good restaurants. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Grandville
Reviews.Content: very comfortable hotel. Even though it is not as new as the marina Bay sands, this hotel has a lot going for it. Namely Location,Location,Location. Close to MRT station, Millenia,Marina and suntec shopping malls all a stones throw away. Best beds in town..!! Fantastic Breakfast buffet. Friendly staff. Only downside being the pool which is a bit boring just rectangular basic pool. needs some landscaping. Also TV's being on side wall so difficult to watch for long period from the bed. great value for money though and very pleasant stay. complimentary fruits in room nice touch too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stop over hotel”
Reviews.Author: gimboeek
Reviews.Content: Great staff! Bit suspicious of the concierge though who tried to book us into an excursion we didn't agree to and made us feel guilty. Was he working on commision? ;-). Or perhaps, this could be put down to miscommunication? Excellent buffet breakfast. Where can you get dim sum, waffles and icecream for breakfast?! ;-) Location good. Near all the shopping malls and 10 mins walk from raffles which has an excellent shop. Also let us have a late checkout and use the pool/gym facilities as we had a late night.

Reviews.Title: “amazing, amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMaddie11
Reviews.Content: 2nd Best hotel in singapore! Oscars returant on the 1st floor has the best food u have ever tasted! the pool is amazing with a pool bar! Everything at this hotel is awesome. everybody is SO nice! stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Conrad--F1 race around the bay”
Reviews.Author: EverLastingTrips
Reviews.Content: One of the very first hotels I've stayed in Singapore,was here for a week and price was reasonable. Rooms are newly renovated and have complete bath amenities, cable TV, phone, mini bar, coffee machine, newspaper and internet connection. They have coffee shop, pool, massage and gym. Location is great, in the heart of commercial hub.Suntec helps you to do shopping and esplande gives you the theatrical view.The race track is nearby and view the racing buddies from the window. The hotel is clean and nice with well-trained staff, but I guess, the environment is just too serious and formal for me. Good for business, not for sightseeing and backpackers tho. But if you want comfort, then the hotel's okay. cheaper than the other hotels in the area. The location is perfect for me. I know I will stay at this hotel again and again. Its a busy hotel and there are plenty of restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to see singapore”
Reviews.Author: SwaroopC
Reviews.Content: Its location is a major plus point besides many other facilites this property offers. Its in close proximity to good shopping & eating joints. Its right opposite Suntec city with access to MRT for Dhoobi Ghat from where u can go anywhere with Metro. Rooms are plush with a very prompt service. View from room is cool as u can see Singapore flyer and Merlion from one side and Fountain of Wealth from other. The welcome chocolates and everyday fruit platter with free laundry for business customer are great add-ons. Additional points for the sumptuous spread for breakfast and lunch buffet with all types of cuisines on the option list. Just the temperature management could be better as most of the times we were shivering within hotel due to low temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: scot5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights on stopover to NZ. The hotel upgraded my wife and I to a suite on Exectuive floor as it was our annivesary. The hotel is brilliant, Room was plush and exquisite. Staff were great. Location is very good and within a short walk from all major tousisty bits. All in all the hotel could not be faulted. Although it is not the cheapest in Singapore I would rate it very high.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Breakfast was such a highlight!”
Reviews.Author: Bumblebee2306
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights and it was fantastic, Comforatble sized rooms with great amentities. The higlight was definately the breakfast buffet though. It had everythng from normal breakfast items to chocolate, candy and ice-cream! The range was the best i have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless once again! Deserved to be the best in SG”
Reviews.Author: zwgc2
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here in August and had a great time here, I returned here for a night as part of a short trip to SG. Checkin staff was very polite and helpful, and we paid a little extra to get upgraded to an executive suite--I must say the suite itself is very spacious, but the dining "room" space is not that well used and seems like a "wasted" space if you don't use the table a lot. The bedroom is nicely decorated, with the extremely comfortable and high bed, and nice bathroom with Acca Kappa amenities. An extra toilet near the suite entrance makes life a bit easier when you have a couple of people staying there. the sofas, chairs in the living room is not that comfortable and could help with a bit of upgrading, getting some new furnitures. One of the great things about Conrad is the wonderful executive lounge--located on the top (31st )floor of the hotel with magnificent view over to the CBD. A wide range of food selection during the afternoon tea period, and wide range of alcoholic and soft drinks as well. Had breakfast at 6.30 in the morning and the choice was again impressive--quite a lot of hot food choices alongside fruits/cold cuts and pastry selection. Executive Lounge is well worth the extra, not only because of the lounge access, but also that you light pressing for 5 items upon arrival, 50% off laundry and free local calls, all of which are quite handy. the only downside to the lounge is there is only 1 PC--should bring your own laptop/ipads to the lounge. A truly top notch hotel in Singapore, and can't really find any significant bad thing to write about--a must try when you stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Winner...”
Reviews.Author: Biggles0376
Reviews.Content: I travel to Singapore, or S'pore as we sometimes abbreviate it mainly on business...its is a winner everytime. The location, the rooms, the service and that buffet breakfast is second ONLY to Sunday brunch at the Fullerton. Luckily the company has a corporate rate that offers us an Executive room - with this upgrade we get access to a lounge on the 21st floor which will serve you breakfast, allow you free wifi and of course complimentary drinks and canapes from 5.30pm every day..nice touch especially on check out day before the long red eye flight back to Blighty... It is also located next to our regional HQ based at Suntec, so optimally located...can't wait for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Rook3rs
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is mainly for the business traveller, it is an excellent hotel for the tourist. It is located centrally with a set of interlocking malls only a few steps away and the hop-on/hop-off bus terminal is across the street. It is also only a 10 minute walk to the Singapore Flier (Ferris Wheel) and not much further to the river area with restaurants and entertainment. There are several restaurants within easy walking distance. The hotel is luxurious and the rooms are adequately-sized although the T.V. on the side wall makes it difficult to watch. The breakfast in the Executive lounge has a great choice with Western, Asian, and Japanese food along with all the usual fruit, pastries, etc. The lounge also provides an all-day bar with an afternoon tea and evening snacks. We were upgraded to the lounge as Hilton Diamond members but it would represent good value for all the benefits. The pool is large, 20 m by 10 m, for a city centre hotel and there are good sun loungers with umbrellas along with tree cover. The staff also bring round iced water at regular intervals. The staff throughout the hotel are excellent and willing to be of service.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - couple of faults”
Reviews.Author: LassiComeHome
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and service is excellent. My only complaints about this hotel are that the rooms are small compared to other similar hotels in the area and in same price range. Also the TV's are on the side wall - so if you want to watch TV from bed you quickly get a sore neck. There are only 2 restaurants - Oscars (multi cuisine) and Golden Peony (Cantonese) - which is little choice for such a big hotel. But otherwise great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you come to Singapore for shopping”
Reviews.Author: antan
Reviews.Content: You came to Singapore for shopping, or not?!...? If so, this is a gerat place (there are reportedly 1000 shops in the "Marina Bay" complex which this hotel is part of (there is also the Mandarin Oriental, the Pan Pacific, a few others), all on reclaimed land in the harbor of Singapore. If you look for nature, or for something `authentic`, or `exotic`, this is the wrong place for you. The hotel is a bit difficult to find (hidden beteween other high-rise buildings), but once you are there you will find the location convenient. There is a pool on the 5th floor or so (with some potted palms around it - thats about it in respect of nature for this place), but otherwise the hotel is excellent: high-standard, luxury class, excellent sleep quality (really). The gym is a bit small (may find it difficult to find a free treadmill in the morning), but the hotel has class, embedded in luxury. Unfortunatey, it could be just `anywhere`(in the US), but as for a `Conrad` it keeps its promises down to the last `dot` - just as expectable from a Conrad. Very nice and helpful staff! Although my comments may read as `lack-luster` or only `half-hearted`, I would still come again (only those, who come to `exotic` Singapore might find it disappointing to a degree to end up on the outskrits (or within the perimeters, to be more precise) of a mega-mall complex.

Reviews.Title: “Really genuine, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: auntynell
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days at the Conrad Centennial as a follow on from our 30th anniversary trip to Phuket. We booked our stay on the executuve level where the service was fabulous. Every single staff member hosting the guests here was great. They made a very special effort to ensure that our anniversary was memorable - girls you have great voices! Thank you for the beautiful cake. The facilities in the executive lounge were amazing and it was so nice to return during the day and enjoy a quick refreshment drink prior to more shopping! Breakfast was great and the evening cocktails were wonderful. On our return from dinner we enjoyed a quick nightcap. Soo nice. Room was very pleasant, lots of great toiletries, room amenities etc. view ecxcellent. Extra special tribute to Benet - doorman. He was so friendly, remembered our name every time and engaged in conversation each time we entered or left the hotel. Thank you all, we had a great time at the Conrad Centennial and can highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in luxury!”
Reviews.Author: RuthT00TH
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all the lovely staff at the Conrad! We arrived jet lagged and bedraggled and were welcomed and made comfortable. Our room wasn't ready (at 9.30am!) so we were taken to the club lounge and given coffee and made comfortable for the half hour it took to make it available.Our 3 night stay that followed was wonderful. Staff were aways friendly, smiling and happy to help. the hotel had all the amenities you would expect from a luxury hotel. Our room was well appointed and spacious with a view of the harbour. Toiletries in the bathroom were top quality as were the furnishings and linen. A stopover after a European holiday turned out to be a highlight of our trip. Well done Conrad staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Just delightful”
Reviews.Author: fibiScotland
Reviews.Content: We had a suite overlooking the national day celebartions which was lovely. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The furnishings were luxurious, super clean, staff lovely. Breakfast super. The executive lounge was very nice also with a good selection of drinks and snacks. Views to die for. Two slight negatives were the pool which seemed to be in shade most of the time and some of the staff in the executive lounge who seemed to serve American guests who tipped before anyone else- and certainly before us on many occasions! This would not stop me from staying again- its just so unusual for this to happen in Singapore that it has stuck in my mind!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Haven”
Reviews.Author: mamaduckling
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on his recent business trip to Singapore. This hotel was selected by a consultant, but I was very pleased with her selection. Singapore is a very long way from the US; our group was very travel weary after traveling more than 20 hours. We arrived at the front desk with a group needing 9 rooms at 2:15 am. Even in the middle of the night, the hotel processed our reservations with charming efficiency and had our entire group off to our rooms within 20 minutes. The room itself was nicely sized and appointed with a fabulous king bed, down comforter with a clean duvet cover, and wonderful pillows. There was a nice desk, flat screen TV, a plush chair with ottoman for relaxing. The bathroom had a wonderful tub and a separate shower with plenty of pressure. The view was fabulous. We very much enjoyed the breakfast buffet. The food was plentiful, well prepared, and delicious; there were traditional "American" foods as well as a large array of different cultural offerings (a good way to try new food). The breakfast buffet is a great way to start the day. Other reviews have mentioned the staff and I can only echo their comments. The staff was attentive and seemed genuinely pleased to provide service. The hotel's location is excellent. We walked everywhere from the hotel, but when we were simply too tired to walk more, the excellent subway system (MRT) was a short walk. The hotel bar is very lovely, but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: kceesse
Reviews.Content: Pros - Great location in Marina Bay with lots of hotels and shopping centers nearby - Service was genuine and friendly, including escort from check-in to room - Decor was relatively modern (but note it hasn't been renovated for over 6 years) - Evening turndown - Fruits and chocolate in room - Large bathrooms and large rooms (40 sqm) - Short wait for elevators (5 for 31 floors) - Comfortable beds Cons - Spa facilities poor and not modern - Pool was surrounded by lots of tall buildings and wasn't pleasant (should plant more trees) - Internet fee of SGD 30 per 24 hr Overall, highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Truly Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: AA_Gull
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the nicest hotel I have stayed in in Singapore. We arrived looking somewhat worse for wear after a long bus journey from Melacca. Check in was swift and efficient and the lady who checked us in then personally escorted us to our room. The room was spotless and beautifully equipped - even the TV remote had a leather cover! The bed was a little firm for my personal taste but by no means uncomfortable. It was very big and had wonderfully crisp linen on it. Breakfast was a piece de resistance. More choice than you could shake a stick at, brilliantly presented and prepared. I've often wondered why we cannot get good French butter here in NZ - and now I know it should be possible because that is what they serve with the croissant in the Conrad in Singapore!! My only regret is that I had neither the time (nor the budget!) to stay for a week. The one downside is the ludicrous expense of wireless internet in the rooms. They also charge you TWICE if you use say a laptop and an iPhone in the room - so be warned!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, but gave off a business feel”
Reviews.Author: byln
Reviews.Content: We were at the Conrad over new year at the beginning 2010, so this is a somewhat overdue review. The room itself was spacious and well appointed, with a particularly inviting bed that did not disappoint later in the evening. Likewise the bathroom, where everything was clean and bright. While the hotel itself is not new, i didnt get any of the dated feeling from the room. There was also little or no noise from the surrounding rooms. We were under a new year's deal that came with breakfast the next morning and dinner the night before. We mistakenly showed up at Oscar's for dinner, where they informed us that actually our dinner was at the chinese resataurant, Golden Peony, but because it was full they would be seating us at Oscar's instead and invited us to the buffet. The buffet was excellent - particularly if you like oysters (which we unfortunately do not eat), and the sheer spread was so inviting and enticing. For New Year's eve we were conscious that this would probably be about S$100 per head, so we were very pleasantly surprised that the hotel did not insist we go up to Golden Peony instead. We also squeezed in a visit to the gym - which was generally well equipped for a medium sized gym. Its also next to the pool, so easy access for people who want to run then swim. The gym is open to non-guests who are members, so during peak hours, there is a maximum time you are allowed on any of the cardio machines - around 20 or 30 minutes if i remember correctly. The hotel has also easy access to Marina Square and Millenia Walk - so shopping is readily availble. This was a very pleasant stay indeed, and we look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “A Singapore hotel with top flight staff....at last”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: Th headline says it all. In all my trips to Singapore over the years the staff have let every major hotel down. For some reason I had never stayed before at The Conrad, but I found staff here that were fewer on the ground but knew exactly what they were meant to be doing. What a relief from the queues of incompetent nodding staff that pass as service in other Singapore hotels. Well done

Reviews.Title: “very happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTravelBug
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews from Tripadvisor, and we were happy with our choice. Check-in was efficient and the staff was vey friendly and accommodating. Our bedroom (business room) was well appointed, and it had a beautiful waterfront view. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was sparkling clean. Breakfast was good and had a wide-range of selections of Asian and Western dishes. We had dinner once at the hotel, the Hainan chicken rice and Laska (signature dishes, Restaurant Oscar) were scrumptious. At its business center, we used the computer and printer free of charge. We were especially pleased to find out we could walk from the hotel through underground air-conditioned corridors to the Esplanade Mall (15 min.), Raffles City (20 min.), Marina Square (5 min.), Millennium Walk (2 min.) and Suntec City (5 min.). Also taxis to major sightseeing attractions from the hotel were not expensive. We had an enjoyable stay at this hotel for 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Singapore stay with 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: eurocruise
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days at this marvellous hotel after reading previous reviews on trip advisor. The hotel exceeded my expectations in many ways. Paid for an Executive Room with lounge access where Breakfast Lunch Afternoon Tea and Cocktails including Champagne were freely available accompanied by wonderful canapes - different every night. The food was of good quality, the service excellent, and atmosphere especially on a night overlooking the lights of Singapore truly memorable. The rooms were of excellent size with unobtrusive housekeeping twice daily. Beautiful spacious Marble bathrooms. The hotel is located in Marina Bay next to many shopping centres and a wide choice of restaurants.The concierge was particularly helpful and we navigated the metro (3 minutes walk from the hotel) to get to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Reluctant to Correct Their Mistake”
Reviews.Author: lprisr
Reviews.Content: We booked a non-smoking room and at the check-in desk, the girl also verbally confirmed that. Another girl led us to our room. I am sure you know where this is leading to now. As soon as we opened the door to the room, a pungent sharp cigarette smoke. It wasn't just a hint of smell, it was as strong as you can imagine, hit you right in the face. I kindly ask, is this really a non-smoking room? But she replied "well it's actually a smoking room". So we asked to change room. Seemed like a reasonable request, right? The concierge called us back and said they rather just bring a ionizer/deodorizer to the room. At that point, I was a little confused. Isn't this Conrad, a 5-star hotel where customers come first? Isn't the mistake theirs of giving us a smoking room? What is the problem that they don't want to fix this? Finally after a few back and forth of explaining and convincing them that we don't believe the ionize would help, they agreed to give us another room. The room was nice, spacious, comfortable. Take a look at the pictures. The location was great, next to an MRT station and across the street from the exhibition center where a big Food Republic food court is in.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Singapore - great staff, plush rooms, superb location”
Reviews.Author: Prashan
Reviews.Content: Returning to the Conrad is like returning home - the staff from the doormen, concierge to the team in the Lounge all recognise you from your previous visit. Stayed only 1 night after the Singapore Grand Prix but still enjoyed the impeccable Service. Heinrich Graffe and his team continue to deliver consistent levels of high quality service and satisfaction. Keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, welcoming, clean and spacious - overall superb”
Reviews.Author: euro_licenced_driver
Reviews.Content: Every member, without exception, were ultra friendly, gracious and helpful. The overall atmosphere of the hotel is luxurious without being overpowering. It is centrally located with several shopping malls close by. the subway is so simple to use that i would recommend it highly, thereby avoiding rush-hour traffic jams. The breakfast is top class, with a great choice of different ethnic foods. bedrooms are luxurious and spacious, and the view of the marina is well worth it. While this is a large hotel, they are expert at providing the personal touch also

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Top: Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkJensen
Reviews.Content: I usually travel for business and Singapore is always better when we stay here. You get what you pay for. Top service. Great staff (I mean.. great) and an amazing service, specially for business meetings, conventions, expo, etc. I have stay here 3 times and 1 time was with my fiancee (now my wife). Fantastic service even back there. They keep improving and their new chef give a nice charm to the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: jnismith
Reviews.Content: I've probably stayed here about 5 times but last week was just superb. The hotel itself is not spectacular in any way but it's the staff that make the difference. Apart from the constant smiling and greeting, you feel that they are happy to support you in any way. One example was going to the bar late and asking the barman what food could be provided quickly. Within 10 or 15 mins, I had a lovely plate of sate and some chips in my room. For a stressed busineman, its little things like that that make the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: dannati
Reviews.Content: As almost every Conrad you cannot make a lot wrong. Great Place, very Stylish. rooms were quiet big, we loved the view. the pool is absolutely nice, with good possibility to swim. the lobby is astonishing and very elegant. last but not least the great executive lounge which is an oasis of peace in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Persva
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night. Checking in is a breeze and staff service were excellent. No inferior service from them even though we were Singaporeans. Concierge guy has great memory too. Room is extremely clean. The bed is comfy and love their spacious bathroom. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sugartee
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and clean, hotel was comfortable but if you are there to be near the shopping stay in orchard road. Suntec is beside the hotel but Orchard has more places to go. The hotel itself is great and their breakfast excellent, but hotel is more for businessmen than for children even if they give teddy bears and rubber duckies (nice touch though)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: tripp2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night on the executive floor. The room was comfortable and verything looked ok. The executive floor breakfast was decent. There is an outdoor pool in the hotel. The staff was extermely polite and acccomodating. The only down side for this hotel is I think the high price. Other than that it upholds the Hilton standards to the most extend.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel away from center”
Reviews.Author: hp1212
Reviews.Content: This is a very solid Conrad, although not quite as elegant as some newer Asian Conrads. I stayed in a business floor room, which was spacious, posh, comfortable, and very quiet. The bathroom was quite luxurious and plentifully supplied, while the room's decor was somewhat more staid (furniture especially). I had a very nice view over a wooded area overlooking water, a welcome contrast. The requisite Conrad bear and rubber duck were well presented, happy looking, and always appreciated as presents back home :) Due to this hotel's location outside of the center, I used taxis quite frequently during my stay. Taxis taken from the hotel turned out to be particularly good (nice new cars and friendly drivers), which I will give the Conrad credit for.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, caring staff; great location; ideal for our needs”
Reviews.Author: ADRC
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a grande finale to our far east vacation and found it with this hotel and its executive rooms and attached privileges. Other reviewers have recommended upgrading to the executive rooms and I would wholeheartedly endorse this for a family with three older teenagers. The rooms were clean and luxurious. The hotel staff were always very courteous and attentive especially so when one family member felt a bit poorly. I was especially impressed that the cleaning staff asked for my room key card to check it when I walked into our room as it was being serviced. The hotel is ideally located for the terminus for the Duck and Hippo bus tours of the city. We also used the MRT underground transport system easily from the hotel. My sons told me the pool was cool (in all senses of the word).

Reviews.Title: “Always the best in town”
Reviews.Author: italyItalia
Reviews.Content: Every time I go to Conrad Hotel I find it even better than the time before, this hotel is excellent for everything: luxury, rooms, service, complimentary products and breakfast. Location is also terrific and if you get a room facing the marina you will enjoy the view. I will definetly come back there because it's surely the best in town.

Reviews.Title: “High quality and incredible service”
Reviews.Author: Sascha_van_Ryssen
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a very nice building with pool and fitness center. The staff is very friendly, the service incredible. Very close to Suntec City, app. 20 min from the airport by taxi.If possible try to book a room with 'financial district view'. There are very nice bars around for the night which are less expensive and quite a few locals.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded hotel, this time around.”
Reviews.Author: Shinyy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Conrad earlier as well and love doing that however, this time around I found the hotel to be extremely crowded due to some contingent for upcoming games. It took away the entire charm that is associated with staying at Conrad. Otherwise a quiet hotel, great for business. The rooms are spacious and standards generally good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tyo1820036
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights (Fri & Sat) with corporate rate. I got email confirmation from front desk a week prior to my arrival to confirm my arrival time and room preference. When I checked in, front desk staff ushered me to the room and it was actually in executive floor. There were welcome fruits and a box of chocolate, and of course Conrad bear and rubber duck! Although the room was not my preference (two beds room, instead of king size), I really enjoyed the specious luxury room with ocean view where I could see Mer-Lion and fireworks on Sat night. The vicinity to Suntec, millennia walk and Marina bay was great. The room service dishes from Golden Peony were excellent. The only minor drawback were 1) the room was behind the elevators and I heard small machinery noises from wall 2)wired network was out of service, though Wi-Fi was available

Reviews.Title: “Conrad did it again”
Reviews.Author: Leshansen
Reviews.Content: Every year our company gets a suite at the Conrad during the TFWA Singapore Show. We are never disappointed of the facilities, customer attention, room, any aspects of this great hotel. The Concierge Harziyani Azali (Sinci) was phenomenal and very accomodating to our needs. We had very many meetings and sometimes back-to-back. She even helped with the "traffic". The Suite came with the Club level facilities, where we had breakfast ( a nice spread ) every day and meetings with customers. Very professional staff anywhere you go. The price of the room is also very reasonable, considering it is the Ambassador Suite. It can definitely be used for a romantic stay in Singapore. It has a spectacular view and the hotel itself is within walk from everything. Thanks once again to Conrad Centennial for her exceptional service!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable business/vacation hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fontek
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults) stayed her on a vacation stopover in Singapore for 5 days. We got a great rate for the executive floor at the Hilton web site by paying in advance. This was well worth the price, as the executive lounge offered a fantastic breakfast and ample evening cocktails/snacks. One could probably get by on lounge food as two meals a day. The hotel location is quite good: away from hectic down town out, adjacent to metro line, within walking distance of the marina park and several shopping centers, and next door to the major tour operator in the city. The staff were all delightful and very interested in helping with maps, directions, etc. The gift shop loan DVDs free to guests. The rooms (on the executive floor) were spacious and well equipped (including large screen TV and DVD). WiFi is free in the executive lounge and available in rooms on a pay by the day basis. We did request a non-smoking room and were originally assigned to a non-smoking room on a floor whose corridors reeked of smoke. A prompt complaint got us swiftly and courteously moved to a non-smoking floor. Our departing flight was at 11 pm and the executive floor desk allowed us late check out until 8 pm. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: Adrian58_10
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent high end hotel in a quieter end of the city. Close to public transport and extensive shopping malls but away from Orchard Road shops. Very good 20 metre pool with gym and a breakfast to remember. Easy access to the airport and as we were on the 29th floor, tremendous views of the smaller harbour area and the local high risers particularly at night. We had a Hilton weekend deal for 1 night and got a very good price for what we received. Very happy and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in the busy Singapore hotel scene...”
Reviews.Author: Payam81
Reviews.Content: I can't really add much that hasn't been said about this hotel. Overall it's a great place to enjoy your stay in Singapore. Easy access to multitude of shops and services all around including the excellent MRT. It's not THE most luxurious Conrad I've been to, but certainly does hold its own. It's also fairly reasonably priced at times, making the choice a no brainer. I will come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Bradley5
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Conrad in early June 2010 for four nights. We found a great deal on expedia and then upgraded to an Executive Floor directly with the hotel for S$100 extra per night. This gave us access to the Executive Floor Club Lounge which was just fantastic. Great food and beverage service at any time of the day. Late checkout to 6pm on our final day which was great and we could use the club right up until we departed at 8.30pm to the airport One thing stood out at this hotel for us and that was the service . We arrived on the first night quite late and a hostess met us at the front door and whisked us to our room for check in, all in under 5 mins. The service stayed at this level for the whole stay. A highlight for us was the champagne lunch buffet on the weekend. We ended up talking to the executive chef on arrival and were treated to a special degustation menu prepared personally by him, it was the highlight of our stay. The room was very nice and well appointed. The bed was a little hard but they had a pillow menu which my wife enjoyed. Our only suggestion to improve the service would be to add a chocolate or two during evening turndown !! Overall we give 5 stars to this hotel, we will definitely be back and can’t wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: arthursiew
Reviews.Content: The Conrad in Singapore was great. I enjoyed my stay and the service was almost flawless. This hotel deserves the title of being the top 5 in Singapore. The rooms were very nice. I booked a standard two twin room. It was large and comfortable. It was a little over 40sq m. The beds were somewhat hard, but I still had a good sleep for my stay. There are also a lot of pillows to choose from in the pillow menu. Since the room was big, we had enough room to put our queen air mattress. In the bathroom, there was a big shower and a tub. Of course, there was a toilet and sink. There was also a little duck for the bath tub. One minus was that there was no free internet. Service was great. Check in was hassle free and pretty quick. Housekeeping was friendly and would ask us about a good time to clean since we put the Do Not Disturb light on. They also had an evening turndown service which was lovely. For most of the time, the concierge was very helpful with directions. However, service was a little slow when calling up for pillows or shampoo. The location of the hotel is perfect. There were three nearby stations (Promenade, Esplanade, and Cityhall). There was a Food Republic across the road. It is perfect for tourists and guests on business. There was a pool and exercise room, but I didn't use them so I have no comment. The breakfast at the Oscar's was pretty good. The buffet was more than decent. They had an omelet stand and the expected ham, sausage, bacon and some Chinese foods such as dim sum, porridge, etc. I probably won't pay for it, as there are cheaper options outside of the hotel. Since it was included with the rate, I decided to give it a try. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at the Conrad. Even though it's not perfect, I felt like I got my value for my money (got a very good rate) and received the service I expect from a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's been a while but still pretty good”
Reviews.Author: TheFergie
Reviews.Content: I've been using the Ritz Carlton for a while and couldn't get in so that I'd give this a go again. I probably haven't been in it for five years or so. I thought it might be on the slippery slope, a Ia the Ritz Carlton but, I have to say it was better than I thought. The negatives - the bathroom and fittings are a bit dated, you have to pay for Internet access etc. but the service is still excellent, good location, clean, quiet and a nice pool. Given a choice, next time I'm back I'd go for this above the Ritz given their costs are similar.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobbywestwood
Reviews.Content: After a good stay in Conrad Chicago last year I walked into Conrad Centennial Singapore with high expectations and I was not disappointed. The hotel is a business hotel and very focused on business, but it's still a good place to relax. Because of my Hilton HHonors status I was upgraded to a room on the business floor and it was up to my expectations for a Conrad hotel. There is a huge flatscreen television, nice comfortable bed and seperate shower and bathtube in the bathroom. If I compare with Conrad Chicago, this hotel is better. Especially the service where I was escorted to my room by the receptionist and in room there were complimentary fruit and chocolate. I also had breakfast in the hotel at the restaurant "Salon By The Pool" and it was good with a large selection of food. The negative about this hotel is the internet. They charge 6 Singapore Dollars pr. 15 minutes and that will cost a business man a lot of money to do his work in this hotel. In my opinion internet should be free in every hotel, a lot of people actually select their hotels after where they can get free wireless internet access. Overall it's a great choice in Singapore, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Kid friendly hotel for one that is known as a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Biff'ed
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 days, on a sponsored trip. I don't know how much was paid so I cannot comment regarding the price. Good location, near the Esplanade theater and Singapore fliers. A far but still manageable walk even up to the merlion if you don't have kids with you or seniors. Right across the street the Suntec mall (duck tours, toys r us) and in front of if after passing through the Pan pacific is the Marina Square mall - two huge malls so even if you don't have time to go orchard you still can do your shopping and easily deposit your bags back to the hotel. Marina Mandarin is also nearby which is where airebus to Kuala lumpur is located. (quite expensive though and there are several other choices). Starbucks and some restos nearby. Also located near the expressway going to the airport and to sentosa. Room size was ok, Huge Sony bravia LCD TV. We got a room facing nearby pan pacific, we could see the singapore flier and thanks to the camera megazoom even the merlion. Bathroom was large - which is a big plus for me with separate shower stall, tub. Wife really liked the Acca Kappa bath soap and our toddler enjoyed the bath tub playing with the Conrad rubber duckie. Room also came with a complimentary small stuffed teddy bear. No free room internet though. Breakfast - nice setup but could have been better if the place were it was served was bigger. The food was good but fewer choices compared to other hotels of the same star rating that we have been. Staff was really friendly here. On seeing that we have a toddler with us, a high chair was at once offered and even brought us a kiddie placemat with kiddie (plastic with cartoon characters) and utensils. One of the staff even gave another conrad stuffed bear, this time with a chef's hat. won't have a problem returning here.

Reviews.Title: “I was at the hotel for a seven day...”
Reviews.Author: Zacharymia
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for a seven day business trip. Room was a good size and customer service was excellent. Executive lounge was great. Great customer service. Hotel is not near Orchard Rd, but a quick taxi ride away

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: banchye
Reviews.Content: Couldn't find a better place to escape to last weekend! It was simply paradise from the moment we checked in. The staff (from the Front Desk, to the restaurants, at the pool, Housekeeping) were there to cater to our every needs. We were so well taken care off! Thank you for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: synd12
Reviews.Content: I tried this hotel in January and booked a club room. It was definitively a great place to stay at, in the middle of suntec city. It only takes 20 minuted to get to the airport. The rooms are really big and fairly nicely appointed, Beware though there is no overflow in the bathtub. The club lounge is one of the best i have been in imo as they serve wine, and beers from breakfast until they close. It's little pricey but worth it. The staff is amazing and can't do enough to make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Another good experience”
Reviews.Author: pano
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Large, open, great bed and excellent large bathrooms with bathtub and separate shower. Location: We used taxis most of the time here and the most we paid was about $8SGD to get to the night markets etc. EAsy walk to MRT and some restaurants if needed Best part of our stay was the club lounge access and late checkout to 18:00 - the staff in the lounge were really great and even made us a few drinks that werent readily availible ir they had to go to some effort. Wine and food selection in the lounge was great during the stay the internet was very fast. After a long flight it was a great place to recharge.

Reviews.Title: “more than Sleeping-Inn!!”
Reviews.Author: AnyC3
Reviews.Content: Got nothing to complain; house-keeping was very good..amazingly spotless! the mattress was sooo comfy with pillow menus that you can pick every night (never know anything like this before somewhere else!) and the 24hrs executive lounge on the 31st fl with 360degrees view of Singapore?? awesomeness!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Athing
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located and has the perfect setting for the business traveller. Service is at its best and the hotels provides every amentiry required for a comfortable stay. The F&B does justice to a Hilton hotel. Overall a great hotel and one of the best in the five star segment in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: pico74
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in quite a few 5 star hotels - the Conrad ranks up there with the best. From the moment I arrived I felt welcomed - a complementary orange juice while I waited to check in. The staff couldn't have been more helpful throughout my whole 3 day stay. Great room with stunning views. Very quiet and comfortable. Huge Bathroom. Great buffet breakfast and decent sized gym. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “great business hotel - excellent attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: cooldoc1971
Reviews.Content: The staff from the reception to the gym was excellent. The room was clean, comfortable and luxurious. Best hotel to stay for conference at Suntec. On the downside: no free internet access except in the lobby for the 1st hour.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in brilliant location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: goldcardsoul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in the middle of May. When booking we noticed that for about £40 more we could upgrade to an executive room. This price included breakfast and seemed a sensible thing to do as we had never been to Singapore before. When we arrived we were whisked away to the executive lounge and checked in there. The staff from the first minute were so polite and friendly and a real credit to the hotel. We were told that the executive lounge was still serving afternoon tea and we should go and get some refreshments before afternoon tea finished. Whilst we did this the staff finalised our room and get our luggage taken to our room. The room itself was perfect with a perfect view to match. The room had lots of little touches to make it that extra bit special. A great entertainment system, a pillow menu, a little box of chocolates, fruit etc. The bathroom was massive and had all the extras you expect. The location of the hotel is perfect as the MTR is right next to the hotel, this is easy to get to and from the airport on (which we did) and easy to get anywhere else in singapore too. The Suntec city mall accross the road has lots of shops and restaurants and is where the Hippo Duck tours pick up from. Overall we have been lucky enough to stay in some great hotels around the world and this is one of the best if not the best we have stayed in. The staff were without doubt the best staff we have come accross. I would recommend and would love to go back there, i would further recommend that if you can upgrade to the executive lounge you should.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: sirdaav
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in sultry Singapore, out of the way a bit for tourists perhaps, service is awesome, nice "feel" to the hotel - my last night there I had to leave really early and the rooms was so nice I could have so easily slept in. Bathroom is huge, marble, no longer "new" but like much of Singapore it's clinically clean. Bed is super. I had to arrange with the hotel up front since I was leaving bags, heading to Indonesia, returning, then leaving again - nothing was a bother.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but comfortable and in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Tam Carr
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay in the Hilton when we visit Singapore however this time decided to try the Conrad which is a partner hotel. Hotel prices in Singapore are not cheap and even using the advanced payment option the rate was what we would usually consider to be very expensive (S$300 / night including breakfast and all taxes / service). However this is what you must pay to stay in this class of hotel when in Singapore. Those deciding to stay at the Conrad will not be disappointed as it is a very comfortable hotel. The rooms are of a good size and very nicely fitted out for both business and leisure traveller. The views from the windows were spctacular to say the least looking across towards the Merlion and Marina Bay. Looking to the side you had a great view of the Singapore Flyer and all the ships at anchor just off the coast. All the usual amenities were available including a 46" Sony HD television and Home Theatre system. The bathroom was also of a good size and had separate shower and bath. Our only negative comments on the room was the bed is very high from the floor (about 32") and the mattress was too firm for our comfort. The height must be a problem for some of the asian guests who can be quite short in stature. The room also appeared to be very clean however the skirtings in the corners were very dusty as was the carpet under the bed. Minor points but I would expect a hotel of this class to maintain a better standard of housekeeping. Breakfast was adequate buffet style with a fair choice of both asian and western food. All the food was nice and hot which is often not the case with buffet breakfasts. The restaurant is clean and the staff smiling and friendly. Best thing in this hotels favour is the location. It is in the heart of Marina Bay with hundreds of shops moments away. MRT is also nearby as is the terminus for the many city tour buses and the Singapore Flyer. Walking in the area is safe unless of course you stay here during the Singapore Grand Prix when some of the roads immediately outside the hotel are transformed into parts of the track. That's how close you are. All in all a very enjoyable stay however I think we will revert back to the Hilton in Orchard Road for our next visit. The breakfast is much better and the beds are the most comfortable we have ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with extremely friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: stuart1895
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed in one the hotel's executive floors for 7 nights last week. I personally think the hotel is extremely comfortable only enhanced by such lovely friendly staff. Our whole experience was faultless from start to finish and although I would admit the swimming pool area could do with some modernisation the rest of the hotel more than make up for this. Haruna and her staff in the executive lounge on the 31st floor are such a lovely team working together helping to create such a lovely. A special little mention to Constance and Fiona who's service in the lounge was truly fantastic. One little criticism. I know wifi is free in the executive lounge for guests but surely this should be extended throughout the hotel. It is a 5 star hotel and come on this is 2010. All in all a wonderful stay and if you can stretch that little bit further the lounge is extremely good value for money. Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Stay - Plush rooms, extra touches”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta_Banana
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Conrad Centennial was only for 2 nights as Singapore was a super quick stopover where we got in around dinner time, and left at 4 or 5 in the morning after only one full day to tour the city. We were warned ahead of time that "Singapore is more American than America" and indeed they are correct. It's like a clean maze of malls and commerce! The service was top notch and we were upgraded to a business floor and given a complimentary breakfast. The room was very plush with a gorgeous, spacious bathroom, soft bed, high tech electronics/TV, mini bar, and complimentary chocolates and fruit. The breakfast was business attire required but many of the patrons were more casual - probably because it was so hot out and many (like ourselves) did not expect the free upgrade and may not have packed accordingly. There was a very diverse display on the buffet - American breakfast items, and plenty of varieties of Asian foods too. You could mix eggs and bacon with noodles and spicy selections. The lobby had complimentary wireless that we took advantage of in the late afternoon - sitting in luxurious couches with a pianist performing classical music. There are plenty of restaurants right outside the hotel - we choose to eat at these mostly and did not eat at the hotel except for breakfast. It was the lunar New Year celebration while we were there, and we got lucky and came across performers at one of the malls in the late afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “WOW- just WOW!”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtr4veler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and we were sad to leave. The service is outstanding, the breakfast was excellent, the bathroom is close to the ones I have at home and man do I love it. This hotel know how to do their business. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...just excellent”
Reviews.Author: kmrau
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on my very short list of favorite places to stay in the whole world. It's that good. The place works like a well oiled machine. From the time my family and I arrived for our 3-night stay, we were extremely well looked after. The check-in staff, the concierge desk and the support staff were all courteous and the service level was top notch. Having effused praise on the hotel itself, I must admit that the hotel's location is not ideal if you're a tourist. There's practically no tourist attraction (other than the Singapore Flyer) that's a short walk away. While the hotel itself is great, there may be better options depending on what you're in the city for. For me, however, location's a minor irritation. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant unexpected discovery”
Reviews.Author: bunechca
Reviews.Content: Usually during our travelling in Singapore we stayed in Ritz Carlton Millenia Singapore, but this time I find a very good offer from Conrad, read lots of review and decided to try. Initially I was very prejudiced and searched negative in everything. But my stay where exceeded all my expectation. It is really luxury first class hotel. We lived in club room on the 26 floor with beautiful Marina bay view. Besides, from our room we saw Marina Mandarin Hotel, Pan Pacific hotel and Singapore Convention Centre. Hotel is very comfortable situated - near fountain of wealth - Suntec City. 2 MRT station - Esplanade and Promenade - 5 minutes walk. Transfer from airport to the hotel takes about 20 minutes and costs 17-20 sing dollars. When we entered to the hotel we were invited to the club floor for check-in. Check-in was very prompt. So far the staff did all formalities we were offered to drink champagne or wine. After that we were accompanied to our room. Room was spacious, comfortable and well equipped. The king size bed was very cosy. The bathroom had cabin and bath. There were even scales. Complimentary water and tea, coffee facilities. Unfortunately wi-fi internet was charged, but in club rooms you have 1 hour a day complimentary wi-fi. Lounge was very pleasant but there were too many people, although we always could find the vacant table. Beverage and alcoholic drinks are available for free during the whole day till 22-30. Breakfast, sweets and dishes during cocktail hours were really magnificent and very tasty. We lived in the hotel 4 days and we did not see the same dishes. Great array. I was very surprised. The swimming pool was on the fourth floor – was spacious enough. I was surprised again when we were brought a complimentary cool water and apples. And the smell in lobby was so charming – I did not want to leave from there. What I would like to change – extend Lounge operating time till midnight and add some dishes between breakfast and cocktail hours and complimentary internet in club rooms. So I can recommend this hotel to everybody who likes luxury and very attentive and effective service. As for me, it was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed and I plan to return there again if the parity price-quality will be the same. I want to thank local incredible staff for very memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service was the One Significant Differentiator”
Reviews.Author: Rafaya
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Conrad Singapore for 3 nights on business trip since the meeting also took place in the same venue. I arrived at 5 PM and was quite disappointed when found out that they ran out of single rooms and thus I got a twin room instead. The only thing that made it better was the promise that the room would definitely have a good view and there were little glasses filled with refreshing juices served to us during check-in. It was the first time ever I got served with welcome drinks in any hotels in Singapore and trust me, I have been to many of them. What a nice little touch ! Then a staff took me up to my room and it was as promised, with the corner room, there were 2 windows and the small window on the side looks out directly at the Singapore Eye while the other one oversees the marina bay area. My first problem with the room happened when the door wouldn't be locked from the outside. Upon calling the reception, they fixed it within 10 minutes time while profusely appologizing for the problem. Later on when I was turning on the shower, the hot water shower knob fell off but fortunately I was able to put it back on since by this time I didn't want to wait for them to fix it up. Then as I was going to make tea, I found out that there were used and empty sugar and tea sachets in the bowl. So it was kinda bad impression that they didn't clean the room thoroughly. I was determined to write my review and give the hotel a 2 Star Rating due to these - until I experienced their level of service and hospitality ! All staff were always friendly and polite without seemingly pretentious. On the second night, I came home around 945 PM only to realized that I had forgotten to buy a medicine for my stomache. So I went to the Concierge and asked him the nearest drugstore. He led me out of the door and I thought he was going to show me the direction. But nooo, he actually crossed the street with me, entered the Millenia Shopping Mall right across the street and led me into an almost closing drug store. He then asked the cashier lady to keep the store opened and serve me because I was in need of a medicine. After making sure that I was fully attended, he smiled and left. I didn't get his name and never encountered him again for the rest of my stay, but it sure was one of the best service I have experienced in my life. The rest of my stay, I kept experiencing this extra-mile level of service throughout the hotel. When I asked the direction of the toilet, a staff didn't just show me the direction but actually led me down the stairs and into the front door of the ladies' room. In the meeting room, while waiting for coffee in the coffee machine, the staff asked me to wait inside and he then later brought my coffee in. Upon check-out, one of the concierge ladies even waited and chatted with me while waiting for a taxi. This hotel definitely brings a whole new meaning to service especially when service tends to be practical, efficient and in business-like manners in most singapore hotels. Their personal touch and sincere willingness to take a step ahead in guaranteeing the guest's experience is definitely an added value to the hotel. Although I am tempted to give them a 4-Star Rating, Ithe 3-Star Rating is due to the old-dated rooms, thin walls and also the fact that the TV is facing sideways to the bed which was a bit inconvenient since I like to watch the TV while falling asleep and having it on my side was kinda weird.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - the nicest hotel I have every stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: scooby_d00_uk
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start with this place... There is a reason it's one of the best hotels in Singapore... The staff are fantastic - all really friendly and more than happy to help you. My room was excellent - very spacious with a huge LCD TV and an excellent king size bed. The bathroom had both a shower and a bath and was clad in marble with lots of free toiletries provided. Both the room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. The hotel also has a great pool and nice spa facilities. There is a bar right next to the pool and it's a great place to come and escape the extreme heat and humidity of Singapore. Breakfast is excellent - you can everything from a selection of local cuisine to waffles and ice cream! Fresh juice and coffee is often topped up whilst you are away from your table. When I visited, the IT expo was on at the exhibition centre over the road, which made the area extremely busy and made getting to the MRT difficult at times. If I'm ever back in Singapore, this is the hotel I will aim to stay at. I really cannot fault it - it's excellent.

Reviews.Title: “truly a great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Chets_9
Reviews.Content: the conrad singapore is a real gem!! the rooms were fantastic. the staff at check in were very polite and helpful. the minute you enter the hotel you get a good feeling, very classy. the breakfast in the lounge on the ground floor has a great indoor/outdoor setting. staff at the breakfast area were great, good service and a nice spread. highly reccomended!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed at so far”
Reviews.Author: kevin_mumbai
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth recommending and a great location too. Very courteous service and very nice rooms and view. Only negative was the fact that I got a room on a smoking floor which gave a bit of a bad stench of stale smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless room, excellent service, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Aggie_Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room at the Conrad over Christmas and New Year and found it to be a most pleasant and welcoming experience. Our reservation notice from Expedia stated that bedding for the third guest was included in our total booking fee, however on checking in we were informed that this was not the case and we would have to pay an extra SIN$500 to have a trundle bed delivered to our room. We queried this charge and, following discussion with the Front Desk Manager, our check-in assistant, Clint, informed us that the fee had been waived and that a bed would be delivered to our room free of charge! We were most grateful for the hotel's decision and it helped start our holiday off on a positive note. Our room was spotlessly cleaned every day by the housekeeping staff, with fresh fruit provided daily. We were also given a delicious cake to share on Christmas Eve. We received a turn-down service every evening, where slippers were placed on a clean mat on the floor next to our beds, classical music was left playing on the stereo system and bottles of spring water and clean glasses were placed on our bedside tables. Our spacious bathroom was always tidy, with towels, robes and toiletries replenished without asking. The pool was clean and rarely crowded, deep enough for serious lap-swimming as well as spacious enough to muck around in without disturing other guests. The complimentary chilled water and fruit provided by the pool staff was most welcome. The overground wallk from the Conrad to City Hall MRT station takes approximately 6mins whereas the underground walk takes approximately 12mins, however, it is an air-conditioned route which can be a welcome relief from the humidity. We also saw construction of a new MRT station diagonally opposite the hotel, which will make for an easier walk once the new line opens. For a cheaper alternative to airport taxis and shuttles there is a SMRT bus (number 153?) that travels via the Conrad to and from Changi Airport. Suntec City Mall, Millenia Walk, and Marina Square are within very easy walking distance and contain retail shops, supermarkets, fast food outlets and food courts (and a cinema in Marina Square). Also Makansutra at Glutton's Bay is a great introduction to traditional hawker-style food and a stroll along the Esplanade provides for an enjoyable after dinner activity. Overall, the hotel was always quiet despite the high number of guests staying over the holiday period and it is definitely somewhere where we would consider staying on our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: HansRotterdam
Reviews.Content: Stranded in Singapore for a week due to airspace closure in Europe, this hotel really understood our needs and were fantastic ! Service is excellent, rooms are really nice: big, spacious and very well cleaned. For us the best 5 star we have seen in the Far East. Greatly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “not a 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: The-El-Primo
Reviews.Content: been here for a week. well maintained, good collection of artworks, and a very helpful concierge. its obviously aged, room was quite small, and the view, not worth the price your paying coz the bay is far and pan pacific and mandarin blocked it even we're on one of the top floors. and oh you'll see the merlion afar, candysized. this conrad is no five-star at all. maybe back then. the breakfast spread was like just what you can have in a 4-star hotel. location was just ok. bottomline, i'd rather have st. regis. lastly which was really disappointing was that they dont have spa aminities, just an old pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with superb breakfast buffet at Oscars!”
Reviews.Author: Tootsie828
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Conrad for 5 days and overall we had a very great experience. Everyday we always looked forward to the buffet breakfast which was the best! Hotel staff are friendly. Only one complaint is the housekeeping on the last day, the towels were not arranged and you felt like the room was no longer cleaned. But I would definitely stay in this hotel again, hopefully be able to get their January sale again at 50% off. If you want to have a relaxing vacation throughout, stay at Conrad as you will definitely start your day right with their superb breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: trmncsu91
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad on the tail end of a 2 weeks Asia trip. Nothing negative to say about the experience. The hotel is getting a bit dated, and the pool area is just very average. Front desk and executive level lounge service was excellent. Only stayed in Singapore for 48 hours and thats about all you need as there is not much to do in the city !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you like renovation works right outside your door”
Reviews.Author: Goofy05
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with extended family ( 3 rooms) for 7 nights beginning April 2010 - on 23rd floor. Initially was quite impressed with the service, rooms, pool, staff etc. Bathroom is large and extremely clean. Hotel is tucked away but connected to numerous malls and near fountain of wealth with lots of eating options. Breakfast and dinner at 'Oscars' was exceptional. The hotel must have been full on the first 2 nights as we had to have breakfast in the Ballroom which was no where near as good as Oscars. They have a great selection, and Neil on the waffle station was superb. However after the 4th night maintenance works began on the same floor that we were all on. This consisted of painting doors with high strength oil paints/varnishes, and then removing wallpaper and re-wallpapering using glues and adhesives. The first night we had EXTREMELY strong fumes coming through the airconditioning in one of our rooms. Went to reception where we were offered to move rooms the FOLLOWING AFTERNOON. The next day we were offered a new room on the same floor, so we packed up and moved. There were ioniser machines up and down the corridor, and I thought this would be it. Not so, the works continued and each day there were at least 4 workmen with ladders and wallpaper EVERYwhere, vacuum cleaners all through the aisle, and the fumes - my goodness. I was so shocked and went and contacted reception - I just got a 'sorry for the inconvenience'. I couldn't believe that a 5 star hotel would carry out major maintenance works on the same floor where guests were staying. It wasn't just the inconvenience of having to walk through all the mess, but the strong fumes gave us all headaches/nausea/dry coughs etc etc. Couldn't believe the attitude of the staff when we checked out. They obviously didn't see it as a problem, and for this reason I will never stay at a Conrad or recommend this hotel to anyone. There are plenty of other hotels in the area that treat their guests better than this. I suggest you try 'The Fairmont', 'Pan Pacific' or 'Marina Mandarin'.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Conrad - best deal during January Sale!!”
Reviews.Author: TanyaMumOfTwo
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old son and I had two Business Rooms booked at the Conrad for three nights over Easter on our way home to Australia from Seoul. I had been lucky enough to see their January Sale prices for weekends at the Hotel throughout 2010 (paid in full in advance) and they were too good to pass up. I will plan my next visit to Singapore (and I'm sure there'll be one as I love that place!!) so as to take advantage of this sale again if I can. (I paid a TOTAL, ie. including all taxes, of SGD600 per room and one of the nights wasn't even classed as a weekend!!). As these were Business Rooms we also received SGD20 credit for laundry per room per day, and a guaranteed late checkout of 3pm. In fact, one of the rooms was extended to 5pm as our flight didn't leave for home until 9pm. GREAT value.
