Lots has been said about the comfort and amenities of the rooms and it's all true - great beds, great plasma screens with good channels, beautiful bathrooms, quality fittings, beautiful timber accents and sensational views. And breakfast (included in my price) was fabulous! One challenge is to negotiate the best route to the City Hall MRT - although the new Circle line will be open any day now and that will make getting around Singapore from the Conrad a lot easier. They had a "soft" opening of this line on one of our days in town and 50,000 people showed up to ride it for free between 11am and 4pm!! Nearby malls include Marina Square (find it via the Millenia Walk opposite the Hotel) and Suntec City. Raffles City is also close. Walking through the underground walkways/arcades makes all this a pleasant experience - over ground is quicker, but sweatier!! A couple of Food Courts are nearby - closest to the Conrad is "Koufu" (I think the spelling is correct) and we ate there a couple of times as it was soooo close and convenient and yummy!! Then there is the Food Loft at top of Marina Square (next best) and Food Republic at Suntec (third best as always sooo busy it's hard to find anywhere to sit down!!). Hope those hints help - LOVED the Conrad and if I can get that price again I'll be back there in a flash!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sapphire1008
Reviews.Content: clean, nice, near to the city, and to the train station. its accessible to the near tourism spots of singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice club lounge.”
Reviews.Author: s_pearceHoChiMinh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Singapore Conrad hotel on several occasions and have always enjoyed the personal service given by the club lounge. The view from the lounge is nice and the breakfast and evening cocktails are plentiful. The rooms are well decorated and quiet with comfortable beds. The location is not the best, but still within easy access to all places in the city. The swimming pool and gym are adequate and I found the service around the pool to be excellent. There are a few restaurants located outside the hotel and of course like most hotels in Singapore it is located directly opposite 2 shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “No Soccer Channel, otherwise everything is perfect”
Reviews.Author: Sockie_SGP
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at the Conrad hotel for one night to celebrate our anniversary. At the same time, we were hoping to catch the EPL games during our stay. However, we were disappointed to find that the hotel has no soccer channel! Besides the above, everything else is perfect. The hotel has one of the best breakfast variety as compared to the other nearby hotels which we have stayed before. Service was great regardless that we are locals.

Reviews.Title: “above average city hotel”
Reviews.Author: louisa1956
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on stopover to Bali. Booked club floor. Arrived 6.30 am and they managed to find us a double room, albeit a smoking room, but after a long flight, not to bothered. They brought an ionizer to the room and sprayed it which did help. Room very large and bed and pillows very comfortable. Bathroom, bath and shower also very large with nice double sinks and plenty of toiletries and amenity kits. Club lounge was excellent, as were the staff. Views from lounge have to be among the best in Singapore, kept moving seats to get different views. Good drinks and plenty of them and good selection of nibbles (better than the Mandarin Oriental where we stayed on the way back). Pool was also better than the Pan Pacific and the service excellent. Would definitely stay here again next time passing through Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: NZersabroadLondon
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel! The service was exceptional, we couldn't stop raving how great the staff was. If you stay we would recommend to choose an Executive Room as it includes access to the Executive Lounge with breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails included! fantastic. There is free wireless in the lobby and in the lounge which was very useful. The girl in the exec lounge check in/out was fantastic, she chased around to find us on the last day to give us our honeymoon conrad teddies! what great service.. And the health/pool person - sorry I didn;t get names - but he was also fantastic! Always smiling and making sure we had enough towels and drinks. Five star service!!

Reviews.Title: “Teddy Bear”
Reviews.Author: BazzerBoy
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a conveinent part of the town. Facilities are great with easy access to malls and restaurants. Great views of the sungapore flyer. King size beds are very comfortable and the bathroom is great. I loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: caide1990
Reviews.Content: After considering the reviews on TripAdvisor we decided to stay here for a weekend while in Singapore. We arrived early in the morning after a red-eye and we headed straight to the hotel. Upon entering, our bags were taken from us and we were shown to reception. Initial impressions were good. A very understated lobby. The gentleman who checked us in was very polite and did not once mention that it is only 8am and the official check-in time is not for a while. He took took us to our room while making friendly small chat along the way. We were shown the facilities and he asked us if we needed anything else. The room - Generous size. Very clean (carpet still wet!). Bathroom - luxurious with amenities you'd expect from a 5 star hotel. TV & Radio - techy, maybe a little too techy.. not very user friendly. Bed & Pillow Menu - one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. Guaranteed a good nights sleep. Location - 10-15min walk from MRT. Across the road from Suntec. 2 negatives - 1) My partner spotted mould in the shower. Although it didn't bother me, it bothered her. She called up reception and they acknowledged this and said they would send someone up. Nothing happened. After 10 hours she called up again and explained what had happened. They apologized and said they would send someone up. Shortly after we heard a knock at the door. He simply looked at it and apologized and said it would be cleaned. It was never cleaned. Upon checkout we explained the situation again and they didn't seem phased by it. It's hard not to expect a lot better from Conrad. Although this did not trouble me, it might trouble the 'demanding business traveler' who would expect a discount, complimentary wine or dinner as an apology. 2) While service was impressive at check-in, it soon disappeared. The young lady who opened the door each time you enter and exit the hotel looked bored out of her skull and wouldn't break a smile or mutter a hello. Once again, not a huge issue, but for people who have high expectations - you might be disappointed. I am not entirely sure if I'd return to Conrad Singapore. There is a huge choice of hotels in this category that I'd love to try.

Reviews.Title: “Aging hotel, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: Delegator
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad Centennial for two nights, as did a colleague (separate rooms). Both of us found that the hotel, while updated cosmetically and having a nice swimming pool, had sub-par service, poor cleanliness, and mediocre rooms. The service problems all centered on the desk personnel. Upon check-in I happened to notice that my colleague was being offered a "business package" that my clerk never mentioned. It turned out that this package ($20 in laundry/cleaning credit, plus breakfast, and a 3 PM checkout time, for one fee) was something that would work out well for me. I was glad to be able to get it, but slightly annoyed that my clerk didn't mention it while my colleague's clerk did. The rooms themselves, supposedly on a special "business" floor, were mediocre (see picture). Not much space, and no king size beds available despite having made our reservations 2+ months in advance. Worse, my colleague had problems with mildew or fungus in his room (again, see photo). He ended up switching to a new room for the second day, once space opened up. The service problems returned as we approached check-out. As I was packing around 2 PM, I got a knock on my door. It turned out to be a desk clerk, who asked, "Excuse me sir, but we were wondering whether you were planning on checking out today?" with an air of nervous expectation. I responded that I was planning on leaving by the 3 PM checkout time...was that not enough? He looked very confused and left. It turned out that there was no notation on my account about a 3 PM late checkout -- but there was the charge for the Business Package that included this privilege. My colleague experienced almost the reverse when finally checking out. In his case, nobody bothered him about leaving before 3 PM, but the $20 laundry credit had not been properly applied to his bill. The desk clerk was less than gracious (and less than competent) about dealing with it. So, overall, I was disappointed. This was supposed to be a high-end Hilton property, but it didn't have particularly nice rooms and the service just wasn't very good. Given the number of quality hotels within a couple of square blocks, there have to be better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, clean and spacious - helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Erehwon1
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in Singapore - not as close to the quays as other hotels but this is a very nice hotel, with spacious rooms, very clean and well appointed and the staff was always very helpful. It is also very close to tons of shopping. The breakfast buffet was very nice but could be very crowded at times and because of the crowds the wait staff seemed overwhelmed at times. The buffet was a little on the expensive side but not exceedingly. This should not detract from someone considering staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Still like it”
Reviews.Author: mdns
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at Conrad Singapore in less than a year. We have a different bedroom, better views but somehow the physical size of the bedroom was smaller. Apparently the breakfast on the Ground Floor was much more expansive, but we like the Executive Lounge for it's less crowded. The staff were also friendly as always and remember names by the second day.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer321
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay in the Conrad on our way to Italy and were impressed with this hotel. Large bedroom (Executive), excellent breakfast and an extended checkout of 6pm. Great pool too. Very polite and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 2-night Stay!”
Reviews.Author: andyph
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews of the Conrad on TripAdvisor, I expected a lot out of my stay, and the hotel didn't disappoint even a bit. We arrived early morning at the hotel, and the FO staff promptly did our check-in, and the room was ready in 15mins as it was an early check-in. The room was clean, spacious and the bed was comfortable. The brunch at Oscar's was great, though I expected a bit more variety out of the buffet. Would highly recommend the Tiramisu at Oscar's. Golden Peony was excellent, great Chinese food. Overall the stay was excellent, the large TV and the complimentary DVD selection was exceptional. Proximity to the City Hall MRT station and the Marina Square Mall, and of course the Suntec Centre adds to the appeal of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely weekend at the Conrad Centennial,Singapore”
Reviews.Author: voyager068
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad last weekend in an Executive room.It was a very pleasant experience.The room and bathroom were spacious and well equiped.Room cleaning was efficient and performed by the time i returned from breakfast.All staff i came to contact with were curteous and helpful.The food and drink in the Executive lounge was varied and tasty.The lifts came very speedily.The gym was quite well equiped but i would have liked a reclining bike as well.The gym staff were very friendly(as were all vhe taxi drivers i encountered and the taxi fares were reasonable).Perhaps on one occasion there were not enough poolside loungers for the size of the hotel and in parts some of the public area carpets were stained.Overall a lovely stop over weekend..

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: oks943idk4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stunning. I arrived late at night after a long flight and I was treated to exceptional service and beautiful surroundings. My room was very spacious and had all the comforts I required. If you want to give yourself a treat, stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality room, efficient staff, quiet and yet still unsatisfying”
Reviews.Author: john_tripping
Reviews.Content: I was genuinely impressed with the quality of the bed, bedding and the tv. The lighting was a little clinical, but was ok. Service at front desk was brisk and efficient. So why the average review? I guess I was disappointed by a very poor breakfast, where the pool was positioned but most of all by the useless incidentals I was afforded by my hotels.com deal. Having potential to book a meeting room free for one hour and twenty sing bucks of free laundry was far less useful than internet access. That came at an outrageous premium. Also no free water, so having to ferry that in and out irked me too. Its location is quiet, but not exactly interesting. If I was in SIngapore on business, this would be a solid choice. Leisure - I'm sure there must be more suitable places.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Excellent Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: paso57
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a two-night stay at Conrad Centennial. The staff could not be more accommodating; they seemed to go far out of their way to please. Room was spotless and extremely comfortable. Location directly across the street from Suntec Convention Center and the Paulanner Brewery (welcome after a hot, humid day); would have like to be closer to City Hall MRT Station, but there is an A/C shopping passage from Suntec to the MRT Station (perhaps 15 minutes walk). The accommodations exceeded the cost in terms of value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel but a bit far from MRT”
Reviews.Author: dryus
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel and the rooms. Clean, modern and luxury. The staff are friendly. The hotel surrounded by shopping centers, restaurants, cafes etc. Very convenient & happening. The only weakness is the public transport MRT - it is quite a distance to reach the nearest MRT, which is City Hall station. I gather there will be a new closeby station that will be opened soon. In overall the hotel is brilliant

Reviews.Title: “End of Honeymoon in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the best hotel I have ever stayed in. From the moment we arrived all the small things you expect from a top quality hotel was there. Fresh fruit in room, friendly staff, quick efficient service, local advice. After getting over the shock of the Singapore heat, the location is central to some excellent tourist and shopping spots. The buffet breakfast and buffet dinner were top quality and excellent value for money. We required some medical assistance while in Singapore and the hotel organised room extensions and they arrange for changes to our flights back to Europe.

Reviews.Title: “I was expecting more.”
Reviews.Author: Trip_Datum
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of the "Hilton Family" and this was my first time in a Conrad. I don't know why but I was expecting a level of service higher than the Hilton hotels. Instead of this I've had an average experience and I'll not remember this hotel (neither for good nor for bad). Rooms (I've had a King Executive): spacious, with OK decoration; but two faults: the bed is too high and there was some visible mοuld in the ceiling. Fruits and water were replenished regularly. Executive lounge: nice place, beautifully decorated but I think it is small for the number of executive rooms it serves. 4 nights there and it was full of people and 2 nights really packed! I've noticed that every night a specific table was prepared for two specific people with extra food (sushi, salads etc.) on top of the food available during the cocktail time. I assumed that there were either special guests or senior hotel manager(s). If it is the first case then I do not find clever on behalf of the hotel to give such a visible special treatment. I assume that special guests are staying at big suites where special food could be served. If it is the second case (hotel manager) then it is unacceptable. I am a manager myself and I know that a manager doesn't give itself a special treatment in front of his clients and especially when the availability of services (in this case available space in the lounge) is limited. Service: Friendly staff, good professionalism, the level you expect in SE Asia and that's all. Overall impression: it misses this "something" that will put it in a higher level. I believe that the hotel management is missing a real good opportunity to transform this hotel into a real gem. It seems to me that this is a case where the hotel manager(s) is just "running a business" but not really " managing a Hilton". I'll recommend it to friends if they can find a good offer but next time in Singapore I'll try another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Modern, quiet and comfy”
Reviews.Author: FatcatJunketeer
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in a biz floor room. The location is on the quiter end of Marina Bay/Suntec, and a short walk to those malls; not quite as convenient as the Ritz or MO. Less than10 mins walk to City Hall MRT if you navigate there correctly, 20 mins if you dont. Taxis are usually a short 5-10min wait off-peak, even on weekdays, probably due to the slighly isolated location. A rather dark lobby contrasts with bright and airy corridoors on guest floors. The room felt a little cramped, but was a reasonable size (about 40sqm). The bed is ridiculously high (comfy but a little too firm) and the TV bolted to the wall and perpendicular to the bed, which is absurd since you cant really watch TV from the bed. A pity too since there's a massive HDTV and a dvd player for entertainment. Bathroom was spacious and had generic toiletries and decent pressure from the rather average showerhead. Decent view of the Bay but in general the views are of city buildings only. A few pieces of fruit everyday and the bear and rubber ducky are nice touches. There's an outdoor pool and a small gym which makes up for its size by being open 24 hours. Breakfast by the pool was average, small selection of hot and cold items, pretty standard and nothing outstanding. They apparently do eggs to order but you have to spot the little sign they place on one of the buffet tables to be aware of this as they dont publicise it. They also stipulate strict dress codes for breakfast but I spotted someone wearing shorts there anyhow so why have a policy if you are not going to enforce it. Having to dress up for breakfast is ridiculous but I believe this is only for the biz (and possibly exec) floor brekkie venues. A decent and comfy hotel, mostly catering to the business rather than leisure traveller, as it seems to lack warmth and personality. Great value though and not that different (unless you are a high maintenance type who enjoys being brown nosed etc) to the Ritz across the road which costs significantly more and isnt worth the premium IMHO.

Reviews.Title: “You will not beat this hotel for service”
Reviews.Author: pmhslh
Reviews.Content: Returned to Conrad Singapore from 17th Feb to 21st feb with family,and on arrival got upgraded to the Presidential Suite ( room 2901 ) . Huge living room,seperate dining room,marble bathroom with oversize bath,3 t.vs very impressive. If you are looking for a hotel with it all you should stay here. The standard rooms are very spacious,with 42" flatscreen t.v,comfortable beds with crisp white Egyptian cotton sheets.Marble bathrooms,lovely views from the higher exec floor rooms.Food is fantastic,and you would not get a better buffet breakfast anywhere,the selection is huge, too long a choice to list - ( even ice cream for breakfast ! ) The thing that i want to mention most about his hotel is the service.The staff should be so proud of their high service levels of customer service,you will just not get better,and Conrad Singapore puts most other hotels service levels to shame.Every member of staff was exceptional from managers down to cleaners,most knew our name - i dont know how with 500 other guests walking around. One member of staff that just shone and stood out from the others was Roy in the executive lounge.He was simply a diamond.He put himself out to make sure our needs were met with a smile.He got ice creams for our kids,brought some chocolates for my wife,he couldnt do enough,but in a good way.He was not intrusive or overbearing,but when you asked he was a top man. If you are staying in Singapore and do not know where to pick,i highly reccommend this hotel,it ticks all the boxes and never dissapoints.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Centennial Singapore”
Reviews.Author: BettinaV
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. The food, the service, the location.

Reviews.Title: “for Hilton HHonors user”
Reviews.Author: YukaH
Reviews.Content: to get mile, you can earn at there. They have nice pool and relaxation massage place. Near side of hotel, there is Funshui spot.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: wise_lily
Reviews.Content: I had a blast staying 3 nights at this hotel. Perfect service, incredible breakfast buffet with so many cuisines, how I love traveling in Asia, the best service in the world! Fresh fruits every morning at your door, beautiful room, so comfy bed, beautiful lobby, good location. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with 1st class service!”
Reviews.Author: AlexC_RO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad Singapore between 13-19th of Febraury, looking for a week of relaxation with my wife. We got a Business Room on 23rd floor with view to the Fountain of Wealth. Room was very generous, with desk, armchair, 50" LCD TV and a huge 2x2m tall bed. The bathroom was huge, and full of towels and great ammenities. It had a tub and a shower, you can't really expect anything more. What really turned this trip into a great holiday was not the room, but the service received. The staff was always receptive and doing their job very well, from cleaning the room, serving breakfast, serving us by the pool or "pampering" us in the Executive Lounge. In terms of location, the hotel is 10 minutes away from City-Hall MRT station, but we mostly used buses for transportation. They have AC, arrive every 5 minutes, they take you quickly and directly to many areas in the city. We loved the Conrad, and our son (stayed home) loves the little teddy-bear we got as a present :)

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Enjoyable :D”
Reviews.Author: Hburn10
Reviews.Content: We couldnt resist the excellent offer of having 50% off weekends from their Jan10 sale so it was a stayacation for us from 19-21 Feb (3d2n). It was also nice of the reservation team to offer to upgrade us to the Executive floor after I made some feedback about the room rates, so kudos to that. Our classic twin-bedded room was on the 30th floor, offering views of Suntec City. The room at 40sm felt smaller than most as the bathroom occupied a sizeable portion of the room. Beddings and furniture were all very well maintained, although am not sure it was because we were on the Executive floor. Bathroom amenities were more than sufficient and the conrad bear was a quite signature touch for guests. The only thing is I didnt quite understand the layout of the TV as it was placed adjacent to the beds, which made watching TV quite tricky. The beds were terribly comfortable too! Requests for extra bottled water, towels, and ice buckets were met with quickly, and I had 2 pieces of laundry pressed as part of the perks of the Exe floor, which was returned very efficiently as well. We spent most of our time at the Executive Lounge as the aim of the trip was really to just relax and enjoy. I would recommend anyone to take the Executive floor rooms as the Lounge has complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea from 2:30pm - 5pm, then evening tapas from 5:30pm - 8pm. And its free flow of coffee, tea, soft drinks, wine, and sparkling wine, and housepours all day until 11pm. Basically you can have all your meals there if you want. Quality of food was also excellent given that it was offered complimentry. I had sandwiches, dim sum, chips, sweets, pralines, cheese platter etc and all were very good. They even have a nespresso machine for you to make your own coffee. In particular, Roy from the Executive Lounge represented the hotel magnificantly. Throughout my stays and travels, I have never ever experienced such a high level of service from any hotel. He was courteous, attentive without being intrusive, and indeed efficient. He made us feel totally welcomed at the lounge, despite the fact that we were probably one of the youngest group at the lounge. He went out of his way to ensure our needs were met, and always had a smile on his face even during busy periods. We observed that he delivered the same level of service to the other guests at the Lounge. The above, does also come with a slight comparison to a lady staff at the same Lounge during the stay unfortunately. We might have been mistaken as she may have been in a bad mood that day, but we encountered disdain in her eyes when we first entered the Lounge on 19 Feb, and throughout the afternoon she never served us at all nor smiled. At that time, the Lounge was slightly occupied with a few groups of non-locals, so we were the only local (and younger in age) group that afternoon. Regardless of what was the cause behind her attitude, it should not have happened, especially at the Lounge. And we caught her a few times slouching against the Lounge walls when not serving guests, which looked quite unsightly. But otherwise, the stay was most enjoyable. Good location for shopping as the hotel is right next to Suntec, Marina Square and Millenia Walk which offers multiple choices. I am watching out for new promotions and am coming back again if so!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: TravellerKen
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 days during the Lunar New Year at an exec club room, Requested room on same floor as exec lounge and was given one during check-in! :) The exec longe personnel were most helpful all the time. Service was excellent. I asked for the Straits Times newspaper as it's the weekend and on the 2nd day of the New Year when the newspaper wasn't printed, they delivered the New Paper instead. I thought it was a very nice gesture. Took breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails at the exec lounge - a good spread of all sorts of food. They have 4 different kinds of red wine and 4 whites to choose from, as well as champagne. Location is good, the nearby Millennia Walk is connected to Marina Square with hundreds of shops (but of course most were closed during the lunar new year period). Room was just normal size, bed was a bit too high and my first of two complaints was that while the bed faced the south with a most wonderful view of the city skyline and the Singapore River, the plasma TV was mounted on the right wall. So if we are in bed, we have to turn our heads to the right to watch the TV. Not exactly comfortable. The other complaint was that while the bathroom is of good size and amply endowed with good toilettries (Acca Kappa range), there isn't a socket for hair dryer! Apart from these two peeves, my stay was most enjoyable. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value.”
Reviews.Author: Takehimanywheretwice
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a suite in this hotel for such a ridiculously low rate I kept checking my booking in case they'd made a mistake. This is the main reason we stayed here and we weren't let down. The hotel has all the facilities and the suite was enormous. The bed was supremely comfortable and the room had everything you could wish for. This said we plan to visit Singapore again and stay at the Mandarin Oriental in thier bay (or ocean) view room The CS does everything well and would be great for business but as a holiday hotel it's simply too sterile. Who wants to go on holiday and feel like you're on a business trip? Location is OK but everywhere other than the Suntec shopping mall is a bit of a walk / taxi. The general finish of the place is very good in the public areas (except the pool which is clean, functional but very bland) but only ok in the rooms. Nothing is bad but on the flip side nothing a special. Furniture placement is poorly thought out and makes staying in your room not as enjoyable as it could be. Try the MO (we had them show us one of thier rooms) and you'll know what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Fanstatic Value and Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shaunsia
Reviews.Content: I checked-in before noon and was given a standard room immediately to rest coz the Suite I booked was not yet ready. Anyway shortly after 2 pm my room was ready and I was being upgraded to the Presidential Suite. From the moment I stepped into the Presidential Suite, everything was perfect right to the end when I was granted late check-out till 6 pm. Let me start by writing on their standard room (my standard room was on the Club Floor so can't comment on other standard room) as I was in there for about 2 hours before changing room. Their standard room is of good size, extremely well designed and totally printine, give you the feeling that the hotel was just built yesterday. The toilet is abit on the small side compared to Ritz Carlton (see my other review) but wonderfully stocked with lots of high quality amenities (Acca Kappa). The only thing I don't like about the whole room is the toilet cubicle, it is miniscule, literally (same for Ritz Carlton as well so I wonder is this the trend in Singapore hotels?). Other than that, their standard room is really value for money if you can get a good deal with the hotel. The Club Lounge is very well decorated with big plasma TV and comfortable chairs though the view is quite limited. The lounge serves daily breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails, with free flow of champagne till 11 pm when the lounge closes. The food is good but not marvellous and not many selections. The lounge is nice but the only glitch is it seems to be teeming with people at all times, especially worse during evening cocktail where you will have difficulty finding a place to sit. I cannot comment on the breakfast scene as I did not have breakfast there. You do not feel the exclusivity of a five star hotel Club Lounge when it is that busy. The service in the Club Lounge is great, but not as professional compared to that at Ritz-Carlton. Now the Presidential Suite. I have attached a few pictures of this Suite so it is mainly self-explanatory. As with the standard room I been to, the PS is very well maintained and very clean. It has got a bedroom (on the tiny side I would say), a living room, a dinning room, a pantry, a powder room, and sitting area with standard amenities of a PS such as cordless phone, fax machine and etc. I find the bed abit hard but this is a matter of personal preference. The one thing to emphasize is the dinning room. It has a unblocked view of the Marina, and it is a great enjoyment to have in-room dinning while overlooking the Marina. This hotel has a DVD library that you can loan DVD for your own viewing pleasure in your room, though I am not sure if this feature is also available to non-Club floor rooms. One thing worth highlighting is checking in and out at the Club Floor. Check-in was done on the Club Floor, where I find it strange that there is only one person and one table serving check-in guests. A few times I saw guests have to queue (standing as the check-in desk is just outside the elevator and there are no seats) for a while when checking in or out, and the same goes for me during check-out. Unlike checking out at Ritz-Carlton where you have the luxury of sititing in the Club Lounge enjoying drinks while they prepare the bills and bring it to you at your table. I checked out at 6 pm, and I was asked if I would like to continue my evening cocktails at their lounge, so I guess guests still have access to the lounge after check-out. Overall this is a great hotel if you are looking for an opulent hotel with good location without paying too much, and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone business or leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure you get the city skyline view”
Reviews.Author: HraPormestari
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in Conrad Centennial during our tour in Southeast Asia, and got to know that the hotel is pure luxury right from the start. Shopping around for the best rate is recommended, though, but then again that's the case in the vast majority of cases. The lobby in Conrad is very posh as are also all of the other public spaces. The hotel staff is proficient and friendly, and they really make you feel welcome. The concierge is always there for you, if you need some kind of assistance or advice. The pool at the hotel is wonderful, and the place to be, if you are too tired to leave out to the city. We had contacted the hotel in advance by e-mail and hoped for a high floor and a view to the city skyline, but weren't prepared for the fantastic room we got. Although it was just a classic guest room, it was HUGE - not to mention the beautiful view. One of the room walls was almost all window, and we could see everything all the way to Fullerton. From the smaller window on the adjacent wall we could see the Singapore Flyer. The bathroom was just as great as the room itself. There was a bath, a separate shower and comprehensive toiletries. The complimentary turndown service was a nice touch, since after a long day strolling around the city, the room is ready for going to bed. Locationwise Conrad copes a bit twofold. The enormous Suntec City Mall is right next to it, as are many other huge shopping centres. Also many of the city's great attractions are just a short walk away. On the other hand the walk to the MRT is longish, but luckily you get to walk most of the lenght indoors - come rainshower, you will want to get away from the streets, especially if you didn't remember to take umbrellas from your room with you. Considering the transport to the airport, the route to MRT is definitely too long to walk with luggage. In spite of that Conrad is a highly recommended option for your stay in Singapore, if you appreciate luxurious accommodation and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - luxury bed”
Reviews.Author: triss84
Reviews.Content: Service provided in this hotel was excellent, there were staff around the lobby just to help guests that might need help with directions or any queries. We booked the Business King room during the January sale so it was a great value at SGD180/night with breakfast included in the Pool Terrace. The room itself was spacious, loved the high big luxury bed. The bathroom is to die for, loved the big bathtub with yellow little duck! Bathroom is huge with big mirrors on the wall and behind the door. Concierge was very helpful and porters helping us with the luggage. Taxi rank just right outside the hotel door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, thoughtful service in a handy location.”
Reviews.Author: spikeozangel
Reviews.Content: Twin room facing the Fountain of Wealth (Money?) that was comfortable and scrupulously clean. We booked the half-price weekend deal that included upgrade to business rooms which included $20 free laundry service and breakfast buffet served in smaller restaurant looking out over the pool. Very pleasant, good buffet and the staff are outstanding. From our midnight arrival to being served breakfast or needing to have some letter posted the staff at this hotel could not be better, They were cheerful, intelligent and always so helpful, possibly the best hotel staff I have ever come across. Good location for most attractions in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a BORING city!”
Reviews.Author: Sport_guy_23
Reviews.Content: I can say only good things about this hotel as it is already known for be one of the best in the city. only problem I had was position of television - I still do not get it who designed those rooms?!? We loved the duck in the bathtub and it is now here with us having a nice new home. lol Singapore is so boring that I would never recommend the city, but if you go you should stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AndyXSteveUK
Reviews.Content: Just had 3 nights at the Conrad Singapore and what a nice stay! Firstly we we're upgraded to the Executive floor which meant a special check-in desk, breakfast in the executive lounge, Free afternoon tea and sandwiches and free cocktails! very nice The room itself was on the 26th floor and was a nice size with a big comfy king size bed. A choice is 15 pillows from the pillow menu, fresh fruit everyday (complimentary) with cheese and biscuits waiting with nice classical music playing as we entered the room. The bathroom was large with a seperate bath and shower with all you could ever need in the way of toiletries including a rubber duck! We spent sometime in the pool area and this was very nice with plenty of loungers, attentive staff to bring towels and iced water (free) or beer/cocktails/food if you desired. The location was great, walking distance to lots of shops and restaurants. The only disappointment was pretty expensive internet access, it's almost a crime what hotels charge for something that really should be free, a huge money spinner for them we suspect.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pravasi_bayarea
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights here with a 2 year old. The room was very spacious and well decorated. The view of the city from the room was amazing. Oversized bathrooms as well. The hotel is right across the street from the Suntec City Center and mall, and walking distance to the busstops for the city tourbuses. All in all, a wonderful hotel and for the price, incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Travels09-10
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10pm and were checked in and then as we had never been to the hotel before the guy at reception showed us to our room on the 15th floor. The room was beautiful and the bathroom very spacious. I got a fantastic deal on the hotel with 50% off the standard price but would be happy to return and pay the full rate. The only thing they need to do is extend the free wi-fi to the rooms and not just the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Yet Another Singaporean Gem”
Reviews.Author: Faithful_Suitcase
Reviews.Content: We went to Singapore for a “shopping” weekend. We did consider the St. Regis, but since my wife is pregnant I wanted to limit the walking to shopping where possible. Since I’ve stayed at Orchard Road a few times, I wanted to try out a new spot. Based on reviews and location, we chose the Conrad. BOOKING: I booked online through the Hilton Honors site also requested a car at the airport to pick us up. A reply from the hotel confirming the hotel transfer and rate was received within an hour of booking online. CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT: As a Hilton gold member, we were upgraded to the executive floor. When we arrived they took us and our luggage straight to our room and filled in all the particulars there. Check-out was done at the desk on the executive floor and was very quick. LOCATION: The Conrad is located right in the heart of Suntec City overlooking the fountain of wealth. Access to Suntec City Mall, Marina Square & Millenia Walk in right at your doorstep, so to speak. Further afield you can walk all the way to Raffles city via Marina square & the underground Raffles link. It’s roughly a 20 minute drive to the airport and a 15 minute drive to Orchard road. COMMON AREAS: The hotel has a very “grand” feel to it. The Christmas tree made of little teddy bears was certainly impressive. As for other amenities, we hardly spent much time in the hotel to check them out. FOOD: Our first morning we had breakfast on the executive floor; the food and selection was decent and the service was impeccable. However it has a very pretentious feel to it and feels like eating in a library. For people who want a peaceful undisturbed breakfast, I would recommend it. The other mornings we decided to eat breakfast at the main restaurant as we’re a bit livelier. The selection in the main restaurant is incredible. I’ve seen plenty of places that have a waffle station in their buffet, but the Conrad is the first to have around 8 flavours of ice cream to go with them! Outside of breakfast we never ate at the hotel so can’t comment on the other restaurants. ROOMS: The room we had was very nice and had a cozy yet modern feel to it. The bed was very tall & extremely comfy. We had a very nice view of the fountain of wealth. They had Acca Kappa toiletries in the bathroom for people who care about those things, (i.e. my wife). It may sound silly but I was also impressed by how many hangers they had in the wardrobe. It wasn’t the standard 4 or 5 hangers but a whole wardrobe full. Something that wouldn’t be lost on a business traveler. SERVICE: Service was great. Everyone we dealt with was an above average employee. Especially of note was the driver who picked us from the airport, and the concierge/valets at the front door. Whenever we asked a specific question, they always added their own opinions/recommendations which turned out to be great. Also, whenever we requested a taxi they were very thorough in making sure the cab driver knew where we wanted to go exactly. VALUE: We actually got a reasonable weekend deal through their website and for the quality of stay I certainly would have paid much much more. OVERALL: This is a great place and I don’t think you could go wrong by staying here. It definitely competes with the Shang in terms of service, and will be a place we consider when we make our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel with impeccable service!”
Reviews.Author: NB70
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just got back from our two-night stay at the Conrad Centennial Singapore. This is our first time staying at a Conrad hotel and we greatly enjoyed it. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful and grand. We stayed in an executive room on the club floor (31) and found both the room and service to be impeccable. One gentleman, Winston, who checked us in and whom we saw a number of times during our stay, in addition to being extremely professional seemed to go out of his way to make us feel welcome. He was also very helpful in booking a massage with their spa (very much enjoyed) and in organizing a late check-out. The location of the hotel is fantastic as well. It is just across from the Suntec Mall which is the starting point for the Hop-on-Hop-off bus tours (City, Heritage and Duckboat tours).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: mup
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad (Business Room) for 4 nights arriving very early hours of the 23rd Dec. My Daughter, Teenage Grand daughter and myself shared a twin bed room with a roll out bed. Plenty of room for all three of us and a really good size bathroom easily accomodating 3 females :-) Check in was smooth, efficient and easy. Perhaps that was due to our arrival time as we had pre-paid to have the room from the 22nd as we knew it would be an early hours arrival. As mentioned in other posts, beds are extremely comfortable, even the roll out one! Lovely touches with fruit basket, chocolates etc and even a small christmas cake on christmas day. Breakfast choices were excellent. Couple of minutes walk to Suntec and it was pleasant to amble through the underground malls to catch MRT at City Hall and even walked to Raffles in no time at all. We found all staff to be most helpful and pleasant. (Unlike the taxi driver from the airport to the hotel) Unusual for Singapore. Would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great End to 2009 & Great Start to 2010”
Reviews.Author: FaddySue
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Conrad for 4 nights starting on 31st December and checked out on 4th January. We found Conrad to be the BEST hotel we've stayed in Singapore!! Room had nice homely colour tones. The bed was HUGE and comfortable we wanted to stay in bed all day; we ended up leaving the room late afternoon the 5 days we were there. We liked the little touches like little Conrad teddy, rubber ducky in bath & fruits on arrival, the hotel umbrella in the closet, towel robes for the bathroom and cotton robes for day use, amenities/toiletries were Acca Kappa & superb and soothing music always welcomed us back into the room when we returned in the evening (room has DVD/CD player). We were most impressed with the service of their staff. Check-in staff were most helpful and checked us in efficiently. We were given twin bed but our request for king bed was taken care on the second day without any hassle. We also liked the little touches of the house keeping staff that laid out our bedroom slippers at the foot of the bed every evening and set mineral bottles & drinking glass on our side table. Location wise, the hotel was in walking distance to Suntec City Mall, Marina Square and City Link Mall. It was also close to MRT station. In short, this hotel had everything. It was a most memorable stay. We're already making plans to return. Thanks Conrad!! See you soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: researchinghoneymoon
Reviews.Content: I am a very very difficult person to please. We usually stay at 5*, sometimes 4* properties. I am highly criical if things are not the way they should be. I am happy with this property and have nothing to whinge about!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, with a few negatives”
Reviews.Author: LarryUpStateNY
Reviews.Content: Overall, a very good and comfortable hotel. The bed was great, amenities were nice and I particularly enjoyed being able to plug my computer into the entertainment center and work on the large 46 inch LCD TV. On the negative side: expensive and slow internet connection (>$25, although I got a discounted $20 rate through my company), a room safe that is too small for laptops, Oscar restaurant serving large buffets but quality of food is average, Chinese restaurant on 3rd floor didn't have great service. Also, swimming pool is quite small and the setting is not particularly attractive. A few perks come with the business rooms, such as free breakfast and free laundry for a couple of items each day (up to ~$17 per day, which is about one shirt, one pant or 3 pairs of socks)

Reviews.Title: “Hugh soft bed.... I like it.”
Reviews.Author: globetravelerNL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in one week time. choose for promotion business upgrade. Stayed in room 1812. The Bed is Huge/high/soft/big.....I like it. The bathroom comes with separated shower cabine. the only thing that lacked the accesoires were shaving-kit and hairbrush. Breakfast was big assortiment and nothing missing from my preferred needs. What to tell more.... I like this hotel and would go here next time again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent 5-star hotel,bathroom needs upgrading”
Reviews.Author: BENLEE123
Reviews.Content: I had a one night transit stay in Singapore and wanted to stay somewhere closed to the airport. The Conrad’s location is ideal since it is directly next to the highway to the airport and is a mere 20 mins drive away. Arriving I arrived by taxi. Luggage collected by bell boy. Check-in was speedy. I only booked a standard room and was delighted to hear that I have been upgraded to a suite due to my Hilton Honors status. The check-in lady escorted me personally to my suite. The room The room I got was on the 8th floor directly overlooking the Suntec City water fountain. The hotel called it a Centennial suite which presumably is their one-bedroom suite. There’s a separate sitting area but no guest bathroom and no walk-in closet. In fact, it feels rather cramp, and not helped by the hotel’s choice of bulky furniture. The bedroom is just as cramp, with the large king size bed occupying most of the space. The bed is very comfortable with fine linens and there’s also a pillow menu. I wonder if the normal room might actually be better since I can do without the living room and all the extra furniture that takes up lots of space in the suite. The bathroom on the contrary was quite spacious with dual vanity sinks, a shower cubicle and a large bathtub. Unfortunately, the hotel was showing it’s age as per the rather old bathroom fittings. The shower cubicle in particular was annoying with only a small shower head and low water pressure. And a pet peeve of mine, no shower stick! The toiletries are Acca Kappa, quite nice. Also, the bathroom had mold and some wear and tear, though not obviously unsightly. There is a large 46” LCD TV in the living room and a sound system (Sony). Unfortunately, the TV isn’t positioned correctly, so you have to watch it by “lifting your head up”. The is a smaller TV tucked away in the bedroom. Internet connection is not free, S$30 a day. Strangely, there is no wireless internet in the hotel. The Conrad offers very generous welcome amenity for the price paid, including a full basket of fresh fruits ( 6 varieties ) and a box of fine chocolates. There’s also a free Conrad toy bear. The suite is a corner room and the hotel appears to have good sound insulation. I have no problems with noise whatsoever except for the slight traffic noise from the streets. Common Areas In contrast to the room, the common areas are sweeping, spacious and grand conveying good sense of luxury. A eye-catching chandelier anchors the main lobby. The buffet restaurant Oscars appears to be quite popular. Food quality is quite good, though not really outstanding. The gym is next to the pool and has modern gym equipment. The pool doesn’t look very big. The hotel is right next to the Millenia Walk shopping mall and also walking distance to the Suntec city that have more shopping malls and eating outlets. Service Service is quite good and all staff are very polite and helpful. I can’t comment more since I have a very short stay at the hotel ( checked late afternoon and left early morning ) so didn’t really make use of more of their service. Conclusion Overall, this is a nice mid-range 5-star hotel. What I really do not like is the bathroom. It’s in need of a full scale renovation. I’m not sure if other rooms have better bathroom but if a suite bathroom is as such, can’t expect more from the standard rooms. The Conrad is not top-notch luxury and is also priced accordingly. If you are not fussy with bathroom, this is quite a nice hotel to stay in and certainly good value and very decent. I award it a 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: Ozziepore
Reviews.Content: I know you can sometimes get the Conrad on certain 'quote your own price' websites, and sometimes not. This time we got it at an excellent price and we stayed two nights. We were so impressed that we booked it again in a few weeks. I travel extensively in Asia for work purposes, and stay in good 4-5* hotels, and the Conrad is up there with the best of them. My partner and I like to have twin beds so when I travel with him it can be hassle if rooms are tiny and the twin beds are crammed together like a King Size anyway. But the rooms of the Conrad are very large and the beds very comfortable. The teddy and the duckie are a cute touch. The pool is good for a business class hotel (not many resort style pools in Singapore). The bathroom could be any five star hotel - marble, big bath, big shower, nice Acca Kappa amenities. The room had a good iron and ironing board, which - being a big fan of linen - I always appreciate. As others have said, there is no wireless internet in the rooms and broadband access is expensive - if i had been there for work that would really make me mad. That would be the only gripe I had . Oh, and if you don't want to pay the hotel's prices for breakfast there is an excellent food court next to Carrefour supermarket, just a stone's throw over the road.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: nondenom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located RIGHT next to suntec city, which is where most of the banks (and my office) are located. the service, food, and overall experience of the hotel are great. They could really do with a better gym though.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: NathaliaAPH
Reviews.Content: This Hotel have a good room, the room is wide & the bed is wide, especially the bath room is very excellent, elegant & they prepares ginger soap, so it's very refreshing to take a bath in the bath tub. My children is very happy with the Conrad's doll & the ducks they give in the bath room. They're collecting the Conrad's bear dolls. It's opposite the Suntec city that have a very big shopping Mall, & the centre of the duck tour, you can get the adventure in Singapore by bus or boat with Duck Tours. It is also near the Esplanade if you want to see the performance. Near with the Clark Quay that you can get a good dinner. The breakfast is very good, my children still dreaming about their "Scramble egg" , hihihi... And the view from the room is good.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in the World”
Reviews.Author: IMFLYBOY
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hilton property 3 times and it consistently exceeds my most lofty expectations. As a Hilton Honors Diamond Level patron, I am generally treated to an executive room at this wonderful hotel. In typical Southeast Asia style, the staff cannot do enough to make sure that all my needs are anticipated. The rooms are plush and comfortable with million dollar (US) views of the Marina, the Singapore Flyer and the waterfront. It is in easy walking distance of Raffels, the Marina and lots of great shopping and restaurants nearby. If you once in your life should want to treat yourself to luxury, I would highly recommend the Conrad Centennial in Singpore.

Reviews.Title: “GORGEOUS! A+ HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: msmegmog
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in a twin room whilst in transit on my way to Vietnam with my brother. This is a super luxurious hotel. Massive marble bathroom with seperate bath, wonderful views, comfy beds and incredibly helpful and attentive staff. Our bags were immediately taken from us when we arrived in a taxi and were delivered to the room, plus the lady who checked us in escorted us up to the room. Loved the teddy bear christmas tree in the lobby, loved the location which had loads of bars and restaurants and was a quick walk to Raffles. I got a bargain price for this room on Priceline - I hope I am lucky again enough to stay here in the future. One tip though - the bottle of water in the bathroom is complimentary, but the ones in the minibar are not. I was desperately thirsty and drank a small bottle and was charged SIN$10!

Reviews.Title: “One night only but would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: rippermail
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at 10 hotels in Singapore, and I would rate our (brief) stay here as one of the best. Staff were friendly and more than happy to assist at check-in (the welcome drink was an unexpected, but lovely touch), room was clean and had nice views of the cityscape, and the bed was very comfortable. We were only here for one night, in transit home from our holiday, however I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW !”
Reviews.Author: mehrdadnb
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel ,great service , great staff , graet location ....what else are u looking for ?!it was my first experience of CONRAD and I should add that it was one of the best hotel I've ever been so far. thanx to the people at conrad. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: drtravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on a priceline stay of < $100usd per night so the price was very good. Had a spacious room that overlooked the SunTec fortune fountain that was lit at night. Room had all the regular Conrad ammenities. Good pool for hot afternoon breaks. Staff were exceedingly helpful. Location was a bit difficult getting aound all the buildings but there is underground walkway to the subway. Lots of shopping close by. I'd definitely be happy staying there again at the rate I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: ronlogan
Reviews.Content: I was in a pinch and found a vacany at the Conrad at the last moment. What good fotune!'Terrific staff, Great - as yo wudl expect rooms, terrific in every sense. Given my hectic business week - this was sucha a great pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Leave”
Reviews.Author: MrJonathan
Reviews.Content: Bravo to all of the staff at this fabulous hotel. Our 10-day business trip was made all the more productive by staying on the executive floor at this wonderful establishment. Incredible value for our travel dollars. Service is tip-top and the food: breakfast, tea and cocktail hour is plentiful and very-well prepared. Room service was exceptional and very affordable. Looking forward to returning to Singapore and staying again at the Conrad. A special thank you to the concierge staff and the wonderful massages my colleague and I got at the spa. Be sure to try the buffet breakfast at Oscars Restaurant downstairs. Great people. Was very hard to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Starting to get a litle old”
Reviews.Author: maptraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very good overall, but starting to show its age. The bathroom fixtures are starting to look a little dated, as are the 12"x12" marble floor tiles. However, the worst thing is that many of the marble tiles were broken, and there was a bit of mold in some of the grout. All the marble floor tiles had a slight wax feeling to them. Room has a large 40+" Sony LCD TV, which is newish looking and high quality. Desk is equipped with some simple office supplies, but no sticky tape. Room is furnished with 2 chairs as well as an arm chair. Outdoor pool is pretty spacious. Buffet restaurant is decent. Adjacent to the hotel building are several restaurants as well as Starbucks and Coffee Bean. There are also a couple of shopping malls right near by including the Suntec Center mall, and Millennia complex. The Esplanade complex is a short walk away, and there is a small hawker center there as well.

Reviews.Title: “High end, luxurious hotel and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Epiphany3
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone traveling to Singapore. I stayed at the Conrad for 3 nights on a business trip as I got a great rate for the hotel at Priceline. The standard room I got was very spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable. They provided free bottled water and a fruit selection both of which were replenished daily. The bathroom was large. I don't normally soak in tubs, I'm a shower man, but I couldn't resist trying their tub out. They even include a rubber duck! There is no free wi-fi in the rooms, but if you go to the lobby, you can use the free wi-fi if you don't feel like paying extra for internet in your room. Complimentary shoe shines are offered. Their gym had a good selection of equipment and was also stocked with free fruit dispensers in addition to the water fountains. The pool looked welcoming as well, although I did not get to try it out. I didn't eat at any of the hotel restaurants as there are just so many choices next to the hotel. Suntec City Mall is a very short walk away from the Conrad offers a myriad of restaurants to choose from. If you enjoy shopping, you'll love Suntec City and Singapore in general as the give new meaning to the word to megamall. There's also a food court a short walk from the Conrad as well. The nearest MRT station is City Hall station. To enter it, you'll need to go to the underground entrance which is behind the convention center, about a 3-4 minute walk from the Conrad. Then follow the signs and navigate through the underground mall to go to the MRT station. With the hot, humid Singapore weather, you'll appreciate the less time you have to spend outside so navigating through underground structures like this will be welcomed.Taxi are very affordable in Singapore as well and tipping is not required. In summary, for the price I paid, this is by far the most I have ever received for my money. I highly recommend staying at the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel... would stay again”
Reviews.Author: piligar
Reviews.Content: We stopped over on the way to and from Phuket and stopped at the Conrad on the way for a couple of nights. We got a great price by shopping around online ... my favourite is www.hotelscombined.com. We arrived after midnight and check out was really quick and friendly. The area - Suntec City - has a business focus so if it's Orchard Road shopping you want, then the other end of town would be better. There is a big mall in Suntec, just across the road and you can jump on board the Hippo Bus there too. A ticket for the day will take you around town on a pretty gawdy double decker bus so you can orient yourself. Hop on / Hop off at all the key spots like Chinatown, Little India . Try the food court in Suntec. There are some fantastic stalls ...love the dumplings. We couldn't fault the hotel except for the breakfast. We were on a business floor and had breakfast in the pool side restaurant. Could have been better. Eveything else was great especially the little touches like choclates and fruit every day! Happy to recommend the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: RandaVancouverWa
Reviews.Content: We were hired to do four days' work in Singapore, and extended the trip to accommodate jet lag and sightseeing. The Conrad (Hilton) Hotel was fantastic, and staying on the executive floors provides you with a lovely breakfast buffet, tea in the afternoon, then an ample cocktail hour spread as well complete with international selections such as sushi. The room was very comfortable and the service outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault”
Reviews.Author: Simon_Koala
Reviews.Content: Lovely, classy yet subtle hotel. Very modern, not an old hotel which has been refurbished like a lot of others in Singapore. Great location (next to the convention centre, and very close to the Singapore Flyer), and importantly its away from the noisy bars and jaded and well worn tourist area of Clark Quay (but still close enough to be only a short $5 taxi ride away if you do want to go there, which I would recommend doing at least once if you haven't seen Clark Quay before). From the concierge staff to the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff to the restaurant staff to the business lounge staff, I just cannot fault. The concierge staff were so very attentive and helpful in arranging day tours. The front desk staff upon checkin, personally escorted us to our room and explained everything we wanted to know along the way. It was lovely to relax by the not crowded and large swimming pool in the Singaporean afternoon heat, and be able to order meals and drinks from the poolside bar and have these served to you whilst lounging by the pool. So very relaxing ....... We travelled as a family of two adults and two children, and whilst I get the impression that this hotel is not the first choice for families (probably due to its price), the hotel was still very accommodating for the children. The only complaint I would make (if I had to make one) would be the speed of service in the lobby restaurant (Oscar's) during even the non busy times. Whilst the food was lovely, it was just too slow. For instance, we were booked in to do an evening tour and had one hour to have dinner prior to going out on the tour. We sat down and ordered. Forty minutes into the hour, the food had still not arrived (and this as before the dinner rush had even begun). After some reminders to the wait staff, the food did arrive with fifteen minutes to spare. So we quickly ate the food, so what was to have been a leisurely and relaxing dinner, turned into a worrying half hour or so as to why the food hadn't arrived yet, followed by a quickly eaten dinner in about 10-15 minutes, which was somewhat annoying (and which with young kids is often difficult to have them eat so quickly). But as everything else about the hotel was just so good, this one thing didn't sour our opinion of the property even in the slightest. If we ever visit Singapore again, this will be the only place I will stay. Conrad Hilton would indeed be proud !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Great staff, room and location.”
Reviews.Author: dasho
Reviews.Content: Best hotel we have ever stayed in, and we've travelled extensively. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The location was excellent and the king executive room and facilities outstanding. We arrived early after a night on a plane from Italy and they cheerfully allowed us to check in early, and advised us that we were welcome to breakfast too. They then allowed us to check out 6 hours late when we left, as the room was available. This helped us enormously given our awkward flight times.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience at Conrad Centennial”
Reviews.Author: jillian646
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Conrad Centennial was the highlight of our trip to Singapore. I debated between a handful of other hotels, but after finding a great deal on Expedia for 2 nights in an Executive Room, we decided to go w/ the Conrad. We bypassed the long line at reception and were taken immediately up to the "executive check-in" on the upper floors of the hotel. After checking in, we were invited for complimentary drinks and appetizers in the executive lounge. There is free wifi in this area, so each evening we would enjoy a glass of wine while catching up on emails/work. We happened to be in Singapore for their independence day.. so we enjoyed spectacular views of the fireworks from our room. The hotel room amenities were fabulous.. my boyfriend enjoyed the large TV/entertainment center while I enjoyed the large bathtub with top of the line hair products. The staff was extremely helpful as well. They helped us organize the hop on/off City bus tour & had countless restaurant recommendations. Be sure to have a Singapore Sling at Long Bar (Raffles Hotel) and have chili crab when visiting Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “from far, the best hotel to stay in Singapore...”
Reviews.Author: ccrr77fr
Reviews.Content: After a few weeks of holidays in Bali, we wanted to do a stop in Singapore and find an hotel relaxing and providing the highest standards of service. We booked for an Executive Room at Conrad Centennial and we have been more than happy about this excellent choice for such an incredible value for money... First of all, this Conrad is a true five stars property offering to the guests the highest standard of service. It's similar of what you can find in any Peninsula or Ritz Carlton but for a more attactive price. Our amazing room was ultra comfy located at the 28th floor with great views of the Singapore skyline. The room was typically "Conrad" similar to the one i've had in Bangkok or Hong Kong with the very best bed i've never had in any other hotel. I was almost ready to buy the incredible pillows and i've never had such a good sleep. It means apart of the ultra luxury comfort, the soundproofing is just perfect, the blackout simply great and the cleanliness absolutely exceptionnal. About the decoration, Conrad Centennial is luxuriously classic with some nice details which remember you the location of the hotel and a very relaxing scheme of soft colours. And nothing to tell about the equipment cause you'll find in your room everything you need. The bathroom is really bright with separate shower and bathtub and a selection of luxurious amenities smelling so good... Once again, the cleanliness is everywhere and it's a real pleasure to spend time in your marble bathroom. The Executive room comes with a lot of benefits at the Club Executive floor lounge. You'll find a dedicated staff sooo perfect, elegant, smily and helpful always ready to make of your experience in this hotel a memorable one. Apart of a personnalized check in and check out, you'll have a yummy complimentary breakfast in the peaceful atmosphere of the lounge; an afternoon tea with an extended choice of delicious sandwiches and cakes; the popular "Evening cocktails and canapés" with free flow of champagne if you're a fan and different dishes all delicious. Actually, it's more a little dinner than a cocktail time and it's until 8pm which is very convenient. Moreover, at any time you want, you'll be always welcome for a complimentary soft drink or tea/coffee and there is free wifi in the lounge as well... It's a little bit more expensive than a Classic room but it's more than worth it. With a large Fitness center, a refreshing pool and a location just perfect for shopping, this hotel is undoubtly the best choice in Singapore, a wonderful cocoon of luxury, "art de vivre" and exceptionnal service i'll always choose for all my upcoming trips in the Orchid city...

Reviews.Title: “Total opulence.......”
Reviews.Author: Paddeng
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days for the Inaugral 2008 Formula 1 race before moving on to a hotel nearby. This hotel is just sheer opulence and efficiency. I was upgraded to a high floor executive room with floor to ceiling windows overlokking downtown Singapore. Amazing when you consider that F1 was in town (Ron Dennis and Lewis Hamilton were staying here) and I paid for the rooms using Hilton points... Quality, professional staff and FANTASTIC attentive service. Totally recommended

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: celi36
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad as the first of three hotels. Took advanatge of the Hilton's two for one deal and thus upgraded to an executive room at no more cost than a standard room. The room was a good size, massive LCD TV, large bathroom with seperate shower and bath, nice view of the fountain of wealth, spotlessly clean, all very comfortable. Lobby and public areas all nicely done with pleasent ambience, would especially commend the concierge and staff in the lobby - very helpful indeed - always there to greet you and be of assistance. I also enjoyed the pool area - the pool is all one depth which I prefer for swimming, never seemed crowded. Nice view of the flyer. Club level view is OK, but inevitably mostly lots of other hotels. Food was varied each evening and always good quality. You also have the option to take breakfast in Oscars which I recommend for a wide choice and not overally busy if you go early. Choice of drinks was OK, white, red and sparkling durling the day and beer in a basket at happy hour. Lounge service varied between excellent - taking time out to explain the different ingredients of each dish - and ignored. Sat for 30 minutes one evening without being asked if I wanted anything. Also, one time the lounge was too full and I was asked to sit in a conference room where two businessmen were having a meeting - awkward for all of us I think. Finally, location is good, near the esplanade and the flyer, and a huge carrefour across the road for any bits and pieces, but is a bit of a walk to the MRT after a long day until they open the new station right nearby. Would definately stay there again - especially if could get a good deal. But perhaps not at the Club Level.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable & great location”
Reviews.Author: JulzJ
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and i really think this hotel just breathes 5 star. The service was outstanding, communal area and rooms impeccable and location was fantastic. We stayed on the club floor and enjoyed the free champange and food with views over the marina, and chatted to the very friendly staff. Breakfast was something else too. I stupidly left my passport in the toilets in the airport and the staff were fantastic in locating it for me with the staff at the airport. I can't rate this hotel enough for someone wanting a hotel in a good area, walking distance to the marina and its bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Better the average Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian&Alan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and got a really good deal by pre-booking well in advance. We stayed in a King Executive room with the executive lounge access. The room was a good size, but somewhat bland for my taste. Lots of beech wood furniture and not a huge amount of character. I guess this is typical of any business 4* hotel. The executive lounge was small, and with not a huge choice to eat at cocktail hour. The lounge was busy and the service was poor. We had trouble finding a table to sit at, and it wasn't a very relaxing experience. The location was ok. Behind both The Pan Pacific & The Mandarin Oriental, which are far superior in my opinion. To sum up, The Conrad was fine for a one night stay. Would we stay here again, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, very nice...”
Reviews.Author: Popcornlovers
Reviews.Content: We been staying at the Conrad for 2 nights on route to Sydney. We did stay at the club level on 33rd floor with our 14month old daughter. It was just lovely, and I think our daughter would have been getting away with anything, she had a blast. 2 small things I like to point out are: 1) Larger plates for the breakfast, I just hate to get up every 3minutes to get something. 2) the bathroom is very nice; but I recommend a manager to have a seat on the toilet for a few minutes. There are some small things popping to your eyes which could or needed to be fixed before it really looks bad. Otherwise you will not see it looking from the top, also if you get a chance assign a taller person when cleaning the shelf’s in the clothes cabin, smile sorry but with 190cm I do see some stuff in the upper corners… Otherwise, we like to thank the people at the Conrad to make this stay for us such a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay or recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cranbe
Reviews.Content: Cannot remember exactly when I stayed, but should be around that period... 4/5 Star hotel at 3 stars service maybe. We booked 3 rooms at this hotel for a weekend stay but was really disappointed. There is cockcroach in the bathroom, the pool was under renovation without letting us know when we booked it, we got so many kids who were so disappointed. We wrote feedback to them but never get any response at all!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Chesty1
Reviews.Content: We stayed this month for 3 nights in an Executive Room and like a lot of people, got the 2 for 1 rates that were on offer. I must say that I have stayed at many 5 star hotels and this one has really set the bar very high. Firstly the hotel oozes class. As soon as you enter the lobby it has real distinction about it. Our flight arrived around 0530am and I had advised the hotel ahead of time if I could receive an early check in and was fortunate enough to be get early check in. The rooms are quite spacious and come with every amenity you could hope for. The rubber duck and teddy bear is a nice touch. Also liked the size of the bathroom and the double vanity The Executive Lounge on the 31st floor is fantastic. All day drinks and various food dishes are served through out the day. Afternoon tea and cocktail hours are real highlights. They also serve breakfast but its limited for choice and would recommend Oscars in the lobby for this. The view from the lounge is also quite fantastic. The breakfast buffet was probably the best I have ever had. Not only was the variety excellent but the quality was really top notch. Saving the best for last, the service in this hotel is something to behold. Every one is so friendly and will go out of their way to help you. I could go on but if you are after a great 5 star hotel in a good location, look no further than the Conrad!.

Reviews.Title: “The best in town”
Reviews.Author: italyItalia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely amazing, it's perfect on every aspect from the rooms to the service. I've benn in mny hotels in Singapore but this is simly the bestin town. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: carolinehigh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely clean (and I am super fussy) and elegant. The breakfast is the best I have ever had in any hotel. The only downside is the water in the swimming pool is sooo cold, the hotel blocks the sun to the pool for most of the day. I would not hesitate to recommend this classy hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: thebeast1126
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after reading the reviews and got a half price deal on Expedia. Booked the room thru expedia for $111 US a night which included breakfast buffet every morning for the two of us. Arrived half an hour before check in time of 2pm and was told not a problem to check in then. The only hick up the entire stay was they did not show me as having breakfast included on their reservation. Showed a copy of my expedia receipt and it was handled on the spot. I requested a non-smoking king size standard room, but they were booked for non-smoking. They offered a non-smoking two double bed room or a smoking king size room. I asked to see the smoking room/smoking floor. Could barely tell it was a smoking floor/room so opted for the king size room. The rooms are large, beds are comfortable and the shower/bath is great. No problems with water pressure at all. Housekeeping was great and always there when i needed something. Mention was made in other reviews that the TV was on the wall and to the side. This is true but it posed no problem for us. Breakfast buffet included at Oscar's every morning. It was great and really made the stay! we would sleep in and hit the buffet around 0945 and it was loaded with fruits, vegetables, cheeses, main dishe. Very good brunch! This saved us quite a bit as we would eat here before going out and then getting a snack to tide us over to supper. Pool area was nice. The only thing we would say is that you should take a taxi if going to the MRT. Other reviews mention it being a 10 min walk. It was closer to 15. It is a bit confusing and requires you to walk thru a maze of malls and underground shopping venues to find. We stayed 5 days here by the second day of walking everywhere we were tired. Taxis are cheap and readily available at the hotel entrance. Taxi to the airport from the hotel is less than 15$ Sing and less tham $30 Sing after midnight due to a 50% surcharge after 12am. Great hotel and service. Would defintiely stay here again, but we would also look more towards the clarke quay area first.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: fabholslover
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a short stopover on way back home to uk from Bali. Brilliant service from start to finish. Reservations initially wanted to charge more for our 2 executive rooms as the rate changed during the time it took for me to confirm the booking by email but immediately changed the rate and apologised for the 'error' when I complained.
