They continued to provide excellent service once we were there: :can we have a late check out as our plane doesn't leave until midnight? Of course, keep the room until 6pm and then use the executive lounge for as long as you like :can we book a 'larger' taxi for 4 plus luggage at a cheaper rate than the hotel transport? Of course, we will also advance some currency against your room expenses so that you can pay the driver (worked out a lot cheaper than changing a travellers cheque). We really enjoyed our stay and the attentiveness of the staff made us relax right up to the end of our holiday - it was lovely to be able to shower in comfort after a long day of sightseeing & shopping then to relax in the exec lounge with a glass (or two) of champagne and some very substantial snacks until it was time to make our way to the airport - very civilised! I have to say that the exec lounge is fabulous. The standard of food/drinks is excellent, the views are superb and the staff are some of the best I have come across. The rooms were lovely too (although I have to agree with the previous reviewer who mentions the poor shower - but I'm nitpicking here) - all in all a fabulous stay and very reasonably priced for Singapore. Stay here & choose the exec package & enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: JSVP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Conrad for 2 nights in August and loved it. This is a luxury hotel as expected and must surely be best value in Singapore on a 2 for 1 offer. Room was beautifully presented and very spacious with a very very large bathroom and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. We had views overlooking the Fountain of Wealth which was very pretty at night. My only gripe was that the shower was not very powerful Breakfast offered a variety of options both Western and Asian including a waffle station which we loved. Staff were efficient and helpful at all times. All in all, what you would expect from a top-end 5-star brand

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms in the business”
Reviews.Author: suitdude30
Reviews.Content: Just checked out after 9 blissful nights at the Conrad Centennial Singapore. After having stayed at the Grand Hyatt, Mandarin Oriental, Meritus Mandarin and the Swissotel on numerous occasions, I have found my ideal hotel in Singapore. This is mainly to do with its spacious rooms, which, even in the "Classic" (i.e. standard) category, are so comfortable, decorated in very restful earthy tones/colours, and boasting the most comfortable beds anywhere, covered in the smoothest and silkiest bed linen, such that I looked forward to going to bed every night. A 42" Sony Bravia LCD TV and DVD player provide ample entertainment. Some glitches, which I brought to the hotel's management via the questionnaire: 1. Inconsistent Housekeeping: envelopes not replenished daily, even after I called on 2 consecutive days to remind the Housekeeping department; on some days, the decorative bolster and throw were placed on the bed, but not on other days; only 1 bottle of water provided for a double room, necessitating calls to Housekeeping. 2. Check-out took more than half an hour, due to disputes over various charges, and the receptionist confessed that the system is very slow. In the end, all the disputed charges were rebated, but to take more than 30 minutes to check out is unacceptable. Fortunately, I was not running late for a flight! Lovely touches in the hotel include: - Scented candles in the lobby; - Well-equipped gymnasium, with freshly-squeezed orange and guava juices on tap; - Stereo tuned to classical music radio station by evening turn-down staff; - Spacious, well-lit marble bathrooms I stayed on a "2 for 1" promotion, which made for excellent value, as the Conrad is otherwise an expensive business hotel (I was on vacation). On the Business Floor (one category below the Executive Floor), the rate includes breakfast at the "Salon by the Pool", whose buffet, while not as extensive as that of Oscar's (the main restaurant); is more than adequate. The staff are obliging, to the extent of fetching grapefruit and Milo for me from Oscar's, as it was not part of the Salon buffet. Other Biz Flr benefits include a daily $20 laundry allowance, which I negotiated to be substituted for Internet access (very pricey at S$30 per day). Rooms face either Suntec City (4 large office towers surrounding what is billed as the world's largest fountain), or the more picturesque harbour. In spite of my extended stay, my repeated requests for a harbour-view room were in vain, on the grounds of high occupancy. The Conrad is situated above Millenia Walk, a mixed-use retail and office complex, which is linked to the Suntec City and Marina Square malls. The very fast, clean, cheap and convenient underground train system, the MRT (Mass Rapid Transit) is a 10-minute walk away, under the Marina Square complex. Inside Suntec City, there's a huge Carrefour supermarket, where one can stock up on provisions which would otherwise cost an arm, leg and even a spleen at the hotel. SIngapore's largest church, New Creation, operates 4 services every Sunday at its premises in Suntec City, which I happily attended. While the Conrad is clearly targeted at a corporate market, I felt very welcome and comfortable as a leisure traveller, and made full use of the pool and gym. All staff were uniformly helpful and friendly, and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, and I look forward to my next trip, later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: balmain_bug
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week in Singapore and the Conrad was a fantastic choice. We stayed in an executive room which offered great value with included breakfast, afternoon teas and evening cocktails. We didn't think that we would use the afternoon teas and cocktails that much but it was great to be able to walk down the corridor for a snack. The staff were uniformly excellent - we stayed with a 1 year old and everybody went out of their way to help out. The location is very good - the area outside is a little difficult to negotiate with a stroller/pram until you find the best route to the MRT (enter the Marina bay shopping centre which is right opposite Oscar's restaurant and then you can enter the Citylink mall). The room was large with a very large bathroom. I don't know if it was only for the executive package but there were a lot of additional services like a free pillow menu, very comprehensive toiletry bag for the baby etc. Breakfast at Oscar's was a treat - very large selection.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: kazz99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad recently and must say it was one of the best hotels I have had the pleasure of staying at. Having booked an exec room, the friendly and polite people took us up to the exec floor where we are checked in at separate counter. All our baggage was handled by the bell boys and were taken to our room while we finalised the check in. They offered us complimentary drinks (from the exec lounge) during this process. Location is great as it is close to Marina Square (a large shopping centre) and is within walking distance (although about a 10-15min walk) of the CBD. The city view is pretty good although it is somewhat blocked by Pan Pac (I would imagine they would have better views) but the views were still very nice. Exec room is definitely worth it. Access to the exec lounge was great as they provided complimentary drinks throughout the day and also offered afternoon tea (essentially some hot finger food as well as a variety of other things, eg. cheese platter, cakes, other sweets, etc.). Buffet breakfast at Oscar's was quite good, nothing particularly special except for the waffle bar (very tasty and the waffle guy was a really nice guy). Check-out was a breeze as it took all of about 30 seconds. Would return to Conrad again!

Reviews.Title: “As excellent as ever . . .”
Reviews.Author: TheBish
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here previously and had a great experience, so it was our first port of call when we returned to Singapore. I have to say that we were not disappointed and the hotel once again fully met our expectations for an excellent stay on every count. We had breakfast both mornings and it was an amazing buffet selection with a huge choice. We also had room service for dinner and that too was superb. The location is also fantastic next to the fountain of wealth and the massive Suntec shopping centre with its numerous shops and restaurants which is handy for a short stay. All the staff members were professional yet friendly and helpful. This is undoubtedly a 5 star hotel at the top of their game and I would certainly have no hesitation in returning again.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel - nearly all there.”
Reviews.Author: TravellinRooster
Reviews.Content: Oh, how I so wanted to be blown away by this hotel! Do we business travellers become blasé when we have to suffer through all these luxurious hotels or do we become really specific about what makes a hotel really good? Now don't get me wrong, the Conrad is a fantastic hotel with everything you could need, which is just as well really, because you would want everything you need for the price you will pay. The staff are all cordial in that uniquely Singaporean way, the rooms are more than adequate, the lifts go ding-dong when they are arriving all that good stuff, the downside is there are just some simple things they have still not worked out. Why is it so hard to find "Internet" in the guest services guide? Don't go looking for the listing for "Gymnasium" or "Fitness Centre" either – not there - Gym is under "Spa". Am I too picky? And why do I have to be a contortionist to reach the toilet paper whilst sitting on the loo? Is there a reason that it is easier to find the Guest Survey than the in-room menu? The rooms themselves are really quite spacious. The beds are very comfortable and the views are quite good from most floors. Air-conditioning is quiet, a blessing for the weary traveller. Bathrooms are above average, but they feel like they are dating and have that feeling of aging quite quickly. One really expects a hotel like the Conrad Centennial to be exceptional, and it is really is a great hotel. It is just not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but better options available for the price”
Reviews.Author: montgod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad at the tail end of our trip to Singapore. We were able to benefit from the promotional 50% off sale so I will try to gear my review as if there were no promotion and we were paying full price like we did at our previous stay at the Shangri-La Singapore. Both are 5 star hotels so they "should" be pretty equivalent. When we arrived, the hotel staff warmly greeted us. Very nice staff overall I must say. Check in was quick and no problems whatsoever. With our accomodations, we had the breakfast buffet included in our rate. We had the optoin to eat at the executive lounge or at Oscars. We decided to go to Oscars since they had more options than the lounge. Oscars had the usual spread of breads, international foods, omelette station, waffle station, and drink area. For a five star hotel though, I felt like the food was just average. The cereals and dried fruit had a stale taste, soy milk wasn't readily available, the omelette station had a hard time making well done scrambled eggs, breads didn't seem fresh as well as some of the other food options. The freshly made waffles were good with the ice cream option but the glazed pecans and almonds you could top them with were stale. The drink options were okay as well since they would make a fresh carrot juice or semi-fruit smoothie if asked. In terms of everything else, the napkins were hard as a rock. Don't expect to be able to use them without scratching your face off or your childs. Not sure why you would starch them so much that they are only good to look at on the table. Oscars staff was very nice and helpful, but even there professionalism and warmth wouldn't justify me paying around $42 SGD for this buffet. And that's the main point, the buffet is okay especially if it's free, but not if you have to pay that amount of money for it out of your pocket. I could be a bit biased though because I did just stay at the five star Shangri-la Singapore where both breakfast buffet options at the hotel were out of this world good with more options available and everything being fresh. Our executive room was nice. It had a nice layout that made the room seem larger than it was. We also had a great view. The beds were excellent and comfortable. The staff again was great in providing fresh fruits everyday and a turn-down service. A nice touch. Our bathroom was very nice. I would have to say that it was a lot better than the Shangri-La's bathroom. Had a nice layout and great toiletries. The flat screen tvs were huge and of a higher standard. I have never seen a flat screen like this in a hotel before. They also had dvds to check out or movies to order if you wanted to watch something. There wasn't an iron or ironing board available in the room. Not a big deal, but made you wonder since it is a five star hotel. Power outlets were very minimal in the room. Wife had a hard time finding a place to using her curling iron. The staff was nice enough to provide a converter for us though. Internet was available to use by either purchasing it for our room ($30SGD a night - expensive!!), going to the executive lounge (no shorts or comfortable attire allowed and closed at 11pm), or go to the first floor busy lobby and camp out there as long as you want. Not the best options in my opinion. Some other options to be noted at the Conrad: - Pool was a nice size. - Gymnasium was very nice. You definitely would be able to keep up your workout plan away from home w/the nice collection of free weights and machines. - Location was very central to everything. This can be a plus and a minus. When we were there, an event was going on where a man was making announcements over a loud speaker for a long period of time. It was a bit irriating and we were on the 28th floor. This was near the Fountain of Wealth so who knows what was going on. - The one staff negative is that the executive and front desk phone service were not great at all. I had tried to call them both numerous times during out trip and only was able to reach them once. Otherwise, I had to physically go downstairs for assistance. Not sure why they have these services available if I can never reach either of them. All in all a great deal for the promotional rate we received with 50% off. Otherwise, with everything being close to equivalent except the food and internet, I think we would have stayed at the Shangri-la Singapore instead.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Services!”
Reviews.Author: RedBayRuth
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the hotel, we were treated like gold. The fresh fruit each day was a nice touch and very much appreciated, especially arriving in the early morning hours. We had a room on the Executive Floor and use of the Executive Lounge. Everyone was attentive and very friendly. All staff greet you from the lobby to the Lounge. The breakfast was fabulous as well as high tea and cocktails. Room service was exceptional. Concierge staff were very helpful and accommodating. We enjoyed our stay at the Conrad and would go back in a second. The room was well appointed and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel overall in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: LisaJ99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of June 2009 before heading on to Bintan. The service we received was exceptional and the room we were allocated was fantastic with a huge marble bathroom. As it was a belated celebration of our birthdays and our wedding anniversary the hotel gave us a beautiful box of chocolates and a glass each of champagne to help us celebrate. The hotel was ideally located for the "hop on - hop off" Hippo tour bus which stopped just across the road at the Suntec City Mall. At the same Mall there is a huge choice of restaurants offering every sort of food from Turkish to Japanese at reasonable prices. This will definitely be our first choice of hotel next time we go to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “First Class!”
Reviews.Author: binyoulin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 2 nights after our wedding in Singapore. It's included in our wedding reception package and we are pleased that it's Conrad. Everything here is class. We are spoiled for choice with a Breakfast buffet. The room is impressive and the plush beds provides a good excuse to sleep in. It's amazing!

Reviews.Title: “We would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: vickyloubuckley
Reviews.Content: When we arrived past 4pm our room was not ready. We were told to wait for at least three hours. The fact that we presented our Platinum members card was of no significance, nor was the fact that we mentioned it was our anniversary trip. The check-in attendant was completely nonchalant about everything. We left our luggage and went for a bite then returned. Upon entering the rooms (we had two connecting) we were quite let down. Considering this is rated 5 star, we felt like we'd entered a 3. The phone in the toilet was off the wall, the wallpaper in there was peeling, and the grouting was stained. The decor in the room was completely nondescript and though there were suppossed to be fruits and chocolates in the room, none were there despite waiting until after 7pm to check in. Amenities were cheap quality. Water was also not provided, though it was suppossed to be. The 1st night we got no turn-down service at all. No ice was provided, either. I was hungry later and phoned for room service. I asked for a bucket of ice with my order. Not only did my order arrive 20 minutes late... half of the order was cold (old maybe?) and no ice came. The room service attendant told me that if I wanted ice I'd have to call housekeeping! I called room service and after another 20 minutes of waiting with no service I cancelled the order alltogether. THEN, after I'd gone to sleep, a room service waiter came to our room and rang our bell. I didn't answer... he rang another 4 times until I had to get up and send him away. The second night we arrived back to our rooms after a long day of sightseeing. I wanted a nice hot bath. Guess what? NO HOT WATER! I phoned for service and an engineer came up. He ran the water for about 30 minutes while my husband and I waited in the room and then said it was hot. He left. It WAS hot for about 3 minutes. Then cold again. I had to call again. After 45 minutes he came back. By this time it was past 11pm and all I wanted to do was wash and sleep. The duty manager was informed and came up... I was completely upset by this time. I asked to be moved and all he could do is tell me "this is 'unfortunate'." He did offer to let me use the bath in another room and return to my room when finished... Yes, great compromise for a 5 star hotel. The pool area is adequate, yet there is no jacuzzi or anything else to really recommend it. The arrendants were very helpful, though, bringing fruits and towels. All in all, by about 25 minutes after attempting to check in, we were disillusioned with this place and things only got worse. However, we got this on the "u bid it" type site and paid less than a third of the going rate. If you're willing to risk less than great accommodations and service, I'd recommend using that service and maybe you'll get your money's worth. If I had it to do over, I'd pay a lot more and opt for any other place, though. Some bright points... the lady in the gift shop was wonderful and wrapped my gifts with utmost care. Also, free DVD's on loan from the gift shop with a decent selection for all ages. The concierge was helpful, too. DO try his recommendation for good Mexican food over at Riverside Point at a place called the Iguana Cafe. Get the mini chimichangas for the appetizer! Also, this is a 5 minute walk across to the Carrefour supermarket so whatever you may need for your trip is within easy reach. There is a good Japanese restaurant out the back door, too. Coffee places and and a live music beer bar is also within about 30 second's walk so you can always find food and drink close-by in addition to good shopping. The Hippo sightseeing bus has it's main stop just across the street and runs about every 20 minutes or so and is very reasonable in cost. I'd recommend taking the red circuit before doing anything else as it just takes about 40 minutes and takes you all over. Then you can decide what you want to do later on. The yellow circuit is good, too, going out further into the outskirts of the city. DO get off at Clark Quay at night time and have a walk around. It's a beautiful area! You can catch the Hippo boat tour near that stop. Singapore's a nice place to visit... just wish the hotel hadn't been so disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by Club and over the top charges”
Reviews.Author: The_Hotel_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience with the Conrad Centennial Singapore and unfortunately it hadn't been as good as I had hoped. I stayed in Rm 2619 (King Executive) for two nights (approx SGD$280 per night - on a deep discount), which included access to the Executive Floor Lounge. Rooms are nice, with good bathrooms (including a usable bath) and great tolietries (Anna Kappa - Italian origin). TV is poorly placed to side of bed, but otherwise all is good. The room climate control, however, worked poorly - my room was sweltering when I arrived (room is the power saving sort where card needed to power the A/C at anything other than minimal - not a good arrangement in a tropical climate) and I could only make it comfortable by turning the dial down past 10 degrees (which got the room to about 19 degrees as long as you stayed in your room). Executive Club was a let down - only the couches (of which there where only a couple) where comfortable, all the other chairs did not encourage you to linger. Staff in the lounge pretty much left you to yourself - especially if you weren't a local - which was annoying since if you wanted a drink (other than the limited wine or juices out) you had to get one of them to give it to you. Only a small selection of canapes and low grade nibbles put out. You can go down to Oscar's for the included breakfast if you want, which I recommend, as there is greater choice and better service. Lounge also wasn't very large, would get very crowded when hotel isn't half-empty (like it was when I was there). From my experience the lounge was well below par for a five star asian hotel. Got a huge shock when a friend and I ordered coffee in the Lobby Lounge one afternoon, not only was the concept of a flat white not understood but the charge for two very bad coffees was SGD$24. Outrageous. In short, I felt this hotel fell short of the standard to be expected of a premier five star hotel in Asia, especially when it came to service. At full room prices I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GothamSinghu
Reviews.Content: Excellent business hotel. Very professional staff and overview. Impressive facilities. Staff very responsive and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: adirondacksailor
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here at the end of a Southeast Asia cruise and it was the perfect end to the trip. The Conrad Centennial is a gorgeous hotel in every category - public areas, guest rooms, restaurant and staff. The breakfast buffet was a sight to behold. The display surpassed any I have seen, and the food was wonderful. The room and bath were absolutely perfect. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: dcp_7
Reviews.Content: Had an executive room and as soon as we arrived we were taken to a private reception on the top floor. Staff were great, friendly but professional and made sure we wanted for nothing. The room was spacious, clean and had everything we needed. The bathroom was spotless, of a decent size and had a nice shower. The products in the bathroom were also very pleasant and were of good quality. Executive lounge had a good breakfast laid out which was constantly topped up and again the staff always made sure you were looked after. Only disappointment was there was nothing at all laid for lunchtimes - something they should consider. The location was ideal, practically on top of Suntec city mall, which you could walk through in air conditioned comfort to get to the underground and waterfront. Lastly we did eat in Oscars the main hotel restaurant, foolishly we opted for the buffet - it was expensive and we did not feel we got our money's worth. Unless you are able to eat a great deal it really is not worth the cost, especially when the food isnt to everyones taste.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel to put up”
Reviews.Author: RonP79
Reviews.Content: Conrad Centennial Singapore is located in prime location of Singapore and is very close to couple of tourist attracions. For children, Suntec cite is just a stone throw away. Raffles, Merlion square, the floating stadium is also nearby. Only thing is there is not MRT station nearby and have to depend upon taxi and bus. The hotel has huge lobby, nice spacious rooms. Cleanliness was worth appreciating. Compared to the level of service that is being provided, the higher costs are much justified.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: MeanVivi
Reviews.Content: Location - Wonderful for shoppers as it located between 2 mega malls, but not really close to MRT, need 15mins walk through the underground. Check-in/out - efficient n nice, the staff allowed me to check-in an hour earlier n took me to the room directly. good! Room - Fruits updated daily, lovely teddy bear n chocolate on first day. So sweet~ Services - Room cleaning staff r polite n friendly. but the staff at concierge r not smart enough, e.g. wanna take taxi to some attractions but they dont know the approximate fare n just told me all places must within SGD10..........u know, Sin is a small city n only travelling to airport will exceed SGD10!! the problem is that the taxi driver there always drive around n not chossing the shortest way to the destination. :(

Reviews.Title: “THE Perfect Oasis in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Saintlysinister
Reviews.Content: My partner gave a surprise treat for me as a much needed retreat as we're not able to go away from Singapore due to work. It was a weekend getaway. My partner opted for the executive club room. Upon arrival, we were swift to the executive club floor for check in, since it's at the 2nd highest floor of the building, the view is magnificent!! The ONLY time whereby the hotel staff actually is on his knee while asking for our particulars for checking in!! That's THE respect of service that is almost never seen in 5 stars hotels that i have been & seen till to date!! Even though we're local, they still treat us basically like a king which sadly is not commonly found these days. Frequent travellers to Singapore should know by now that the hotel rooms here are not as huge as compared to the ones in Thailand, well, in Conrad, it's spacious, similar to Marina Mandarin executive club rooms, but the highlights in the room were the high-rise bed and ever-so-cudly snow down pillows. They were the perfect match-in-heaven!!! The bathroom could have been bigger with bigger tub, the only mismatch thing in the room. Other than that, no words could truly express how heaven like it is to stay in Conrad. Thank you for making such a nice worthly retreat for me and my partner.

Reviews.Title: “best service ever had”
Reviews.Author: stocki80
Reviews.Content: I stayed three weeks in April 2009 in this Hotel and really enjoyed my stay. The Hotel is located near the Marina and close to Suntec Mall. The MRT is as well close by. The rooms are really nice and huge and well equipped e.g. 42 inch flatscreen. If you have a room with Marina view you can enjoy the beautiful Skyline view! The service in the reception area and in the Executive Lounge is the best ever had and I stay normally about 50 to 75 nights in Hotel per year! I can only recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: AV77
Reviews.Content: Just about perfect...location, facilities, staff, services. If you are on a Biz trip to Singapore...first choice

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever. There are no words. Beyond perfect.”
Reviews.Author: bryanmurphy
Reviews.Content: We were there a few days before a cruise. At the end of the stay, I almost would have rather stayed at the Conrad instead. ALMOST. We travel all over the world. THIS IS THE BEST PLACE EVER. We stayed on the exec floor which got us to the lounge. Worth every cent spent. The staff, Griselda, Nicole, Anne, Hasmine and others were perfect. I keep using that word but that is what this place is. It was wonderful to sit at the top looking down at the city eating the snacks they have there. Breakfast buffet is also the best we've had. It never got crowded. Relaxed. The greeter, Peter, I believe his name is, gave us great info on our upcoming cruise locations. Everyone went beyond. There is someone there to open the doors day and night. The desk staff can't do enough for you. I could have moved into the bathroom in our room. It was huge and they had a little rubber ducky for the tub. I only take showers. I had to get into the tub to use the ducky. Such fun. There is a large shopping mall with a CARREFOUR market, a major food court with perhaps 25 stores, various shops. You can lose. We want to go back to SIN so we can stay at the CONRAD. We enjoyed the city but I just might stay in the hotel the entire time. JUST PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: “5 star yes, but extra costs excessive”
Reviews.Author: mcchan
Reviews.Content: We booked the Conrad as a bit of luxury after a trip to Vietnam. Room was tasteful and comfortable, nice pool etc. Staff were very friendly and eager to help. The hotel is 5 star definitely but it is the extra costs that take the tinge off. Internet access was $7 SGD for 15 minutes - surely in this modern age easily accessible free internet should be the norm? $10 SGD for a bottle of water! Luckily we had breakfast included in our room rate so didn't have to fork out $39 each for the pleasure - may be good value if you want to gorge yourself but not so if you just want coffee and toast. We ate in Peony restaurant based in the hotel for one night and while very nice the prices were very expensive. This seems however to be the theme in general in Singapore and unlikely any of the other 5 star places are any different.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at Conrad”
Reviews.Author: karin stockholm
Reviews.Content: From the minute I arrived and was escortedt to the the executive lounge check in on the 31st floor I felt like a real welcomed guest.That is a very pleasant feeling. The atmosphere is generous and the staff joke in a nice and polite way and really makes you feel well taken care off. The rooms are spacious and the bed is comfortable. ( a bit high if you not are so tall), I was on a birthday trip which was noticed by the hotel and me and my husband shared a wonderful signature cake that was delivered by singing staff to our room upon arrival. A really nice touch. The room has a lot of amenities such as exclusive serie of toiletries, a little map with a neckhanger if you want to go jogging and want advice of a nice running path and so on. The duck in the bathroom and the cute teddy bear was ment for you to keep. Small things that all together makes a stay so cosy and pleasant.. The crowd is mainly conference delegates that attend events in Sun tec city but as a private guest you are just as well taken care off. Food and snacks were excellent and the view from the 31st floor is magnificent. The pool area is in the shadow until noon . An extra plus for the good service there too. The location is good if you want to go shopping in the Sun tec mall, the Esplanade and it is really good for the upcoming F1 races. But you need to take a cab/ MRT if you want to go to Orchard Road. The hotel is ageing but it´s ageing gracefully and with the superb staff it is still a gem in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Service oriented...”
Reviews.Author: ashokvelupula
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I ever stayed in Singapore. The hotel staff is too good to assist. Hotel is good in architecture and pleasing. Hope to stay in this hotel once again. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Staying amidst the fountain of wealth was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: SparkDelhi
Reviews.Content: I visit Singapore frequently for business meetings and the Conrad Centennial is located close to Temasek Boulevard overlooking the Suntek towers and the fountain of wealth. The Conrad is particularly unique as one gets a personal teddy bear at each stay which is a thoughtful carry home present for its guests. The shopping malls, food courts and sightseeing places are located in close proximity and the stay is always a pleasure to look forward to.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSCHO
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy and efficient. The room was well set with extra bed asked and had a fruit palette and a box of chocolate. Had a small but nice swimming pool and the breakfast was a bit limited but yet very nice. After a day in the hot weather in Singapore, the hotel was a nice place to be back for a rest.

Reviews.Title: “memorable”
Reviews.Author: zoo-san
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Conrad singapore because of its location in Suntec City and were very pleased with our choice. Corner executive suite was fantastic - all the amenities there, modern design, 2 flat screen TVs, pillow menu, excellent and plentiful toiletries, fruit, chocolate, teddy bear and bath ducky... Complimentary breakfast, snacks, afternoon tea and evening cocktails in the lounge add nice touch to an overall wonderful stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel in SINGAPORE”
Reviews.Author: jrm1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend, and it was the best experience EVER in a hotel in Singapore. All the staff (from front desk, concierge, restaurant, and doormen) were top notch. All came forward to assist before I could even ask for it, and when they found out it was my partners birthday (a few days ago), I was quietly approached (away from my partner) by the front desk staff (ask for Clint- he is the best!) if I wanted a cake arranged, and they arranged for it to be placed in the room while we were out for dinner. There was even cutlery and plates placed in the room- every detail handled and thought of. Best of all- the cake was not charged to us, a truly great experience. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Singapore- it is located in the fantastic part of the city for shopping and conventions; shopping is connected by covered walkways, and the train station is also connected by covered shopping all the way. But yet the hotel is quiet and serene. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Tropic2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for three days at the end of a 2 week cruise from Shanghai to Singapore. The rooms were well kept with one minor exception. But otherwise the whole experience here was one of the best we have had. Upon arrival the conceige desk immediately met with our wives and worked out reservations for tours and other information about Singapore. Each day they would acknowledge us and asked if they could be of assistance (and they were). With our room we had included a breakfast buffet each day which was outstanding and when we had to leave early to catch a flight they prepared a "breakfast bag" to take with us. When we got there they had them already made up... no fuss, no delays. We also loved the rooms that we stayed in and the rooms were clean and the bath soaps, etc were outstanding. We started our stay on the weekend and were able to take advantage of a very reduced fare for the rooms though pre payment was a requirement of the program we were never charged until we actually got there (though if we had not shown up I'm sure the same would have applied). This hotel is in a great location for shopping (2 or 3 malls within a few blocks, good access to transportation and taxis are quite reasonalbe since everything is rather close by (except for surcharge at rush hours). There is also a lot of restraurants in the area as well as the one at the hotel to choose from with every type of foods. We highly recommend the Conrad and trust you would find it agreable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Public_Dave
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Conrad for three nights when I was in town for a conference at the nearby Raffles City mall area. Check in was smooth, I was whisked off to the 31st floor for check-in and was given a room with a lovely view of the city. The staff were incredibly friendly but not overbearing. The room itself was quite generously proportioned, especially the bathroom, which I liked very much. The unusual toiletries from Italy made for a pleasant change, and the hotel was very generous with the in room fruits and snacks (not to mention the breakfast/tea time buffet). Thanks for the chocolates and fruits Conrad! The facilities are also quite impressive - the pool was very nice as was the gym, I particularly liked the fruit juice bar near the water cooler. Cardio equipment mostly came with built-in TVs from Life Fitness. The location of the hotel is great in that you come straight off the highway from the airport and you're at the hotel, and yet it is quite central, close to the business district and also to a fair bit of shopping and restaurants. A key plus is that it is possible to get from the hotel to Raffles City without being outside for more than about 10 meters (and there is an umbrella in the room after all). I had stayed at the hotel last in 2001, and it seemed as good as new. Had a pleasant evening at the Paulaner Brauhaus nearby. Will definitely stay again with the family on the next visit. I really appreciated the genial hospitality of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “luxury and flexible too- a gem”
Reviews.Author: jpaulcook
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this place. We had a 30hr stopover in Singapore arriving c 8pm but not departing until 11pm next day. The staff were very helpful and gave us the room to 6pm when they took our luggage to be collected. When we checked out, they even asked if we would join them for refreshments before we left! We had an Executive Room which was beautiful and included drinks all day, afternoon tea and canapes in the evening. Everything was spot on- my only tiniest nitpick is sachets of instant coffee and having to pay for real coffee in the minibar. Grea stay, highly recommended and splash out on the exec level- it is worth it

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, 4 star hotel with fabulous breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SoReCa
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES: nicely appointed rooms with large/plush bathroom, friendly staff, hotel connected to underground, air conditioned walkway to metro (very nice in 90 degree weather), good location, buffett breakfast (ours was included in room rate) with lots of delicious Asian and Western choices NEGATIVES: metro further than anticipated but only 10-15 minute brisk walk, pricey compared to most Southeast Asian countries but reasonable compared to other Singaporean hotels of this calibur BOTTOM LINE: very nice, quiet hotel fairly close to metro with comfortable and spacious rooms. Pricey breakfast, but take advantage if included in room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to it's status but not beyond it”
Reviews.Author: MiMi&Sue
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotels are lovely, and the Conrad Centennial is no exception. Beautiful facilities, lots of extras, like a rubber duckie, and an incredible choice of pillows. Everything you would expect of a hotel of this standard, and indeed price. BUT on arrival I requested a non-smoking room. None was available, so I was put in a smoking room, An ioniser was used, and it was bearable. I did communicate that I was not particually happy with a smoking room, and more so a smoking floor. I was promised an ioniser daily. So the smoking room was ok, I guess. But I would have preferred to be moved to another, non-smoking, room. An exceptional hotel would have moved me without fuss. In fact I have been moved under similar circumstances in the past in "lesser" hotels. So the Conrad level of service failed, I'm sorry to say.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Luxury, Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Hotpot2215
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel early Feb. Nicest hotel we have ever stayed in. Staff we're polite, couldn't do enough for you. Lots of complimentary extras. Breakfast was fantastic, everything you would have wanted and more. The rooms were amazing, the biggest TV you can imagine, with the most comfortable beds,pillow menu ,you name it you had it. Set in the business district the hotel could have been slightly better location wise. Taxi's are so cheap though this really isn't a problem. No complaints what so ever about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Vafirish
Reviews.Content: Conrad Centennial Hotel truly leaves up to its Hilton standard of service. It was simply superb. Even though I had no luggage with me, the check-in officer by the name of Chandran actually escorted me all the way to my room. Totally unexpected but well appreciated. Now that’s service! Everything in the room was in tip top condition so there is nothing to complain there and the view is just superb – especially during the day when the sun slowly rises and allowed natural light to enter the room. The breakfast spread was okay – not as extravagant but enough. The waffles and ice-cream is a great way to start your breakfast! You also cannot go wrong with the location as its just within walking distance from the malls and the suntec city convention centre. Conrad Centennial is just excellent. This is how all Singapore Hotel should be! For pictures please visit, [--] and just click on Hotels in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: Calliopea
Reviews.Content: Pros: good location (though a little difficult on foot since you have to connect through shopping malls), unbelievable brunch, nice flatscreen tv in rooms, and free wifi in lobby Cons: concierge gave conflicting information, another big business hotel

Reviews.Title: “At the top league - but not the best within it.”
Reviews.Author: jaejaez
Reviews.Content: Conrad Centennial Singapore (hereafter CCS) is a fine hotel in all aspects but still has a distance to cover before it stands shoulder-to-shoulder with the likes of the Ritz, St. Regis or even its neighboring Mandarin Oriental. Friendliness - check. Cleanliness - check. Amenities - check. Location - check. All solid checks but never a 'STAR' in any of the key categories. The hotel exudes a charm of a boutique property - for its brand name the overall size is on the smaller side. But it's well decorated with thoughtful touches in all corners. The lobby is beautiful without being overwhelming (having said that, the lobby pianist was atrocious - he was playing the piano & sending SMSs @ the same time.. how unprofessional). Staff re fluff the cushions on couches every time guests vacate it. The concierges are constantly engaging guests with friendly conversations and smiles. A great lobby to settle back in. Check-in was very quick and friendly despite the long queue (must have been some corporate group checking in from Japan at the time). Most staff were all smiles except for the rare few that stood around with a glimpse of attitude. One bell boy accepted my 'good morning' with a quick nod. It's usually the other way around in most 5 star properties - bell boys greet me and i nod them with a smile. Rooms are very good but not superb. You need to take a few steps back to do a high jump onto your bed cos they're so high. Try not to fall off the bed while sleeping - you WILL injure yourself. Not exactly my type of bed, but soft and plush nonetheless once you are settled in. Nice flat TV screen on the wall but it's positioned in such a way that you have you look sideways from your bed to watch TV - awkward. A good list of channels to choose from though. Room maintenance is well done and I had a nice view of the wealth fountain & the Suntec from my room. Cute fruit platter was much appreciated and so was the yellow duckling!! Little touches as these make a world of difference and truly make you feel welcome. Bathroom is big with nice marble walls and a separate shower - bath. Plenty amenities (with generous portions - as is the case with all Conrads). My only problem with it was that the shower was not barriered off in any way that if you took a shower you'd wet the entire bathroom floor. An unfortunate flaw in an otherwise excellent bathroom. The bathroom mirrors are also not heated - take a long hot shower and they become useless. Do not get me wrong - the hotel (incl. the rooms) is an excellent one. Those bits that I'm picking on are those I'd change to have it rival the other giants and be at the top of the league. One last thing I'd change (and this is purely subjective) are the candles in the lobby. Given its status as a business hotel, it would be better to scent the lobby with a smell that is more 'soothing' than that which is 'stimulating'. Most guests walking in the doors at night are tired from work and would certainly appreciate a scent that can calm their nerves. Didn't get to use the swimming pool so cannot comment. As for location, it's great to shop and sight-see. It's a stone throw away from the Esplanade Theater, Suntec, Millenia Walk, Marina Bay etc (all shopping malls). But it's a good 20 minute walk away from the nearest MRT station (Cityhall). Once again, a great location but not a superb one. Overall, a lovely hotel indeed... in fact, so lovely that it makes you cringe to iron out those few areas of flaws to make it perfect. I am ready to transfer my loyalty from SPG to HHonours if this is to happen. Would definitely return for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were great. But frontline and reservation needs improvement.”
Reviews.Author: AnYanXuan
Reviews.Content: I had booked a month in advance for a 1 night stay in a king bed business room at the Conrad on valentines’ day. However, 2 days before the 14th, a staff from Conrad called to inform me that they would be running on full house on 14 feb, and hence are offering an early check in at 10 am. As I had plans for the morning, I declined the offer and informed them that I would be checking in at the official check-in time of 2pm. The staff went on to inform me that, as they would be expecting a large crowd, it would be advisable for me to arrive after 3pm to avoid the crowd at check-in. On the 14 feb, I arrived at 215 pm at the hotel lobby but only managed to get my turn to check-in at 240pm. I had a bad feeling when the front desk staff processing my check-in started making calls to the housekeeping department exclaiming the lack of rooms to issue to the guests checking in. True enough, she then informed me that the room category I had booked for was not available, and there were only twin beds left for the business rooms. She then proceeded to issue me a king non-executive room, which according her was the only room with a king bed left. When I enquired on why I could not get a room that I had reserved for, She simply answered that “rooms are issued on a first-come-first-served” basis. Imagine what rooms would be left if I had really came at 3pm? She went on further to explain that all the rooms in the different categories are exactly the same, differing only in the benefits that came with the room. Throughout the whole incident, she was persistent in getting me to accept the “downgrade” and her take-it or leave-it attitude showed that she was unwilling to go think of any other alternative. Only after further enquiry, did she mention that my room would only be available at 7pm after a group of tourist on the business levels who has paid for late checkout till 6pm leaves. I am seriously puzzled on why the hotel actually allowed the prior group of guests to extend their checkout when they are expecting a full house? That was not all. Minutes after entering the non-executive room that I was issued, I was rudely interrupted by a housekeeping staff who entered my room with her ‘staff key’, without even ringing the doorbell! Her explanation for intruding was, she was trying to check if the room is currently being occupied as the front desk is facing a shortage in available rooms. My partner and I were appalled at the way our privacy was not respected and also at the lack of communication between the front desk and housekeeping department. Being our first stay with Conrad, I was seriously disappointed at the level of service we were provided with. I had read numerous good reviews regarding the hotel and was looking forward to my stay. I only managed to get the room category that I had booked for, at 7pm, after the senior duty manager personally attended to my request. The rooms at the Conrad did live up to their reputation in terms of cleanliness and comfort. Small details such as the pillow menu were also thoughtful. The room service was also prompt and delicious. My only piece of advice for those that are staying at Conrad during peak occasions. Be able to check in early, else be prepared to accept the lack of service.

Reviews.Title: “good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: LordReichardt
Reviews.Content: the Marina Bay area is still a little isolated but the hotel is very high standard - i have stayed here several times and i wish they would sort out the key card readers in the elevators - they always seem to malfunction

Reviews.Title: “A special hotel where nothing was too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: BiggerAl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on a stopover across the New Year en route to Australia. We benefited from an excellent rate for the hotel's star rating, but even when you take account of the good value, no other hotel on our one month trip compared with this one. The hotel is one of many in Marina Bay and it was very convenient for city sightseeing. We asked for a high room and that is what we were given with the added benefit of a view of the Merlion fountain in the harbour and the New Year's Eve fireworks. The room was splendid with a bathroom you could party in. There was a bath and separate walk in/walk around shower, enhanced by marble surrounds in tasteful tones. For once the grand foyer was matched by the bedroom accommodation. We used the hotel's outdoor pool which was excellent. The service was faultless from the check in, through the concierge staff and room service to the restaurant. My wife's gluten free vegetarian diet was catered for particularly well. Where else would you get the GF pasta made to order? On the day I dropped my camera SD card through a grating in the street outside the hotel, the maintenace staff rescued it for me as though this was just part of their day's work! With all this excellent service the staff remained at hand but discrete and without an 'over the top' manner that you sometimes get in similar hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussie6
Reviews.Content: My husband was on business in Singapore and I went along for the ride. I have stayed in hotels all over the world and have never experienced service like this. Check in was fantastic. Ten minutes tops. We were then escorted by receptionist to our room and explained air con, tv etc. Concierge desk was amazing. Nothing was too much trouble and all advice given was spot on. Room service was excellent and very fast. Ice blocks delivered to room twice a day without having to ask. Shopping in surrounding areas is great. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for a fancy hotel”
Reviews.Author: frumiousb
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is centrally located in the harbor area and is a nice place to get many of the little touches of services and luxury that this kind of hotel provides. Particularly now, it is a good moment to get some exceptional rates at the Conrad. It may be more expensive than other hotels in the area, but with the rate that we were able to get, it was much cheaper than a hotel in Europe. The beds were very comfortable and the little touches like the fresh fruit in the rooms were appreciated. One minor complaint: the fancy bedside panel with which the room controls the lights was not working well. In our first room (We started and finished our Asian vacation at this hotel), the switch for the desk lights needed pounding in order to turn it on and off. In our second room, even though we turned the privacy light off in our room, it didn't turn off at the door and we came back from a long day of museums and shopping to find that the room had not been made up. Simple switches do have some value! The staff were friendly and perform beautifully. They sometimes even cross the line into being too helpful and too intrusive. As usual, I am constantly irritated by how much these high end hotels charge for things like breakfast, drinks and extras. If I could find a chain that gave some luxury but also charged reasonable prices, then I would be a loyal customer. If breakfast isn't included in your rate, then I would skip the hotel breakfast and instead walk the 10 meters into the nearby Millennium Walk and catch breakfast in the mall. I also found that the quality of the juice and cocktails in the (very expensive) hotel bar was below other bars that I found in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redwrangler8
Reviews.Content: The Conrad in Singapore is an excellent choice for the business traveller, especially when choosing the executive rooms. The service provided is impeccable. The rooms are are beautifully designed, follwing an Asian scheme with a lot of bamboo. The bathrooms are very spacious and the room is very clean and in excellent technical condition. The valet service is prompt, uncomplicated and cleanliness is perfect. The breakfast on the executive floors takes place in a calm environment with a wide variety of international breakfast items. The view of Singapore is from the high floors of this hotel is absolutely outstanding. The location of the hotel is not fully ideal though, even though it is close to the convention center, it is a bit out of the city center and any activities in walking distance to the hotel are limited to "convention related activites" and other hotels. Still I would overall recommend this hotel for the business traveller going to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth the difference”
Reviews.Author: Mupple
Reviews.Content: It costs a little more than some of the other hotels in the Marina area, but the difference is worth it. Decor, amenities and little extra touches in the rooms are great. Beds are wonderfully huge and soft. Service is first rate, staff really seem to try and think ahead to help. If you're looking for views, this is probably not the place, say compared to Swissotel, but overall, this shouldn't detract from the experience. So many things to see and do in Singapore that the length of time spent in the hotel room time may not be great !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent....”
Reviews.Author: alanyeo76
Reviews.Content: Great hotel located at a great location. The lobby gives you a clessy feeling and the check-in staff are always smiling. The room is clean and neat. The bathroom is very nice as well. They have the flat screen tv and DVD player in their rooms and the bed feels extremely comfortable as well. One of the best hotels that i have stayed. We tried the buffet dinner at the oscar (the hotel's coffee house) and the food was fantastic, good buffet spread as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: LiangShanBo
Reviews.Content: Nice 5 star hotel typical of the Hilton chain. Across the street from the convention center and close to several malls (although what large hotel is not close to a mall in SG?). Accordingly, plenty of places to grab a bite at all price levels and do some shopping between meetings. Very convenient to the aiport - maybe 15 minutes by taxi. Also let me check out a day early even though I was on a conference rate and subject to penalty for doing so. Since my company was going under and I was unlikely to get reimbursed for the trip, that meant a lot to me since the hotel is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: ramesh_chugh
Reviews.Content: v stayed in this hotel for 2 nites on 26 & 27th April.On my earlier visit i had stayed at Grand Copthrone Waterfront and had fun there.Check in was smooth and the room was great.Since i was on official trip..i had to share my room with 1 of my sub-ordinate.but the room was big and the furniture was new and plush.Breakfast was terrific with lots of lip smacking dishes.Location wise..its great hotel with suntec centre right in front of it.Commuting was not a problem as taxis and MRT is easliy available. The staff was courteous and polite.Great location and great hotel.Cant wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect business hotel”
Reviews.Author: airsupply
Reviews.Content: This is a typical 5 star chain hotel, huge,bland and lacking atmosphere but excellent for its type. The rooms are beautiful, beds huge and inoffensive colours and design. Lots of nice touches - fruit basket, chocolates and rubber duck for the tub. Good room service and an excellent in-room breakfast menu. The staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Par Excellence Service”
Reviews.Author: ynottravelnewdelhi
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive at staying at The Conrad, but this hotel by far exceeded my expectations. The hotel is a luxury property opposite the Convention Centre, amidst various shopping malls, both high ended as well as mid-level. Check in was smooth, as is expeceted from any luxury hotel. What impressed me most, was the interest taken by room service to make sure that no guest sleeps hungry. With my limited taste in food, the hostess made sure she sent dinner to me to suit my taste buds. This is something that I miss in most hotels in India too, despite vegetarian food being available very predominantly. As a single woman traveller, I was impressed once again - the elevators will only operate with key cards. The buffet is lavish, as compared to any other 5* luxury hotels that I have stayed in. As a travel proffessional, I do stay at some of the finest hotels around the world. The service is discreet yet is visible at every aspect of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: corky_c
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel a few times a year for business, usually for a week or two at a time. The Conrad Centennial Singapore is a fantastic hotel with great facilities, nice restaurants and excellent service. In the 10+ times I've stayed at this hotel I've never experienced any problems. I love the fact that they always have a box of chocolates and fresh fruits in my room when I check in. You also get a cute teddy bear during every stay :)

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: gmbklm
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on business. Very good for my purpose with the high levels of service you get used to at hotels of this type in Singapore. Very comfortable & no hassle. Very helpful and professional staff. Large and very nicely furnished room. Restaurant meals available from very early to very late (except for alcohol), which was useful.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad hotel / Singapore”
Reviews.Author: jjouett
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Conrad which is a Hilton Hotel property. The hotel and staff exceeded my expectations. They had a very nice exercise facility that we took advantage of while staying there. The rooms were nicely appointed and absolutely comforatable. The executive level, which I was upgraded to offered a happy hour and snack foods. I would recommend anyone looking for an upscale hotel to take advantage of everything this hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent executive stay”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this fantastic hotel for the last 3 nights of our stay in Singapore and the hotel was absolutely fantastic. As Hilton Honours Diamonds we were upgraded to the Executive floor and were personally escorted there for check in. The staff at check in were polite, efficient and extremely welcoming. They even provided a cooling welcome drink and moist hand towel whilst they were completing the paper work. The executive room as mentioned by a previous reviewer was large with little extra touches like fruit, chocolates, rubber duck and teddy bear. Fruit was replaced daily and the twice daily housekeeping service was good. The staff were incredible so attentive and nothing was ever too much trouble for them. The executive lounge was lovely with views over the city breakfast, afternoon tea and evening drinks provided - a very relaxing place. Overall we found this hotel excellent. We enjoyed not being in the mayhem and rush of Orchard Road, but still easily accessible to all of Singapores amenities and sights.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: prahran22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as it is almost next door to our company office in Suntec City. Due to the location, the hotel was therefore fine and the staff were always courteous and helpful. The lunch buffet downstairs where breakfast is also served was sensational. Rooms (weel the room I stayed in which was on the premier business floor) was a bit old and had a plazma tv (ggod) on the wall but it was on a wall almost at right-angles to the way the bed was facing...Many a still neck watching late night rubbish whilst eating the pringles from the mini-bar!! All in all, not bad, but reckon for the same price, there are much better hotels if location is not necessary near to Suntec. Actually due to the size of Singapore and the price of taxi's I realised, it actually isn't that important to be 'close' to anything in particular anyway....

Reviews.Title: “Professional, polished customer service”
Reviews.Author: Davred
Reviews.Content: I visit Singapore regularly on business and, whenever possible, ask my clients to book me into The Conrad. Unfortunately they don't all do this as it isn't the cheapest hotel in towwn, but it always makes the return a little bit sweeter! The service is just first rate. It's warm, genuine and welcoming without being cloying. The rooms are a good size, and if you're lucky enough to get an Executive Floor room, you'll get a good plasma or LCD TV as well. My only complaint is that the TV's are on a wall that means you can't lie flat out and watch through your feet! (Something everyone wants to do after a hard day of meetings!) Room service food is average plus, but again the service is terrific and friendly. This is a hotel where people will actually talk to you! Not a great choice of hotel restaurants, but Golden Peony is quite good, and the hot and sour soup with lobster excellent. Heaps of restaurants nearby as well. Location is great and will be even better in a couple of years when the new MRT station opens up nearby, but even now, City Hall is only an easy 10 minute underground, airconditioned walk away. Suntec Exhibition Centre is just across the road, and the Paulaner Brewhouse is next door and offers great German beer. But, back to the hotel. Comfortable, well equipped rooms that are clean, light and airy, good facilities, good pool and spa, clean modern gym, convenient location....but I always come back to the service. It is willing, warm and welcoming. A hotel that is worth trying!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: audreyliz
Reviews.Content: I had got the Executive plan rate, which provided a supposedly larger, nicer room and included breakfast daily. It also included 5 pieces of pressing during the first 2 days of the stay and 20% off at the spa. The room was quite nice with a great view of the surrounding city and part of the bay. There was fresh fruit and a box of chocolates, as well as a little teddy bear and a rubber ducky in the bath. The service was amazing! All the staff acted like I was the most important guest they had all year. I went to the main restaurant for the breakfast buffet twice. The atmosphere is a little crazy, but not too bad. Then I discovered that another breakfast buffet is available on the Executive floor, so I went to that one and it was much more relaxing. The only thing missing were omelettes, waffles, and traditional Asian breakfast items, so if you don't care about that, then its perfect. The spa was absolutely incredible! The prices were also quite reasonable. One technician, Mae, was this tiny little woman with the strongest hands and arms. At one point during the massage, I realized that she was actually sitting across my back and I couldn't even tell she was there. I had scrubs and wraps and all sorts of fun things done there, and then I laid poolside for the rest of the day to recover from my long trip. Warning - the food from the pool menu is blah and insanely expensive. Also, there is a buffet for dinner. The price might be approaching reasonable if you are going to eat your fill of crab legs, praws, oysters, and sushi, but if you are not going to eat those things, you are going to pay WAY too much.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: teddyrex
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a month in Asia and stayed a week at the Conrad Centennial in Singapore. I am Hilton Gold HHonors and have stayed at all the Hilton brands all over the US and Europe but this was the first fime we have stayed at a Conrad Hotel. What a terrific hotel! The room was lovely, the bathroom fantastic and the service throughout was exemplary. We were particularly impressed with the Executive Lounge on the top floor. It took up the entire floor (as I remember) and had great views in all directions. The food and service were wonderful - full breakfast, elegant tea, and other food/beverage service all day long. Did not use the gym, but the pool was beautiful and there was very attentive poolside service. The only thing about the hotel we were not crazy about was the only restaurant - Oscar's. It had a 24 hour a day buffet which looked good if you like buffets (we don't) and was very noisy. We ordered several meals from the VERY LIMITED menu which were OK but it really would have been nice to have had a more conventional restaurant available in the hotel. But we loved the Conrad and would rate this brand as equal to or superior to Ritz Carltons we have stayed at in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Irregular”
Reviews.Author: archmage
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel when I had a business training there. When I first checked in, the room I had was very bad: a) Lingering aroma of smoke in a non-smoking room b) When I asked the hostess who escorted me to the room, she said she couldn't smell the smoke (and it was fairly strong) c) The TV was an antique I asked for a room change and got a better room which had a huge flat screen tv. But the TV remote wasn't really working. The entertainment system was flaky (had a windows error screen on the tv). Overall, the customer service is decent but the room itself isn't fantastic. I've stayed at the Ritz Carlton before and it was much much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but difficult checkout .”
Reviews.Author: Gingersnaps
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a few Hotels like Grand Hyatt, Shangri-la, Marriott, Pan Pacific, Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons. Probably second to Four Seasons/Ritz.. But the lounge if fantastic with great views and surprisingly good food. Water in pool was freezing. And upon checkout, we were overcharged on the weekend rates and it was very inconvenient because the guy helping us at the club floor was not skilled in changing the rates. I think I still prefer staying at the Orchard area .

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Visit and Stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: goliathtn
Reviews.Content: Spent a total of a week at the Conrad in 2004 and what an outstanding hotel. This hotel didn't have any downsides that I saw. I was in Singapore on business and the service at this hotel was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_TX88
Reviews.Content: Conrad Singapore in a classy and elegant hotel. I can usually find something I do not like about a given hotel but not this one. The staff were very gracious and helpful and easily accessible. I had a beautiful room on the corner of the building - I could see the largest fountain in the world ahead of me and the largest Ferris wheel out of the side window. The room left nothing to be desired that I could think of. It had all the small touches that mark a really good hotel. I like to exercise on the road and the Conrad had a great work out room with helpful attendants. They even had mango and apple juice in the exercise room for a refreshing drink after working out! I'm a HHonors Gold member and the concierge lounge was very nice and for breakfast there were actually two areas for us HHonors folks to eat at - one poolside and the other on the top floor (where they served drinks and snacks in the evening). Just an outstanding hotel in the heart of the Singapore business district!

Reviews.Title: “appreciate and honor the concierge who found my wallet ...”
Reviews.Author: 888Wendy
Reviews.Content: i am so thankful that the person (whoever he/ she is) found my wallet and returned me back untouched at the concierge desk . I get used to put lot's of cash ( over Us1000) in my wallet while taking a long trip with my 2 daughters, so here, wanna give them a heartly THANK YOU !! Overall, this is a 5 star hotel and the price is worth to pay ~

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lwlee
Reviews.Content: I didn't read the reviews before I stayed at Conrad. After reading them just now, I am surprised that my experience was somewhat different from the other reviewers. Could it be because we booked through a travel agent and was traveling with young children? We (8 adults + 3 children) stayed at Conrad for 1 night on 02/12/2008. We requested non-smoking rooms on the same floor, and we got 4 rooms on the 6th floor, supposedly a non-smoking floor, except 3 of the rooms smelled like the smoking lounge. When we tried to change 2 of the rooms, we were asked to let housekeeping come in to ionize the room. Why didn't housekeeping ionize the room before we arrive? We checked-in at 7pm! After we insisted on changing rooms and waited for about 10 minutes, we got the room change. After the room change, everything was good; the bed was comfortable, fresh and clean. One little note on the bathroom: the caulking in the shower was moldy. I stayed at Mandarin Oriental August 2007 for 4 nights and had a pleasant experience. Between these 2 hotels, I would choose Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: Smooth_Sluggo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on January 30th for one night. The room was extremely expensive, but fortunately I had enough points in my Hilton HHonors account for a free night, and being a Gold VIP member put me on the club floor with benefits. Had I paid for this room myself, I don't think it would have been worth it for me. This is a fantastic hotel. Check-in was fast, the room and views fantastic, with a bevvy of extra treats for being on the club floor. The room had an extremely comfortable bed, with a 42" flat screen TV, and a large, spacious bathroom. The only problem we experienced was that our pillows smelled a bit funny, as if they had not been washed in a while, but housekeeping switched that out within minutes. The free breakfast on the club floor was excellent, though we got a glance at the regular breakfast and that looked fantastic. The gym is above average but not spectacular, though the pool is very nice and has great views of the city. The front desk was extremely helpful with everything, and is always well staffed. Bottom line: a great hotel with a well-deserved reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Cortleigh
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. Lovely big room and luxurious bathroom with huge shower cubicle. Everything you could possibly want in the room including large flat-screen TV. Enormous variety on offer at breakfast and very attentive staff. Quietly located in a cul-de-sac but a stone's throw from the convention centre. If you do not wish to eat in the hotel, there is a good selection of bars and restaurants opposite in the same street. A 2 minute walk brings you to the Singapore Convention Centre from where you can walk in air-conditioned comfort to the theatre, shopping malls and Raffles City MRT station. After a busy day out, we headed for the lovely rooftop pool which, unlike most hotel pools is a really good size. We were greeted with a complimentary glass of iced water and sliced apple and were invariably the only people there.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: Pork-Jerky
Reviews.Content: 1 night stay in a business hotel. Nothing fantastic or out of the norm except for their turndown service which is worth mentioning. There's a pillow menu with a choice of 16 different types - but go with the ploh... it's a body-length feather pillow that hugs your body just right. It retails for over USD300 if you want to buy it (based on www.plohdirect.com)! There's far too many choices to explore so unless you're there for more than a couple of days, it's hard to run through the entire list. To most, the original pillows provided are fine. A thing to note though, do 'order' your pillow early... we had to wait almost an hour before the pillows came and had to call housekeeping twice to place the 'order'. There's the signature little Conrad bear provided in every room. A nice touch coming from a business hotel. The toilet was spacious and had huge mirrors all round. One gripe about the room is that the TV is very ackwardly positioned at the side of the bed. Meaning if you want to lie in bed to watch TV, you would have to turn on your side (and block your partner while doing so). This is a trade off for the beautiful view that greets you when you wake in the morning with floor-to-ceiling windows with views of Suntec City.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: familytravelchamp
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a trip to Singapore. We loved the food there and we loved Conrad. I called Conrad directly to book because the Hilton website cannot handle an option with 2 adults and 1 child. The check-in process was smooth and we got what we asked for, non-smokiing room, a king-size bed with a rollaway. We are Hilton Honors Gold member and we were upgraded to a business class room with complementary breakfast. The room on 17th floor was spacious with big windows and we could see the harbor and a few other high-rise hotels. It was fun to just looking out the window. We were offered to have breakfast on the executive floor or cafe on the first floor. We picked the cafe on the first floor because we were told that the selection was more there. The breakfast offered Japanese, Chinese and American food. It was quite decent considered it was free.We paid around US$235 per night including tax and service charge. This is a very good price for 5-star quality and service. The concierge, laundry valet, pool/gym area offered very attentive and speedy service. Business class included $20 credit for laundry and I took advantage of it and had our jeans washed for free. I am a cost conscious traveler. It is defintely a luxury to me. Conrad is across the street from Suntec City which is a huge shopping mall with a lot of nice restaurants and food courts. You could find cuisine ranging from Chinese, Sudanese, Indian and more there. McDonald's, Burger King could also be found near the food court if your kids miss their comfort food. I broke down and let my kid have a hamburger after traveling in Asia for more than 10 days. If you want to play tourist, there is also a tourist center where you can take the Hippon (Hop on and hop off) Tour bus to see the city. It is also the depot of the amphibian duck tour. The country/city is quite small and taking taxi is the way to go. It is very inexpensive. We went to Long Beach Seafood restaurant on East Coast for dinner the first night. It is on the beach. Their famous black-peppered Sri Lanka crab was definitely a must to have if you go to Singapore. It was spicy but not overpowering. I could still taste the sweetness and freshness of the crab. My son had a buttered crab. It was also very good. We went to Newton circus (sp?) the seond night for chili crab. This was a place full of hawker stands. The Conrad conciege told us about the rating the hawker stands have. Pick the one that is A rated. This is an interesting experience that you should not miss. We took a subway there ourselves after a day visit to Sentosa, an island that offered, cycling, underworld aquarium, luge ride, cablecar ride and fish spa. Yes, we paid to have fish eating dead skin off our feet. It was a very fascinating experience. Conrad is quite far from the subway station. Both Conrad and Suntec City offer shuttle bus to take you to the closest MRTstation. The hotel is not within distance to Orchard Road that was the haven for shopping. I don't like shopping while I am traveling. So I didn't miss the shopping too much. We loved our time in SIngapore and Conrad was an excellent choice. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent visit to the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: ChaunceyGardiner
Reviews.Content: This is one of many visits here over the years. The Conrad continues to excel as a business hotel. Don’t know how I’d rank it as a leisure hotel (but only because of cost and distance to an MRT station), but I’m a happy camper to be here again. I was on Club Floor this visit, so I was whisked away from the front desk to check in on 31. While signing papers, another employee came by (it was 9:00p) and said “you look like you’ve had a long day, would you like a glass of Taittinger?” Since Mrs. Gardiner would disapprove, I didn’t propose marriage, but I certainly accepted the champagne. I was (either because of my Hilton status, or because I need to have my company renegotiate our rates) put into a 01/Centennial suite. Very, very nice end of building suite with full sitting room: desk, couch, comfy chair, MONSTER Sony flatscreen TV. Loads of windows looking over Suntec Conv Centre and Fountain of Wealth (excellent feng shui!). Bed, as always, exceptionally sleepable. Molton Browne toiletries, which beats heck out of Hyatt’s generics, and on par with Raffles Amrita brand. Room and bathroom sparkled. Please, though, get desk chairs with wheels! Dinner in lobby level generic restaurant. They have an excellent breakfast buffet. I was late for dinner, but had an terrific (as always ) satay set. I asked for pressing of two trousers and two shirts, and they were quickly picked up and agreed for an 8am return. I was hugely embarrassed when housekeeping called 20 minutes later to confirm that (gasp!) one of the cuffs on one of my slacks seemed a bit frayed (note attention to detail: very crisp!).
