Everything was returned, punctually, without further editorial comment, at 8am the next morning, in time for me to head to the day’s business. (The frayed cuff was dutifully pressed as well.) Conrad impressed me when my meeting schedule started running long. I had meetings both in the CBD and at Suntec. As things unwound, one of my company’s assistants called the Conrad to extend my checkout (repeatedly!), and each time she called, they happily agreed… all the way to a 3:30p check-out without extra charge! NICE! (I assume they had the availability…) Then, after a final dash from the office to the Conrad, and a rapidfire packing of suitcase, etc., when I was sitting at the check-out desk on 31, slightly sweaty, the same young lady from the prior evening walked over with a champagne glass and the Taittinger bottle… “Mr. Gardiner, will you have a splash before you head to the airport?” Yes, I will… Another excellent stay at one of the top business hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, excellent views”
Reviews.Author: SirGoofy
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I stayed here for a few nights in 2006. The reason I am writing after so long is because after staying in more that 10 different hotels, I find that no other hotel has such a great room. The bed is elevated and faces a glass wall. What a view awaits you when you wakes up. Excellent hotel but costly though. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Luv the comfy Bed”
Reviews.Author: misslovey
Reviews.Content: (Booked thru redemption of a membershiper points) I was well taken of the moment I stepped into this hotel. I was led to the check-in counter and was surprisely upgraded to the Exec room due to classic rm fully booked. The counter staffs were all very friendly, nor did I once encounter any rude or cold face during my stay there. They were generously witht the fruits platter and due it was a Christmas eve, guests received a fruitcake and a box of choco complimentary. I luv the toiletries (Molten Brown) and the spacious and cosy toilet! Overall, I had a great time there and I will definitely go back again ..soon.

Reviews.Title: “Its ok”
Reviews.Author: TravellerKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: Friendly doorman and guest assistants were out to greet us whenever we reach the doorstep or out of the hotel. Hotel is very much an upper business class hotel. Taxis were easy to get. Location wise not in central, quiet and traffic ok. Room and bathroom were clean. Room facilities ok. However, i had a but of problem with the service of the concierge. They took quite a long time to locate my luggage and to send it to my room after a few calls.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Prashan
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Conrad during a number of visits in 2007, I have to say its is one of the best hotels in the World...the staff are the key to making the stay very enjoyable. The hotel and facilities are always top notch. The Executive Rooms are great and offer great views of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobertAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights and enjoyed it a lot, we had a exectitive room so had access to the evening drinks and nibbles which was great and I thought that the pool area was also quite nice. Very close to quite a few shopping malls and lots of restaraunts at night, as mentioned before taxis are cheap here but you may have to wait sometimes for them. Will definatley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money - slightly inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: KcatHK
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at Raffles the Plaza whenever I go to Singapore but since this trip was last minute, I have to look somewhere else. There was a conference going on so it was difficult to find a room in SG. I stumbled across the Conrad and image how happy I was to discover that the hotel website offered an online rate that was even better than some 4-stars establishments in town! The moment I stepped off the taxi, a Conrad staff came up and greeted me and led me to the check in desk. I arrived around 10-ish in the morning so my room was not ready yet. I did ask if I can just have any room to have a quick change of clothes but no luck. They did, however, offered me a free use of the hotel gym and facilities. The room is nice with a very cosy bed. Not as big as those at Raffles the Plaza but still very comfortable. The best thing for me is the choice of 16 types of pillow that you can order at the touch of a phone call. Finally able to do away with those horrible down pillows and get a very nice contoured one for my stay. The only thing that makes Conrad not as good as other 5-stars establishment, is perhaps the location. It's a 15 minutes walk to the nearest MRT station (albeit via shopping malls) and you pretty much have to use the taxi a lot. It's not that bad considered taxis in SG is not that expensive. All in all, I would say Conrad is good value for the money. I have already booked another trip there in Sept and am really looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Almost fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Ratio3533
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Conrad Singapore. All in all it was a great trip and I would have given this hotel 5 stars but for 2 aspects: (1) The phone system in the room did not work - calls came through but confusingly on 2 separate lines, voicemails were left for me but no light ever came on to indicate this (there is a designated red light on each of the 2 phones to show messages). This caused me a lot of confusion and stress as I had to keep calling down to the lobby to see if any messages had come for me. I ended up missing a few friends' calls and hence did not get to meet them on this trip. (2) For some reason this is the only hotel in Asia that I have stayed at (of the 5 star variety) that did not have a steam/sauna room in the changing rooms/ spa near the pool. Ok, I accept that it is a business hotel, but there were many other family types staying there as well - would have been a great addition. The gym was fantastic and very extensive so this would have helped. Apart from these 2 minor hiccups, the hotel was fabulous. The staff were truly friendly and were great with my baby daughter, giving her alot of attention, toys and one maitre d even carried her off for a few minutes so we could take our breakfast from the buffet! The rooms were clean, fairly large (although nothing beats the Conrads in Bali or Bangkok for sheer size) and good views of Suntec. All in all, I would probably stay here again at least location wise because it was the best located of all the Marina hotels I think - directly attached to a mall, and close to the link to City Hall MRT.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: benders
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Conrad Centennial Hotel in Singapore during May 2007. The hotel came with very good reports fromTrip Advisor and it proved that these were accurate. The room was comfortable, roomy and well laid out. The bathroom was beautifully appointed. The hotel has an impressive lobby area with a lounge bar off to one side. All the staff were polite and friendly. The hotel is adjacent to the SunTec Towers area and a few minutes by taxi to the central City Hall and Cathedral precinct. The price of the room was reasonable and this hotel would suit the business traveller well. I have no hesitation in supporting the many favourable comments made previously about the Conrad in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place & Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Bishan
Reviews.Content: We were at the Conrad for the recent National Day holidays. We have stayed there 6 years ago and we are happy to see that the hotel property has maintained its relevance in terms of maintenance and service, if not exceeding in many aspects. The staff (from reservations, reception, poolside, security) were friendly, never rude, and were forthcoming in assistance. The place was spacious and even it was running full occupancy with the holidays, there was no noise to complain about. It is an excellent hotel if you are on business. If you have young children (like us), you probably need to be a bit careful with the high beds (though you can request for extra cot or fold-up bed for the young ones) and to note there is no kids pool. The executive lounge on the 31st level is a wonderful place to relax too. Perhaps they could improve on some of the food items (we had chicken rice and wanton noodle soup from room service); otherwise the National Day chocolate cake we had was very good. And of course, the rubber duckie and signature Conrad stuff bears were a great momentos for guests and kids to keep and to remind them to return again, and like my 5-year old who adds "soon please".

Reviews.Title: “Service at its peak”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCarlito
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on previous occasions when in Singapore and I must say that their quality of service and product offering has never failed over time. They have consistently impressed me and given the level of service I would expect from a 5 star hotel. The staff always have beaming smiles to greet you, whether they are behind the counter, walking past you in the lobby or opening the elevator for you. The facilities at this venue are excellent. The gym is always in good order, neat and tidy with modern equipment. It never seems to be busy, which is good for me. The pool just outside the gym is also very good for doing laps, as the length is more than 15 metres in length. The rooms are well appointed. Large spacious rooms and big king size beds. You will also find a small Conrad bear on your bed, which makes for good little presents if you have any nieces or nephews. There is always a welcome bowl of fruit and complimentary bottles of water available for you. There is an even larger modern bathroom with fabulous amenities and plush robes for you to use. True comfort after a hard days shopping. And if you're into shopping, there is definitely no shortage of shopping options just in and around the hotel. Marina Square Mall and Suntec City Mall surround this hotel on either side. You can also walk through the underground pasageway to Raffles City, which is also lined with shops. Once you get to Raffles, you will be confronted with more shopping. I would highly recommend this hotel, as your stay will no doubt be comfortable and you will be made to feel a valued guest during the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Drew2
Reviews.Content: In a word this place is amazing. There are always at least 2 people waiting to help you wherever you go in the hotel. The service is so outstanding that no request seems unreasonable to them. We were on the top floor, 31, and had great views of the ocean and Suntec City. The other side of the hotel has the great harbor and city views. Our room was a corner room (non-suite) and it had a little window on the side wall that was not all windows. The rooms are spacious and classy. The pictures on the Conrad site make them look dated and do not do them justice. There is a flatscreen TV with a dvd/radio sound system that is excellent. You can borrow CDs and DVDs from the executive lounge. We had a fresh fruit plate everyday and bottled water, which we really needed in the heat and humidity. The toiletries are Molton Brown and they give you a ton of everything, and the bathroom is huge. It must take up half of the total area in the room. This floor is where the executive lounge is and it is great with a wonderful staff. Food in the lounge is good and there are computers with free internet. This is truly a business hotel, but we were here on holiday and we did not feel as if we were out of place. The breakfast buffet at Oscar’s is really good too. There are staff people everywhere. The buffet has a nice balance of western breakfast items and Asian breakfast items and my favorite, dim sum. The pool area is nice and the gym/spa has a yogilates (yoga/pilates) class out by the pool on Tuesday mornings free for hotel guests, which was a nice way to start the day even in the morning humidity. As for the location of the Conrad, if you want to be close to an MRT stop, then it is about a 15+ minute walk. You can walk almost completely through several shopping malls all the way to City Hall station. If you walked outside, it would probably take less than 15 minutes to walk it. If you want to be near shopping that is not Orchard Rd, this is the place for you. It is across from Suntec, Millenia Walk, and Marina Square. But in Singapore, no matter where you are, there are at least 3 shopping malls in close proximity. There are restaurants across at Millenia Walk and in the other shopping malls. Across the street at Suntec there is a nice indoor food court there. Since we were scheduled to arrive around 1:45am, we splurged and booked the hotel limo, but worth it for us because we had never been to Singapore before and our driver was waiting for us right after baggage claim. After coming from LAX via Tokyo on a 2 hour-delayed flight, we were exhausted and it was nice to be taken care of at 4:00am. All in all, we loved this hotel. We stayed at The Oriental after a side trip to Phuket, and we like the Conrad better. It might help that we are Hilton Diamond members, but there just seemed to be a better vibe for us at the Conrad. Coming back to the Conrad after being out all day felt like coming home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin_Griffiths
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, and always my first choice when I go to Singapore. Nice big open lobby, quality rooms, and great views over the bay. Servce great as you'd expect. Also a nice scattering of restaurants around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great with children”
Reviews.Author: BigMurph
Reviews.Content: Can not fault this hotel. It all started with the great service through the hotel reservations department. Since we were travelling with my 2yo daughter, took the option of spending a little bit more and booked the Centennial Suite. As this is in the business floor area, were whisked to the Executive floor for check in. The room was excellent giving us a separate area for our 2yo (with a cot pre-arranged at no extra charge) while we watched TV on a huge plasma (another plasma is included in the bedroom). A small teddy bear was provided also for our daughter, as well as a little amenities pack which was a nice touch. The hotel staff are very friendly and pleasant and the concierge most knowledgable. Staff treated our daughter like a celebrity almost to the point that we were like her entourage!! Surprised at other comments in respect to this hotel, and almost changed our booking because of it - so glad we didn't. The hotel is clean, well maintained, and provides all of the touches expected of an international hotel. The pool was clean and a decent size. Breakfast was included and caters for all tastes with a good selection. We had dinner at Oscars one night and this also was good value for money in comparision to typical hotel meals/expenses. We found the location well suited for our needs with many shopping areas near-by. Would recommend going to the Carrefour grocery store across from the hotel for snacks, drinks etc (very convenient with the little one requiring milk etc). If you don't mind the heat (or its not raining) would recommend walking to the City Hall MRT as it was less than 5mins (compared to at least 10 underground) and no escalators (at least 5 which is tricky with a stroller). In all, the choice of the suite was a wise choice if you can afford a bit extra, especially if travelling with little ones. This hotel needs to be elevated in rank for Singapore hotels - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Just a little bit ahead of the pack”
Reviews.Author: beijau
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Conrad in the past eight years. It has weathered the years well. Room comfort, amenities, and staff attitude were just enough above run-of-the-mill in Singapore to be noticeable. I enjoy the Marina location for its easy access to my office and other parts of the business district. Importantly, I never had any problem getting a taxi to work in the morning. In my opinion, the Ritz Carlton offers a better quality of stay with a similar location, so go there if money is not an issue. The Four Seasons is a long way away, but also ranks higher in my book for comfort and service. Compared to several other Singapore hotels I have stayed at, though, the Conrad is clearly a solid option. An odd aside: if you like your room service this may not be the place for an extended stay. Although I have every confidence that the staff could be talked into creative meal planning with some additional effort, the room service menu was among the smallest I have ever seen at a top hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rapublico
Reviews.Content: I liked the Conrad. First of all, the staff, from those attending the front-desk, restaurants, pool/spa, up to the baggage handling, all were very helpful and friendly. No one was negative or came off as rude or abrupt. More importantly, the room was quite nice too. I neither found it small nor lacking anything. Everything was clean, in place, and tastefully done, from the daytime service to the nightly turndown. Reading other comments, I was surprised that other guests smelled odd odors and said the rooms were in need of repair and refurbishing. Maybe it depends o the room, but mind was quite a nice one with a view of the Merlion, although quite away in the distance. Our rate included breakfast, which had a wide selection. If included with the room rate, it is well worth it. I've been to quite a few lavish hotel breakfast buffets, but this one was the first to offer homemade ice-creams with all the toppings. They were tempting, but I can only eat so much. It was a nice touch, and definitely a break from the usual. Overall, I have seen better breakfast spreads, but how much do we really need? It is simply fine, with a good array of not only western and Asian foods but also traditional breakfast and brunch selections too. Plus, if you don't like air conditioning (like me), you can sit outside too and enjoy your breakfast, which was a pleasant option. All in all, I cannot find fault with the hotel itself. The only thing that would make it perfect would be to move it a little closer to a major attraction or station. But since this is impossible, it doesn't count as a suggestion for improvement. Anyway, taxis are very reasonable. And since walking is good for me, I was able to walk to the Merlion Park, River Walk, Raffles Hotel, Raffles City Shopping center and City Hall Station. Plus, three big shopping centers are right next door: the Millennium Walk, Suntec City Mall (with Carrefour), and the Marina Square. All in all, the Conrad is convenient enough to see parts of Singapore on foot, while still offering very pleasant hotel accommodations too. I have no reservations in recommending this hotel for a pleasant stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: ausmithglenn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Singapore on two separate occassions on our last Asian trip. The first stay for two nights prompted us to to cancel our stay in the another hotel on our return so we could stay at the Conrad again. The hotel is located in the Marina area. There is a shopping centre and MRT station conveniently located next door to the hotel so getting around the city is a breeze. The check-in process was very smooth and the staff were very courteous (which is pretty much the case anywhere in Singapore). As a gold member of the Hilton Hhonors programme we were upgraded to a business room with free breakfast and late checkout. The rooms had fantastic views the Marina area. The rooms were spacious, fresh and impeccably maintained. We loved the quirky touch of having a cute teddy bear and rubber ducky. The pillow menu featuring 13 different pillow types was also and eccentric touch - we didn't indulge in this particular offering as the bed and pillows provided were more than adequate. The daily fruit platter and box of chocolates (absolutely delicious!) in the room were a nice added touch. We would have absolutely no hesitation in booking a stay at the Conrad when we are next in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_Lloyd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Raffles Plaza for years when in Singapore, so approached my stay here with a little trepidation. I needed not worry, the hotel is exceelent inside. It is not as well located, but next to Suntec and very handy. MRT is 10 mins away and an up/over/under walk, not so good. However, remember Singapore is small so 5 mins walk can change your view of lcoation! My room was clean, well equipped with a side view of the water, and a close up view of rooms in the nearby Pan Pacific, which forces a little discreteness. I will definately stay here again as the staff and service were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mcgahat
Reviews.Content: This property is one of the better in Singapore I think. I like the location even though most people prefer to stay in the Orchard Rd. area if they are on a leisure trip this hotel has some excellent rates on the weekend and you get a top notch hotel. There is a mall next door to the hotel that has some excellent dining options if you dont want to eat at the hotel and there are some dining options in the street in back of the hotel as well. The workout equipment is a bit old but fine for a workout and the pool is large and seems never to be very busy. Service at the hotel is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: tanseaway
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Conrad Singapore during the Xmas holiday season in 2006. The hotel is well located for business travellers - especially anyone attending conventions at the gigantic Suntec City convention centre, which is literally across the road. It is very close to the financial district too. Paulaner Brauhaus - a German-themed microbrewery - is next door for those who need to quench their thirst. Efficient and courteous staff, the hotel ticks all the boxes and there is little to fault. The rooms are starting to look a little dated, but are spacious enough and very clean. Room rates are a relative bargain compared to other 5-star hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: TR45
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Centennial is a very special hotel. It looks from the outside like a typical high rise hotel. Inside, the quality of the service and the room is spectacular. My room faced the Fountain of Wealth. It was a large room with a sumptuous king-size bed. It had a large desk and the entire felt spacious because of high ceilings. The bed and pillows were magnificent and I slept in absolute quiet each night I was there. The bath was clean and enormous. It contained a large soaking tub and a huge glass shower. The bath, and indeed the room, was immaculate. I have only one suggestion for improvement. I had placed a do not disturb sign on my door and usually I leave the room the next morning early enough that I don't need to really do this. But, upon leaving at 9:30 a.m., I found the maid had already been by to attempt to clean the room!!! So, put up that sign and make sure you tell the front desk that you have left and would like your room serviced. To me, the Conrad needs to re-think how early it sends its staff around to service rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: D-holidayLover
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, good service during check-in and out...friendly staffs ask for late check-out until 3pm they just give straight away, is just too perfect....somemore the room is nice will come back again.....

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent”
Reviews.Author: munkypete
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in November 2006. Booked a business room on the 28th floor with executive lounge access. From the moment we arrived we were treated like superior guests. Escorted to the executive lounge for personal check in facilities. After the check in formalities escorted to the room and had all the benefits of the executive floor explained (of which there are many). There was fresh fruit and a small box of chocolates in the room. The room was perfect, well equipped, the bed was very confortable, everything worked, and was spotlessly clean. TV channel selection was poor, but hey if you want to watch TV stay at home! Location is perfect for shopping and the MRT, you can walk to Raffles and the Merlion. The staff in the executive lounge were impeccable, always willing to help and serve. Canapés and drinks are available in the evening. Cakes, scones and tea are available late afternoon. Breakfast is available either in the executive lounge the main restaurant or by the pool. The first day we had breakfast in the lounge the second in the main restaurant. Use the main restaurant is my advice, bigger and better range of food. There is an outdoor pool and a gym. I really couldn't fault this hotel at all, I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but far from perfect”
Reviews.Author: Happytiler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad Singapore for 4 nights in one of their 'Business Rooms'. This entitles you to S$10 daily off laundry, breakfast in a room overlooking the pool, in-room fruit, etc. However, I never got any fruit until I asked for it 3 times! The breakfast is pretty poor and they were always running out of stuff like bacon and eggs. Rooms OK but hardly luxurious - TV was old and channel selection was poor. The bathrooom was a bit dated and the shower was in need of a bit of renovation unless you like a dribble! The location was excellent, however, right in the middle of Marina Square, Millenia Walk and Suntec shopping districts and very easy to walk to the MRT or to get buses into Orchard Road, etc. However there are similar hotels in the vicinity and I would probably opt for staying in one of those rather than the Conrad in future.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as London”
Reviews.Author: S6blr
Reviews.Content: Where to start? I arrived early AM from London, having paid for my room the night before, so I could check in at 0700 in the morning. First off was that "we're sorry, we used your room -- you'll have to have a room with twin beds" wasn't a good omen. Second was that the TV would randomly change to B&W from Colour, and that the remote didn't work -- poor QA/attention to detail. Third, when you're seriously jetlagged, you don't need the nightly turndown staff showing at 2100 when you've already gone to bed. The restaurant Oscar's is very so-so, and most food on offer the evening I had dinner were only lukewarm, and the sushi on buffet had seen better hours. There is a VERY GOOD feature, the spa at this Conrad. They offer a 2 HOUR massage called the "Jet-lag Special" which is a combination of deep-tissue, foot and head/aromatherapy massage that is UNQUESTIONABLY the best massage I've ever had in 46 years! Next time, even though this hotel is right next to my company's Singapore office, I will stay at the Pan-Pacific, Raffles, or Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LakeOswegoMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a week at the Conrad Singapore and we loved everything about our stay. The room was immaculate and the shower was the best ever. The beds and bedding were so comfortable. The executive floor offered breakfast and afternoon cusine in both asian and western fare. The Chinese restaurant was superb. The hotel staff were friendly and spoke very good English. I can heartly recommend this hotel!

HotelInfo.Name: Conrad Centennial Singapore
HotelInfo.Address: 2 Temasek Blvd, Singapore 038982, Singapore
